{{Skill infobox | name = Disarm Trap | campaign = Nightfall | type = Skill | special = Mission | activation = 2 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. You disable an activated [[Sentry Trap|sentry trap]] before it discharges. You are [[easily interrupted]] while using this skill. | concise description = Skill. You disable an activated sentry trap before it discharges. {{gray|You are easily interrupted.}} | aoe = earshot }}
==Acquisition== This is a temporary skill that can only be obtained and used during the [[Venta Cemetery]] mission. It can be accepted from [[Rojis]] at the start of the mission and will remain on the [[skill bar]] until completion of the mission.
==Notes== *Disarm Trap is used to disarm the [[area of effect]] damage of the Sentry Traps in the mission. *Sentry Traps take 5 seconds to activate, so they are easy to disarm as long as one is careful. This skill has an [[earshot]] range but does not need a [[target]]. *This skill will take up one slot on your [[skill bar]]. In acquiring the skill, you will be asked to choose the skill to replace if your skill bar is full. Make sure to bear this in mind when selecting your build for the mission. **You can replace [[Comfort Animal]] or [[Heal as One]] with this skill and still keep control of your [[pet]].
[[Category:Nightfall PvE-only skills]] [[Category:Easily interrupted skills]] [[Category:Common skills]] [[Category:Mission skills]]
[[de:Falle entschärfen]]

revision.text: {{Skill infobox | id = 1249 | name = Displacement | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Communing | type = Binding Ritual | energy = 15 | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 45 | causes1 = Spirit | causes2 = Block | description = [[Binding Ritual]]. Create a level {{gr|1|14}} [[spirit]]. All non-spirit [[Ally|allies]] within its [[Spirit range|range]] have a 75% chance to [[block]] incoming [[attack]]s. Every time an attack is blocked in this way, this spirit takes 60 [[damage]]. This spirit dies after {{gr|30|60}} seconds. | concise description = Binding Ritual. Creates a level {{gr|1|14}} spirit ({{gr|30|60}} second lifespan). Non-spirit allies within range have 75% chance to block. Block effect: this spirit takes 60 damage. | has-pvp = y }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Communing]] | var1 name = Level | var1 at0 = 1 | var1 at15 = 14 | var2 name = [[Duration]] | var2 at0 = 30 | var2 at15 = 60 | var3 name = [[Block]]s X hits | var3 at0 = 1 | var3 at15 = 5 }} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) == Notes == * This skill creates a [[Spirit of Displacement]]. * Often used with [[Shelter]] and [[Union]] to provide superior [[damage reduction]]. * Since this spirit will usually die very quickly, it is best to use this skill before the fight starts so that when it actually does begin, this skill will be ready to use again. * [[Armor of Unfeeling]] can be used to reduce the damage taken by this spirit due to its effect. {{anomaly|There is a delay of 2-3 seconds from the spirit's creation to its effect being applied, unlike other skills.}} {{bug|The duration bar beneath the [[effects monitor]] [[skill icon]] does not shrink over time like other effects with durations.}} [[Category:Skills that affect allies]] [[de:Verschiebung]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Disrupting Accuracy | id = 1723 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Ranger | attribute = Marksmanship | type = Preparation | energy = 5 | activation = 2 | recharge = 12 | causes1 = Interrupt | description = [[Preparation]]. For 36 seconds, whenever your arrows [[critical hit|critical]], they also [[interrupt]] your [[target]]. | concise description = Preparation. (36 seconds.) Interrupts an [[action]] whenever your arrows critical. }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) *[[Medando]] ([[Yohlon Haven]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])
== Notes == *Despite not scaling with Marksmanship, this skill benefits from the critical rate increase offered by the attribute. *This skill works well with [[Incendiary Arrows]] to interrupt multiple foes. *To increase the frequency of interrupts, consider skills that increase [[attack speed]]. *To increase the reliability to interrupt, consider skills such as [[Dual Shot]], [[Triple Shot]] and [[Forked Arrow]]. Primary [[assassin]]s can utilize the skills [[Way of the Master]] and [[Critical Eye]] to raise their critical chance as well. ** Non-primary assassins may find the effect of these uninvested skills too weak to deserve a skill slot.
[[Category:Essentially unlinked skills]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

revision.comment: This skill does indeed have the same energy cost, activation time, and recharge as D-shot, but being a spell it is unable to be blocked, a noteworthy advantage.

If Distracting Shot hits, it [[interrupt]]s [[target]] [[foe]]'s [[action]] but deals only {{gr|1|16}} [[damage]]. If the interrupted action was a [[skill]], that skill is [[disable]]d for an additional 20 seconds. | concise description = Bow Attack. Interrupts an action. Interruption effect: interrupted skill is disabled for +20 seconds. {{gray|Hits for only {{gr|1|16}} damage.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Expertise]] |var1 name = [[Armor-ignoring damage]] |var1 at0 = 1 |var1 at15 = 16}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Charr Reinforcements]] ([[Piken Square]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Disruption]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Captain Osric]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * Factions ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Gedrel of Ascalon]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) ** [[Kodan]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) ** [[Tyr the Skaald]] (Gunnar's Hold) ** [[Lexx]] ([[Rata Sum]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Disrupting Chop}} * {{skill icon|Disrupting Lunge}} * {{skill icon|Magebane Shot}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * In [[Nightfall]] this skill becomes unlocked after recruiting either [[Margrid the Sly]] or [[Acolyte Jin]], then it can be learned using the [[skill tome]]. * The arrow leaves the bow {{1/4}} seconds into this skill's activation, as [[attack skill]]s hit halfway through their stated [[activation time]]. * This skill has a {{3/4}} second [[aftercast delay]]. * Skills will not be disabled if they are [[easily interrupted]] (including [[Dazed]]) or interrupted by an effect such as [[Choking Gas]] or [[Spinal Shivers]], as those trigger before Distracting Shot takes effect. * Distracting Shot will not disable a skill that is prevented from being interrupted.
== Trivia == * Prior to the [[Game updates/20080529#Bug Fixes 2|May 29, 2008 game update]], this skill received no bonus damage from some preparations.
[[Category:Ranger skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]] [[Category:Skills without known Nightfall trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 284 | name = Divine Boon | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | attribute = Divine Favor | type = Enchantment Spell | energy = 5 | recharge = 10 | activation = {{1/4}} | upkeep = -1 | causes1 = Healing | causes2 = Energy Loss | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. While you maintain this enchantment, whenever you cast a [[Protection Prayers|Protection Prayer]] {{sic|should be Protection Prayers}} or [[Divine Favor]] [[spell]] that [[target]]s an [[ally]], that ally is [[heal]]ed for {{gr|15|60}} [[Health]], and you lose 1 [[Energy]]. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. Whenever you cast a Protection Prayer {{sic}} or Divine Favor spell on an ally, that ally is healed for {{gr|15|60}}. {{gray|Heal cost: you lose 1 Energy.}} | target = self }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Divine Favor]] |var1 name = [[Heal]]ing |var1 at0 = 15 |var1 at15 = 60}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[The Wayward Monk]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Firstwatch Sergio]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) ** [[Captain Greywind]] ([[North Kryta Province]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Masaharu]] ([[Seitung Harbor]]) ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) ** [[Yokuni]] ([[Maatu Keep]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * Nightfall ** [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Healer's Boon}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Divine Boon requires strong [[energy management]], since it increases skill costs and decreases natural regeneration. * Unlike the Divine Favor bonus, [[Target#Untargeted_skills|untargeted skills]] will neither heal the caster, nor cause the energy loss. * Divine Boon's healing ''always'' takes effect first, before the effects of the spell that triggered it. For example, its healing will occur before [[Zealous Benediction]] checks its target's health. When using [[Mend Condition]] to remove a [[Deep Wound]], Divine Boon's healing is still reduced by the Deep Wound.
[[Category:Upkeep skills]]
== Trivia == * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Divine Boon/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[Category:Monk skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

Send out a [[projectile]] that kills [[target]] [[foe]] if it hits. | concise description = Skill. Projectile: kills target foe if it hits. }}

== Trivia == * This skill is akin to the ball in [[w:Dodgeball|dodgeball]].

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1133 | name = Drunken Blow | campaign = Factions | profession = Warrior | attribute = Tactics | type = Melee Attack | special = Duplicate | energy = 5 | duplicate = yes | recharge = 7 | causes1 = Deep Wound | causes2 = Weakness | causes3 = Bleeding | causes4 = Crippled | causes5 = Knockdown | description = [[Melee Attack]]. If this [[attack]] hits, you strike for +{{gr|10|40|}} [[damage]] and your [[target]] suffers from one of the following [[condition]]s: [[Deep Wound]] (for 20 seconds), [[Weakness]] (for 20 seconds), [[Bleeding]] (for 25 seconds), or [[Crippled]] (for 15 seconds). After making a Drunken Blow, you are [[knock down|knocked down]]. | concise description = Melee Attack. Deals +{{gr|10|40}} damage. Inflicts one of the following random conditions: Deep Wound (20 seconds), Weakness (20 seconds), Bleeding (25 seconds), or Crippled (15 seconds). {{gray|You are knocked-down.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Tactics]] |var1 name = + [[Damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 40}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Skill Chaining]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Desperation Blow}} ([[duplicate skill]])
== Notes == * Could be combined with [["I Meant to Do That!"]]. * Consider using with [[Steady Stance]] or [[Balanced Stance]] to bypass the knock down penalty. * This skill will only knock you down if it hits. * Contrary to [[Grapple]], [[Stonefist Insignia]] does not prolong the time you are knocked down. * If this attack hits multiple targets by using a [[scythe]], the conditions are applied separately. You are also knocked down separately for each hit, which matters if preventing knock downs.
== Trivia == * The effects resemble the Drunken fist martial art where becoming unbalanced and falling down is incorporated into attacks. * The warrior in [[:File:Drunken Blow (large).jpg|the icon]] wears an armor combination of an [[Warrior Elite Dragon armor|Elite Dragon Hauberk]], [[Warrior Platemail armor|Platemail Gauntlets]] and [[Warrior Kurzick armor|Kurzick Leggings]].
[[Category:Warrior skill rewards]]
[[de:Betrunkener Schlag]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 2218 | name = Drunken Master | campaign = Eye of the North | attribute = Deldrimor rank | type = Stance | recharge = 60 | energy = 5 | pve-only = y | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | causes2 = Increased Attack Speed | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr2|72|90}} seconds, your [[movement speed|movement]] and [[attack speed|attack]] speeds are increased by {{gr2|10|15}}%. If you are [[drunk]] while activating this skill, your movement and attack speeds are increased by {{gr2|25|33}}% instead. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr2|72|90}} seconds.) You move and attack {{gr2|10|15}}% faster if you are not drunk. You move and attack {{gr2|25|33}}% faster if you are drunk. }}
{{Skill progression max10 |title track = [[Deldrimor rank]] |var1 name = Duration |var1 at0 = 72 |var1 at10 = 90 |var2 name = Speed increase % (if sober) |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at10 = 15 |var3 name = Speed increase % (if [[drunk]]) |var3 at0 = 25 |var3 at10 = 33 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill quest]]s''' *[[Deeprunner's Map]] ([[Umbral Grotto]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Onslaught}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Primal Rage}} (elite) *{{skill icon|Rampage as One}} (elite)
== Notes == * You cannot use this skill without being at least [[Deldrimor rank]] 1, because it is awarded along with 1,500 reputation points. *If you would like to have the added benefits of Drunken Master ''without'' the screen effects of being drunk open the game options menu and on the graphics tab uncheck "Enable post process effects". *The use of one 1 point [[alcohol]] just before you activate the skill is enough to trigger the bonus effects.
== Trivia == * The skill animation differs depending on whether you are drunk when you activate it: ** If sober, the ring and keg will appear; ** If drunk, a ''wobbling'' keg (looking like a [[Keg of Aged Hunter's Ale]]) will appear briefly, followed by the standard animation. * The skill's name is a reference to the film ''[[W:Drunken Master|Drunken Master]]'' and its [[W:Drunken Master II|sequel]] ([http://wiki.guildwars.com/index.php?title=User_talk:Emily_Diehl/Trivia_archive_2&oldid=671332#reference.3F source]), which are based upon the kung fu styles known colloquially as [[W:Zui Quan|drunken boxing]].
[[Category:References to films & tv series]]

{{skill infobox | name = Drunken Stumbling | id = 3166 | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Monster | type = Stance | adrenaline = 4 | special = Monster | description = [[Stance]]. For 10 seconds, you [[Attack speed|attack 33% faster]] and cannot be [[Knock down|knocked down]]. Whenever you would be knocked down, you gain 1 [[adrenaline]] and all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s take 50 [[damage]]. | concise description = Stance. (10 seconds.) You attack 33% faster and cannot be knocked down. If hit with a knockdown, you gain 1 adrenaline and adjacent foes take 50 damage. | aoe = adjacent }}
==Related skills== * {{skill icon|"Brace Yourself!"}} * {{skill icon|Steady Stance}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *This skill is only used by [[Dian Fermati]].
[[Category:War in Kryta skills]]
[[de:Betrunkenes Torkeln]]

{{skill infobox |name = Dryder's Feast |special = Monster |type = Spell |energy = 5 |activation = 1 |recharge = 10 |campaign = Eye of the North |description = Spell. [[Life stealing|Steal]] 30 [[Health]] for each [[hex]] on [[target]] [[foe]]. |concise description = Spell. Steal 30 Health for each hex on target foe. }}
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Feast of Corruption}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *This skill is used by [[Dryder]]s found in [[Depths of Tyria]].
==Trivia== *Before the release, it was named "Dryder's Gaze".
[[de:Dryders Schmaus]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 2213 | name = Ear Bite | campaign = Eye of the North | attribute = Deldrimor rank | type = Touch skill | adrenaline = 4 | activation = {{3/4}} | pve-only = y | target = foes | range = touch | causes1 = Bleeding | causes2 = Piercing Damage | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Target]] [[Touch skill|touched]] [[foe]] takes {{gr2|50|70}} [[piercing damage]] and begins [[Bleeding]] for {{gr2|15|25}} seconds. | concise description = Touch Skill. Deals {{gr2|50|70}} piercing damage and inflicts Bleeding condition ({{gr2|15|25}} seconds). }}
{{Skill progression max10 |title track = [[Deldrimor rank]] |var1 name = [[Piercing damage]] |var1 at0 = 50 |var1 at10 = 70 |var2 name = [[Bleeding]] [[duration]] |var2 at0 = 15 |var2 at10 = 25 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill quest]]s''' *[[The Throwdown in a Norn Town]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]])
==Notes== * Ear Bite is a touch skill, not an [[attack]]. Therefore, you gain no [[adrenaline]] after use. * The damage dealt is [[Armor-ignoring damage|armor-ignoring]].
==Trivia== * The name of this skill most likely refers to an incident in a boxing match in which [[W:Holyfield-Tyson II|Mike Tyson bit Evander Holyfield in both ears]] (and bit a piece of one off) and ended up being disqualified from the fight, and banned from the sport for a time period. * It appears that the model used in the [[skill icon]] is a male Monk in [[Monk Tyrian armor]].
[[Category:Touch skills]]
[[de:Ohrenbiss]]

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 354 | name = Earth Shaker | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Warrior | attribute = Hammer Mastery | type = Hammer Attack | elite = y | adrenaline = 8 | aoe = adjacent | target = foes | pbaoe = self | causes1 = Knockdown | description = [[Elite]] [[Hammer Attack]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] and all [[adjacent]] foes are [[Knock down|knocked down]]. (50% [[fail]]ure chance with [[Hammer Mastery]] 4 or less.) | concise description = Elite Hammer Attack. Knocks down target and adjacent foes. {{gray|50% failure chance unless Hammer Mastery is 5 or more.}} }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Candy Corn Tyrant]] ([[North Kryta Province]], only during [[Evil Residents]] or [[Evil Residents Code: Harmonica]] and requires a [[Mad King's Influence#Norn form|Norn form skill]]) ** [[Kor Stonewrath]] ([[Snake Dance]]) ** [[Carnak the Hungry]] ([[The Black Curtain (War in Kryta)]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Monstrous Afflicted Warrior]] ([[Pongmei Valley]], only during [[Cleansing Pongmei Valley]]; [[Morostav Trail]], only during [[Cleansing Morostav Trail]]) * [[Guild Wars Eye of the North | Eye of the North]] ** [[Jormungand]] ([[Norrhart Domains]], [[Bjora Marches]], [[Drakkar Lake]], and [[Varajar Fells]]) ** [[Alpha Tyrannus]] ([[Alcazia Tangle]], only during the [[Norn Catering]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Backbreaker}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Devastating Hammer}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Magehunter's Smash}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Yeti Smash}}
== Notes == * Only the target foe is hit with the attack; this skill must hit for the knockdown to take effect. * Target foe and all foes ''adjacent to target foe'' are knocked down.
== Trivia == * This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Earth Shaker/Skill history|skill history]] for details. * [[Devona]] uses this skill in [[pre-Searing]], where only four other elite skills are seen ([[Barrage]], [[Bull's Charge]], [[Hundred Blades]], and [[Ward Against Harm]]). * The animation was changed in the [[Feedback:Game updates/20100225#Warrior|February 25, 2010 game update]].
[[Category:Skills with a failure rate linked to an attribute]]
[[de:Erdrüttler]]

{{skill infobox | name = Earth Vortex | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Monster | special = Monster | type = Attack | adrenaline = 8 | recharge = 30 | description = [[Attack]]. For 30 seconds, all [[foe]]s [[In the area|in this area]] are struck for 15 [[earth damage]] every second. Any foe using a [[skill]] when struck is [[Knock down|knocked down]]. | concise description = Attack. (30 seconds.) Deals 15 earth damage every second to all foes in the area. Any foe using a skill when struck is knocked-down.}} ==Notes== *Used by [[Prophet Varesh]] in the [[Ruins of Morah]].
[[de:Erdstrudel]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 2958 | name = Eastern Health Shrine Bonus | type = Spell | description = [[Spell]]. Your party members' maximum Health is increased by 120. | concise description = Spell. Your party members have +120 maximum Health. }}
==Notes== *Applied to all party members after capturing the [[Eastern Health Shrine]] in [[Plikkup Works]] during [[Costume Brawl]].

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | name = Ebon Hawk | id = 1374 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Earth Magic | type = Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | causes1 = Earth Damage | causes2 = Weakness | description = [[Spell]]. Send a [[Projectile spell|projectile]] that strikes [[target]] [[foe]] for {{gr|10|85}} [[earth damage]] and causes [[Weakness]] for {{gr|5|15}} seconds if it hits. | concise description = Spell. Projectile: deals {{gr|10|85}} earth damage and inflicts Weakness condition ({{gr|5|15}} seconds). | target = foes }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Earth Magic]] | var1 name = [[Earth damage]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 85 | var2 name = [[Weakness]] [[Duration]] | var2 at0 = 5 | var2 at15 = 15}} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) * [[Medando]] ([[Yohlon Haven]]) * [[Resh]] ([[Yahnur Market]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]]) == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Enervating Charge}} == Notes == * This skill can serve as an opener for [[Stoning]] and/or [[Glowstone]]. * Unlike [[Enervating Charge]], [[Weakness]] is applied before calculating damage. == Trivia == * ''[http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Ebon_Hawk Ebon Hawk]'' is the name of the player's ship in the [[w:Star Wars|Star Wars]] computer game [[w:Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic|Knights of the Old Republic]]. *The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Ebon Hawk/Skill history|skill history]] for details. [[Category:Projectile spells]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

For 20 seconds, non-[[spirit]] [[Ally|allies]] [[In the area|in this area]] strike for +15 [[damage]] and gain +24 [[Armor rating|armor]]. | concise description = Ward Spell. (20 seconds.) Allies in this ward deal +15 damage and have +24 more armor. Spirits are unaffected. }}

({{gr|5|20}} seconds.) Inflicts Burning condition ({{gr|1|2}} second[s]) whenever you apply an Elemental hex to a [[target]]. | target = untargeted }}

revision.text: {{Skill infobox | id = 72 | name = Elemental Resistance | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Inspiration Magic | type = Stance | energy = 10 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Increased Armor Rating | causes2 = Decreased Armor Rating | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|30|90}} seconds, You gain +40 [[armor rating|armor]] against [[elemental damage]], but you lose {{gr|24|12}} armor against [[physical damage]]. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|30|90}} seconds.) You have +40 armor against elemental damage. {{gray|You have {{gr|24|12|-}} armor against physical damage.}} }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Inspiration Magic]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 30 |var1 at15 = 90 |var2 name = - [[Armor rating|Armor]] against [[physical damage]] |var2 at0 = 24 |var2 at15 = 12}} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[The Forgotten Ones]] ([[Destiny's Gorge]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Bartoch]] ([[Droknar's Forge]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Mantra of Earth}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Flame}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Frost}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Lightning}} * {{skill icon|Physical Resistance}} == Notes == * [[Greater Conflagration]] or [[Stone Striker]] can be used to eliminate the downside of this skill. * [[Hero]]es do not maintain this stance and rarely use it, so it may require micromanagement. This differs from the otherwise similar stances [[Mantra of Flame]], [[Mantra of Frost]], [[Mantra of Earth]], and [[Mantra of Lightning]], which are all maintained permanently by heroes and hence easier to use against elemental damage. {{bug|Similar to [[Cracked Armor]], this skill will not lower your armor rating below 60 or your [[List of armor effects by category#Equipment|"core" armor]] rating, if your "core" armor rating is lower than 60.}} {{bug|If you use a skill or combination of skills and effects that, after subtraction of the penalty from Elemental Resistance, still grants +26 or more armor rating against physical damage, Elemental Resistance's armor penalty does not function. See also [[armor calculation]].}} [[Category:Mesmer skill rewards]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Elemental Shift | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Monster | special = Monster | type = Form | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 30 | description = [[Form]]. Creature becomes attuned to a different element. | concise description = [[Form]]. Creature becomes attuned to a different element.}}
==Notes== *This [[skill]] is used by [[Chromatic Drake]]s in order to switch between their four skill sets. **There is a different version of this skill for each skill set. *Upon use, [[energy]] and [[overcast]] values are reset to full and none respectively and the newly obtained skill bar is [[recharge time|recharged]]. **The different versions of this skill allow the user to switch between elements as soon as the new skill set appears. **Used versions of Elemental Shift themselves are not recharged. If the user successfully cycles through all four unique skill sets within the 30 seconds recharge time, they will have to wait for the recharge to finish on the next skill set. *During a short-term [[bug]] with [[Simple Thievery]] which allowed players to use [[monster skill]]s, this skill would turn the player into a [[drake]] and set their maximum energy to 80. The effect wore off after [[Zone#Zoning|zoning]].
==Trivia== *[[Elementalist]]s in ''[[Guild Wars 2]]'' have a [[profession]] mechanic similar to this skill.
[[de:Elementare Veränderung]]

{{skill infobox | id = 3177, 3178 | name = Elite Regeneration | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) }}
==Notes== * This [[skill]] is an always active, unseen [[buff]]. It cannot be prevented or [[disable]]d.

revision.comment: /* Notes */ removing some not very important notes. And phantom pain is not exactly perfectly countered since illusion mesmers will run fragility
revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 1126 | name = Empathic Removal | campaign = Factions | profession = Monk | type = Spell | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 7 | elite = yes | target = other allies | causes1 = Healing | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. You and [[target]] other [[ally]] lose 1 [[condition]] and 1 [[hex]], and are [[heal]]ed for 50. | concise description = Elite Spell. Removes one condition and hex from target ally and yourself, and heals for 50. {{gray|Cannot self-target.}} | removes1 = Condition | removes2 = Hex spell }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Byzzr Wingmender]] ([[Melandru's Hope]])
== Related skills == {{see|Doublecast skill}} * {{skill icon|Blessed Light}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Divert Hexes}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Signet of Removal}} (elite)
== Notes == * This skill removes a hex, removes a condition, and then heals. * [[Hero]]es use this skill properly, using it to cleanse themselves whether the target or themselves are afflicted. ** AI will just use this spell on allies for its healing aspect. *The self healing and condition removal can help with skills with [[health sacrifice]] or [[Condition#Skills_which_inflict_conditions_on_oneself|that inflict conditions on oneself]].
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
{{anomaly|Unlike other healing skills, this spell can target [[spirit|spirits]] to remove [[burning]]. However, Empathic Removal will not heal the spirits.}}
[[de:Ausdrückliche Entfernung]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 1541 | name = Enchanted Haste | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Dervish | type = Flash Enchantment Spell | energy = 10 | recharge = 15 | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | description = [[Flash Enchantment Spell]]. For 7 seconds, you [[Speed boost|move 25% faster]]. If this [[enchantment]] ends prematurely, you lose 1 [[condition]]. | concise description = Flash Enchantment Spell. (7 seconds). You move 25% faster. Lose 1 condition if this enchantment ends prematurely. | removes1 = Condition }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) *[[Baram]] ([[The Kodash Bazaar]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Pikin]] (Kamadan, Jewel of Istan)

==Notes== * This skill increases average speed by 11.67% if used every time it recharges. * This can be maintained indefinitely with [[Extend Enchantments]] at Mysticism 11 (or 9 when using a 20% [[of Enchanting]] weapon).
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.

{{skill infobox | name = Enchantment Collapse | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | type = Hex spell | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | description = [[Hex Spell]]. Each time [[target]] [[foe]] loses an [[enchantment]], that foe loses all enchantments. | concise description = Hex Spell. Target foe loses all enchantments each time this foe loses an enchantment.}} ==Notes== *Used by [[Prophet Varesh]] in the [[Ruins of Morah]] mission. *This hex spell has an infinite [[duration]] and will only end upon [[death]] or by [[List of hex removal skills|hex removal]]. *This also takes effect when the duration of an enchantment ends. * [[Inspired Hex]] and [[Revealed Hex]] are particularly effective at removing this, since they will recharge instantly when used on monster skills.
[[de:Verzauberungszerfall]]

{{skill infobox | name = Enemies Must Die! | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | profession = Monster | type = Shout | energy = 5 | recharge = 20 | description = [[Shout]]. For 10 seconds, all of Varesh's allies gain [[target]] enemy as a priority target. | concise description = Shout. (10 seconds.) All of Varesh's allies gain target enemy as a priority target.}} ==Notes== *Used by [[Commander Varesh]] in the [[Ruins of Morah]] mission. *Varesh appears to use this skill when a [[foe]] is below 50% [[health]]. *Notably, this skill does not directly influence the battle, and only changes the [[AI]] behavior of foes. {{Anomaly|This skill's name is missing quotation marks which most shouts have.}}
[[de:Feinde müssen sterben!]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 474 | name = Energizing Wind | campaign = Core | profession = Ranger | attribute = Beast Mastery | type = Nature Ritual | energy = 15 | activation = 5 | recharge = 60 | target = | range = | aoe = spirit | causes1 = Spirit | causes2 = Decreased Energy Cost | causes3 = Increased Recharge Time | description = [[Nature Ritual]]. Create a level {{gr|1|6}} [[spirit]]. For non-spirit [[creature]]s within its [[Spirit range|range]], all [[skill]]s cost 15 less [[Energy]] (minimum cost 10 Energy), and skills [[recharge]] 25% slower. This spirit dies after {{gr|1|31}} second[s]. | concise description = Nature Ritual. Creates a level {{gr|1|6}} spirit ({{gr|1|31}} second[s] lifespan). Skills cost 15 less energy (minimum cost 10 energy) and recharge 25% slower for creatures in range. Does not affect spirits. }}

== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Guild Wars Prophecies|Prophecies]] ** [[Thengen]] ([[Port Sledge]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Guild Wars Factions|Factions]] ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) ** [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) * [[Guild Wars Nightfall|Nightfall]] ** [[Baram]] ([[The Kodash Bazaar]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * Nightfall ** [[Warden of Whispers (The Kodash Bazaar)|Warden of Whispers]] ([[The Kodash Bazaar]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * Prophecies ** [[Cella the Hooded]] ([[North Kryta Province]]) ** [[Melp the Harpooner]] ([[Watchtower Coast]]) ** [[Tree of Renewal]] ([[D'Alessio Seaboard]]/[[Divinity Coast]]) ** [[Tree of Solitude]] ([[Nebo Terrace]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Quickening Zephyr}} * {{skill icon|Soul Twisting}} (elite)
== Notes == * This skill creates a [[Spirit of Energizing Wind]]. * Can be combined with [[Quickening Zephyr]] to reduce the recharge cost introduced by this skill. * If affected by both Energizing Wind and Quickening Zephyr, 5, 10, and 15 energy skills are cheaper with Energizing Wind applied last, while 25 Energy skills are cheaper if Quickening Zephyr is applied last. * The effects of [[Expertise]] are calculated after the effects of Energizing Wind.
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.

Deals +{{gr|10|40}} damage and causes knockdown if target foe was moving. }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Hammer Mastery]] |var1 name = [[Adrenaline]] gain |var1 at0 = 1 |var1 at15 = 4 |var2 name = + [[Damage]]
(on moving foe) |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 40}} == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Bull's Strike}} * {{skill icon|Mokele Smash}} [[de:Erzürnter Schlag (PvP)]]

Gives you {{gr|1|4}} strike[s] of adrenaline if you hit. Deals +{{gr|10|40}} damage and causes knockdown if target foe was moving. | has-pvp = y }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Hammer Mastery]] |var1 name = [[Adrenaline]] gain |var1 at0 = 1 |var1 at15 = 4 |var2 name = + [[Damage]] (on moving foe) |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 40}} == Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *[[Factions]] **[[Afflicted Guardsman Chun]] ([[Bukdek Byway]], only during [[The Afflicted Guard]]) **[[Drinkmaster Tahnu]] (Bukdek Byway, only during [[The Drunken Master]]) **[[The Afflicted Ako]] ([[Vizunah Square]] and [[Shadow's Passage]]) **[[The Afflicted Maaka]] ([[Unwaking Waters]] and [[The Eternal Grove]]) **[[The Afflicted Tamaya]] ([[Dragon's Throat]]) **[[Tuila the Club]] ([[Shadow's Passage (Winds of Change)]]) **[[Gowan Chobak]] (Shadow's Passage (Winds of Change), after [[A Chance Encounter]]) *[[Eye of the North]] **[[Indestructible Golem]] ([[The Elusive Golemancer]]) == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Bull's Strike}} * {{skill icon|Mokele Smash}} == Notes == * After defeating Drinkmaster Tahnu as part of the quest The Drunken Master, he will walk slowly back towards the [[portal]] to [[Kaineng Center]]. If he does not get stuck on the way there, he will die and players will be able to capture this skill. * Use with [[Auspicious Blow]] for easy [[spam]]ming of this skill. [[de:Erzürnter Schlag]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Enraging Charge | id = 1414 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Warrior | attribute = Strength | type = Stance | energy = 5 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | causes2 = Adrenaline Gain | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|5|15}} seconds, you [[Speed boost|move 25% faster]]. Enraging Charge ends when you successfully strike a [[target]], at which point you gain {{gr|0|3}} strike[s] of [[adrenaline]] if you hit with a [[melee attack]]. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|5|15}} seconds.) You move 25% faster. Gain +{{gr|0|3}} adrenaline on your next melee attack. {{gray|Ends after your next hit.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Strength]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var2 name = [[Adrenaline]] gain |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 15 |var2 at0 = 0 |var2 at15 = 3}}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Nightfall]] **[[Zendeht]] ([[Gate of Torment]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *Nightfall **[[Hoju]] (Gate of Torment)
'''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *Nightfall **[[Bloodback Morrob]] ([[Mehtani Keys]]) **[[Robah Hardback]] ([[The Floodplain of Mahnkelon]]) *[[Eye of the North]] **[[Molotov Rocktail]] ([[Dalada Uplands]]) **[[Lissah the Packleader]] ([[Bjora Marches]]) **[[Mobrin, Lord of the Marsh]] ([[Sparkfly Swamp]])
==Notes== *This stance ends before your next successful hit, so attack skills affected by stances such as [[Standing Slash]] or [[Barbarous Slice]] will not consider you in a stance if they hit.
==Trivia== *The [[Warrior]] displayed on the [[skill icon]] appears to be wearing [[Sunspear armor]] and is also seen on the skill icons of [[Lion's Comfort]], [[Headbutt]] and [[Flail]].
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 78 | name = Epidemic | campaign = Core | profession = Mesmer | type = Spell | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 5 | causes1 = Condition | description = [[Spell]]. Spread all negative [[condition]]s and their remaining [[duration]]s from [[target]] [[foe]] to all foes [[adjacent]] to your target. | concise description = Spell. Conditions on target foe transfer to adjacent foes. | aoe = adjacent | target = foes }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Prophecies]] **[[Taltosh]] ([[Grendich Courthouse]]) **[[Captain Osric]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) **[[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) *[[Factions]] **[[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) **[[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) **[[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]]) *[[Nightfall]] **[[Medando]] ([[Yohlon Haven]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *Nightfall **[[Warden of Whispers (Chantry of Secrets)|Warden of Whispers]] ([[Chantry of Secrets]])

==Notes== *Despite the concise description stating the conditions are transferred to adjacent foes, they are not removed from the target.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 2109 | name = Eternal Aura | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Dervish | attribute = Sunspear rank | pve-only = y | type = Enchantment Spell | energy = 15 | activation = 4 | recharge = 30 | causes1 = Increased Maximum Health | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. You have +100 max [[Health]]. When this enchantment [[End effect|ends]], all [[party]] members [[in the area]] are [[Resurrection|resurrected]] with {{gr2|40|50}}% Health and {{gr2|20|30}}% [[Energy]]. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. You have +100 max Health. End effect: all party members in the area are resurrected with {{gr2|40|50}}% Health and {{gr2|20|30}}% Energy. | aoe = in the area | target = untargeted | pbaoe = self }} {{Skill progression max10 | title track = [[Sunspear rank]] | var1 name = % Health | var1 at0 = 40 | var1 at10 = 50 | var2 name = % Energy | var2 at0 = 20 | var2 at10 = 30 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Pikin]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) *[[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]]) *[[Libeh]] ([[Command Post]])
==Related skills== {{see|Health#Skills}} *{{skill icon|"By Ural's Hammer!"}} *{{skill icon|"We Shall Return!"}} *{{skill icon|Light of Dwayna}} *{{skill icon|Lively Was Naomei}} *{{skill icon|Restoration}} *{{skill icon|Unyielding Aura}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *Has no [[duration]] (this is one of the few [[Upkeep#Skills that last indefinitely without an upkeep|skills that last indefinitely without an upkeep]]). *If ended by the caster's [[death]], this skill also resurrects the caster. *Unlike [[Lively Was Naomei]], Eternal Aura revives instantly and is the only skill that can prevent a [[wipe]]. *Equipping [[List_of_enchantment_removal_skills#On_self|enchantment removal skills]] or [[Teardown#List of teardown skills|teardown skills]] that do not rely on combat will allow the user to resurrect on command. {{bug|This enchantment can be cast while under the effects of [[Frozen Soil]].}}
==Trivia== *The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
==See also== *[[Scroll of Resurrection]]
[[Category:Resurrection skills]] [[Category:Dervish PvE-only skills]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]
[[de:Ewige Aura]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 178 | name = Ether Prodigy | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Energy Storage | type = Enchantment Spell | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | overcast = 10 | causes1 = Energy Regeneration | causes2 = Health Loss | removes1 = Enchantment | description = [[Elite]] [[Enchantment Spell]]. Lose all enchantments. For {{gr|8|20}} seconds, you gain +6 [[Energy regeneration]]. When Ether Prodigy [[End effect|ends]], you [[Health loss|lose]] 2 [[Health]] for each point of [[Energy]] you have. | concise description = Elite Enchantment Spell. ({{gr|8|20}} seconds.) You have +6 Energy regeneration. End effect: lose 2 Health for each point of Energy you have. {{gray|Lose all enchantments.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Energy Storage]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 8 |var1 at15 = 20 |var2 name = [[Energy]] gained |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 40 |var3 name = Energy gain/second<sup>1</sup> |var3 at0 = 0.17 |var3 at15 = 1.17 }} #Without [[overcast]]. Recasting it in a 30 second cycle, so overcast doesn't stack.
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Jyth Sprayburst]] ([[Ring of Fire]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Tyndir Flamecaller]] ([[Cathedral of Flames]], level 2) ** [[Hierophant Burntsoul]] ([[Assault on the Stronghold]]) ** [[Straut Flamebourne]] ([[Sacnoth Valley]], only during [[Fire and Pain]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Aneurysm}} * {{skill icon|Lyssa's Aura}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Spirit Channeling}} (elite)
== Notes == * Re-applying this enchantment while it is active will cause you to lose all enchantments, including this one, thereby triggering the health loss. * Consider [[Glyph of Essence]] or [[Ether Lord]], or a low-energy [[weapon swap]] to hide energy, to counter the health loss.

== Notes == * The energy gain ''does'' trigger upon the death of the hexed foe. *If you cast this skill on a target which an ally has already put Ethereal Burden on, you will gain two [[packet]]s of energy. One for when theirs would have normally ended, and one when yours ends

{{Skill infobox | id = 975 | name = Exhausting Assault | campaign = Factions | profession = Assassin | attribute = Dagger Mastery | type = Dual Attack | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/2}} | recharge = 8 | requires = lead | interrupt = y | target = foes | aoe = none | causes1 = Interrupt | causes2 = Overcast | description = [[Dual Attack]]. Must follow a [[lead attack]]. [[Target]] [[foe]]'s [[action]] is [[interrupt]]ed. If that action was casting a [[spell]], target foe suffers 10 [[Overcast]]. | concise description = Dual Attack. Interrupts an action. Inflicts 10 Overcast if the interrupted action was a spell. {{gray|Must follow a lead attack.}} }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) *[[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) *[[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
==Notes== *Exhausting Assault is the only dual attack skill that doesn't require an [[off-hand attack]] skill to precede it. *This skill will inflict overcast on its target even if the interruption is prevented. *As this is an [[attack skill]], the [[activation time]] is actually {{1/4}} second. *If the target is [[Skill queue|skill queuing]], this attack can interrupt two skills. This way, it is possible to inflict 20 overcast with one attack. *A target [[elementalist]] may actually benefit from the effects of this skill, as some of their [[Overcast#Skills_that_benefit_from_overcast|skills gain additional effects while the caster is overcast]].
[[Category:Essentially unlinked skills]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1173 | name = Exposed Underbelly | campaign = Factions | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = While [[Knock down|on your side]], you take +X [[damage]] when you take damage, where X is twice your [[level]]. | concise description = While [[Knock down|on your side]], you take +X [[damage]] when you take damage, where X is twice your [[level]]. }} == Notes == * This effect is strongly suspected to be applied on [[Siege Turtle]]s when they are hit by [[Juggernaut Toss]], causing them to flip, negating the effects of the [[stance]] [[Turtle Shell]] for its duration and dramatically increasing damage suffered from even minor sources.

{{Skill infobox | id = 2491 | name = False Death | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | campaign = Eye of the North | description = [[Insect]]s have a 25% chance of [[Resurrection|resurrecting]] when [[kill]]ed. Insects are resurrected with 25% [[Health]] and [[Energy]]. | concise description = Insects have a 25% chance of resurrecting when killed. Insects are resurrected with 25% Health and Energy. }}
==Notes== *A constantly active, invisible effect on [[mantid]] insects in the [[Charr Homelands]]. *Resurrection occurs several seconds after [[death]], leading to situations where the mantid may revive itself as your [[party]] is already leaving the vicinity. *This effect can trigger multiple times on the same mantid. *Mantids that are killed more than once do not provide additional [[experience]] or reputation points, and do not refresh kill-based reputation benefits, such as [[Hunt Rampage]]. *Each time a mantid is killed, it leaves behind an exploitable [[corpse]].
==Trivia== *[[Andrew McLeod]] stated that this passive skill "is intended to make them feel more like big insects- you stomp on them, but they still get up and crawl around." [http://wiki.guildwars.com/index.php?title=User_talk:Andrew_McLeod&diff=355606&oldid=353120#Mantis_in_GW:EN]
[[Category:Resurrection skills]]
[[de:Falscher Tod]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 151 | name = Feast of Corruption | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Necromancer | attribute = Curses | type = Spell | elite = y | energy = 15 | activation = 2 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Life Stealing | causes2 = Shadow Damage | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] and all [[adjacent]] foes are struck for {{gr|16|80}} [[shadow damage]]. You [[Life stealing|steal]] up to {{gr|8|40}} [[Health]] from each struck foe who is suffering from a [[hex]]. | concise description = Elite Spell. Deals {{gr|16|80}} damage to target and adjacent foes. Steal {{gr|8|40}} Health from each hexed foe. | aoe = adjacent | target = foes }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Curses]] |var1 name = [[Shadow damage]] |var1 at0 = 16 |var1 at15 = 80 |var2 name = [[Life stealing]] |var2 at0 = 8 |var2 at15 = 40}}
== Acquisition == ; [[Signet of Capture]] * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Maw the Mountain Heart]] ([[Dreadnought's Drift]], [[Grenth's Footprint]], [[Lornar's Pass]], [[Mineral Springs]], [[Snake Dance]], [[Spearhead Peak]], and [[Talus Chute]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Apep, Unending Night]] (during [[Raid on Kaineng Center]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Ravenous Gaze}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Consider combining with hex spells that hexes foes in an [[area of effect]], such as [[Reckless Haste]] or [[Suffering]]. * If your target dies while you are casting Feast of Corruption, the spell will not [[fail]]. * You cannot capture this skill from four prominent foes that use it: ** [[Rotscale]], [[Selvetarm]], and [[Fendi Nin]] are [[boss-like foe]]s; you can only capture skills from bosses. ** The death of the [[Inscribed Guardian]] at the end of [[Finding the Bloodstone]] triggers a [[cinematic]], leaving no time to capture the skill.
[[Category:Armor-ignoring damage]]
[[de:Schmaus der Verdorbenheit]]

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Flurry of Splinters | id= 3075 | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Monster | type = Bow Attack | energy = 15 | activation = 2 | recharge = 10 | description=
[[Bow Attack]]. A flurry of Bone Splinters shoots out, hitting [[target]] [[foe]] and up to 5 foes in [[longbow]] range for 35 [[damage]] per hit over 3 seconds. The Bone Splinters seem to penetrate all defenses. | concise description = Bow Attack. A flurry of Bone Splinters shoots out, hitting target foe and up to 5 foes in longbow range for 35 damage per hit over 3 seconds. The Bone Splinters seem to penetrate all defenses. }}
==Notes== * The [[activation time]] is actually 1 second, since this is an [[attack skill]]. * The attack damage for this skill is always 0. * This skill is used only by [[Skeleton of Dhuum|Skeletons of Dhuum]]. * ''The Bone Splinters seem to penetrate all defenses'' should be taken literally; [[prot]]ective and [[block]]ing skills have no effect against this skill. * This attack can still be [[Line of sight|dodged or obstructed]]. * If the projectile fails to hit, the animation will still take place but the damage will not be dealt to any [[creature]]s in range.
[[de:Splitterschauer]]

== Trivia == * The amount of damage, 1,337, is a reference to [[Wikipedia:Leet|leetspeak]]'s way of writing "leet", meaning "elite".

{{Skill infobox | id = 19 | name = Fragility | campaign = Core | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Illusion Magic | type = Hex Spell | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | has-pvp = y | description = [[Hex Spell]]. For {{gr|8|20}} seconds, [[target]] and [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s take {{gr|5|20}} [[damage]] each time they suffer or recover from a new [[condition]]. | concise description = Hex Spell. Also hexes foes adjacent to target ({{gr|8|20}} seconds). These foes take {{gr|5|20}} damage each time they gain or lose a condition. | aoe = adjacent }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Illusion Magic]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 8 |var1 at15 = 20 |var2 name = [[Damage]] |var2 at0 = 5 |var2 at15 = 20}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[The Stone Summit Champion]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Firstwatch Sergio]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) ** [[Xu Fengxia]] ([[Ran Musu Gardens]]) ** [[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])
== Notes == * Fragility deals no damage upon reapplying a condition. ** It's best to keep conditions on the target ''almost'' non-stop, letting conditions expire and directly afterwards re-apply the condition again. * [[Shockwave]] and [[Virulence]] can apply three conditions in one skill. * Synergizes well with [[Avatar of Balthazar]] and [[Reap Impurities]] in dealing large amounts of damage over a short period of time. * With enough conditions, [[Epidemic]], [[Crystal Wave]] or [[Hypochondria]] can cause a massive [[AoE]] [[spike]].
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
==See also== * [[Condition#Ability to inflict conditions|Ability to inflict conditions]] * [[:Category:Skills that cause Condition|Skills that cause conditions]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 200 | name = Glyph of Lesser Energy | campaign = Core | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Energy Storage | type = Glyph | energy = 5 | recharge = 30 | activation = 1 | target = self | range = | aoe = | causes1 = Decreased Energy Cost | causes2 = | removes1 = | requires1 = | description = [[Glyph]]. For the next 15 seconds, your next 2 [[spell]]s cost {{gr|10|18}} less [[Energy]] to cast. | concise description = Glyph. (15 seconds.) Your next 2 spells cost {{gr|10|18}} less Energy. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Energy Storage]] | var1 name = [[Energy]] reduction | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 18}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[The Elementalist Experiment]] ([[Wizard's Folly]] - [[Ascalon (pre-Searing)|pre-Searing]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Skill Chaining]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Halbrik]] ([[Ascalon City (outpost)|Ascalon City]] - pre-Searing) ** [[Sir Bertran]] ([[Ascalon City]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * Factions ** [[Masaharu]] ([[Seitung Harbor]]) ** [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Gedrel of Ascalon]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) ** [[Kodan]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) ** [[Tyr the Skaald]] (Gunnar's Hold) ** [[Lexx]] ([[Rata Sum]]) '''[[Profession changer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Cembrien]] ([[Heroes' Audience]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Glyph of Energy}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == {{Hero|[[Hero behavior]] they will ignore spells that cost only 5{{energy}} in favor of those costing 15{{energy}} or more after invoking a Glyph of Lesser Energy. Consequently, be careful in crafting hero skill bars that make use of this skill.}} * While the Glyph is active, the [[AI]] prioritizes skill usage based on energy costs: ** [[NPC]]s will favor skills that cost more energy over cheaper ones of more immediate benefit. For example, [[Monk]]s are more likely to cast [[Healing Seed]] (cost: 10{{energy}}) before [[Healing Light]] (cost: 5{{energy}}) on a near-death ally. * Charges are used up when casting begins, i.e. a [[cancel]]led or [[interrupt]]ed spell will consume one charge. * Using an attack skill cancels the glyph.
== Trivia ==
* Before [[game updates/20080306|March 6th, 2008]], cancelled spells did not use up a charge.
[[Category:Elementalist skill rewards]] [[Category:Ascalon (pre-Searing) skills]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]] [[Category:Skills without known Nightfall trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 203 | name = Glyph of Renewal | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Elementalist | type = Glyph | energy = 5 | recharge = 10 | activation = 1 | elite = y | causes1 = Recharge | description = [[Elite]] [[Glyph]]. For 15 seconds, your next [[spell]] instantly [[recharge]]s. | concise description = Elite Glyph. (15 seconds.) Your next spell recharges instantly. }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Nayl Klaw Tuthan]] ([[Perdition Rock]])
== Notes == * The instant recharge provided by Glyph of Renewal overrides the effects of [[Diversion]] and [[Auspicious Incantation]]. * The instant recharge will occur even if the spell is [[interrupt]]ed.
[[de:Glyphe der Erneuerung]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 2013 | name = Grenth's Aura | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Dervish | attribute = Wind Prayers | type = Flash Enchantment Spell | energy = 10 | recharge = 10 | causes1 = Life Stealing | description = [[Flash Enchantment]] [[Spell]]. For 20 seconds, you deal {{gr|5|25}} less [[damage]] and steal {{gr|5|25}} [[Health]] whenever you hit with a [[scythe attack]]. When you cast this enchantment you steal {{gr|5|25}} Health from all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. | concise description = Flash Enchantment Spell. (20 seconds.) You deal {{gr|5|25}} less damage and steal {{gr|5|25}} Health when you hit with a scythe. Initial effect: steal {{gr|5|25}} Health from all adjacent foes. | aoe = adjacent | target = untargeted | pbaoe = self }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Wind Prayers]] |var1 name = [[Life stealing]] and [[damage reduction]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 25}} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Micah Fergson]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) *[[Sida]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) *[[Ybbob]] ([[Rata Sum]]) == Related skills == *{{skill icon|Avatar of Grenth}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Mystic Vigor}} *{{skill icon|Nightmare Weapon}} == Notes == * Combines well with [[Nightmare Weapon]] to cause a large life stealing [[spike]] on your [[target]]. * The amount of Life stealing isn't affected by the damage you would have dealt. ** This skill can be used to attack efficiently with a scythe even with no investment in [[Scythe Mastery]]. {{bug|If a [[Ranged attack|ranged]] weapon is swapped for a scythe after the attack was made and before the projectile hit, Grenth's Aura will count this projectile hit as a scythe hit.}} == Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details. [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 86 | name = Grenth's Balance | campaign = Core | profession = Necromancer | type = Spell | elite = yes | energy = 10 | recharge = 10 | activation = {{1/4}} | causes1 = Health Gain | causes2 = Health Loss | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. If [[target]] [[foe]] has more [[Health]] than you, you [[Health gain|gain]] half the difference (up to your maximum Health), and that foe [[Health loss|loses]] an equal amount. If this foe has less Health than you, you lose half the difference, and that foe gains an equal amount. | concise description = Elite Spell. You gain Health equal to half the difference between you and target, and this foe loses an equal amount. {{gray|If this foe has less Health than you, you lose Health equal to half the difference.}} }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Facet of Darkness]] ([[The Dragon's Lair]]) ** [[Mragga]] ([[Frozen Forest]], during [[The Hero's Challenge]]) ** [[Grentchus Magnus]] ([[Nebo Terrace]], during [[The Greatest Snowman Ever Made]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Kuonghsang]] ([[Nahpui Quarter]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Armind the Balancer]] ([[Bahdok Caverns]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Facet of Death]] ([[Sparkfly Swamp]] during [[The Cipher of Grenth]] and [[Varajar Fells]] during [[The Path to Revelations]])
== Notes == * Grenth's Balance is most effective when: ** The target has as much health as possible ''and'' ** The caster has a high maximum health, but is left with very little actual health.
* Effects that cause spell casting to inflict health loss or gain (e.g. [[Backfire]], [[Vigorous Spirit]]) trigger ''before'' this skill checks the caster's health. ** If that effect brings the caster's health to zero, then Grenth's Balance still causes the target to lose health, but the caster dies before they can gain any health. * The [[AI]] uses Grenth's Balance properly, prioritizing high health targets.
{{anomaly|The concise description omits the fact that your health gain (and your target's health loss) is capped by your maximum health.}}
== Trivia == * This skill was named "Charon's Balance" during the beta ([http://wiki.guildwars.com/index.php?title=User_talk:Emily_Diehl/Trivia_archive_2&oldid=571864#Grenth.27s_Balance source]). [[W:Charon (mythology)|Charon]] refers to the ferryman of the dead in Greek mythology.
[[de:Grenths Ausgleich]] [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs]]

{{skill infobox | id = 2090 | name = Ground Cover | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = [[Creature]] has 50% chance to [[block]] [[attack]] {{sic}} while [[Movement|moving]]. | concise description = Creature has 50% chance to block attack {{sic}} while moving. }}
==Notes== * This [[skill]] is an always active, unseen [[buff]]. It cannot be prevented or [[disable]]d. * Used by [[Mandragor]]s in [[Far Shiverpeaks]] and [[Charr Homelands]].

({{gr|10|55}} seconds.) Healing Prayers spells cast 50% faster and heal for 50% more. }}

==Notes== * Does not increase the [[Divine Favor]] healing bonus. Even though healing done by enchantments is not normally enhanced, [[Patient Spirit]] is. For details, see [[Heal#Healing modifiers|healing modifiers]]. * Since the duration of Healer's Boon is the same as its recharge time with no attribute rank in Divine Favor, it proves usable by secondary monk healers as long as energy permits. * Its faster activation effect [[Effect stacking|stacks]] with [[Fast Casting]], as long as the Healing Prayers spell's original casting time is 2 seconds or longer.
== Trivia == * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Healer's Boon/Skill history|skill history]] for details.

{{Skill infobox | id = 1571 | name = Hexbreaker Aria | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Paragon | type = Chant | adrenaline = 8 | activation = 2 | description = [[Chant]]. For 10 seconds, the next time each [[ally]] within [[earshot]] casts a [[spell]], that ally loses 1 [[hex]]. | concise description = Chant. (10 seconds.) Allies in earshot lose one hex with their next spell. | removes1 = Hex spell }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) * [[Rohmen]] ([[Jokanur Diggings (outpost)|Jokanur Diggings]]) * [[Medando]] ([[Yohlon Haven]]) * [[Resh]] ([[Yahnur Market]]) * [[Zendeht]] ([[Gate of Torment]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]''' * [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])
==Notes== *As with other hex removals, hexes that trigger on spell use will trigger before being removed.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]] [[Category:Skills that affect allies]]

{{skill infobox | id = 1008 | name = Hidden Rock | special = Snow fighting | campaign = Core | type = Glyph | activation = 2 | recharge = 10 | causes1 = Dazed | causes2 = Knockdown | description = [[Glyph]]. Your next snowball knocks down target [[foe]] and causes [[Daze]] for 10 seconds. | concise description = Glyph. Your next snowball causes knock-down and inflicts Dazed (10 seconds.) }}
== Acquisition == This skill is given to all players in [[Dwayna Vs Grenth]] and [[The Great Snowball Fight of the Gods (PvP)|The Great Snowball Fight of the Gods]] matches, as well as in repeatable [[Wintersday]] quests.
== Notes == * This skill is only available to players during Wintersday events. * This skill is used by [[Grentch (summon)|Grentch]] and [[Snowman (summon)|Snowman]] from summoning stones. * In the [[Secret Lair of the Snowmen]], this will activate on contact, whether by Snowball or regular attack.
[[de:Versteckter Stein]]

{{skill infobox | id = 1011 | name = Holiday Blues | profession = Necromancer | campaign = Core | type = Spell | special = Snow fighting | activation = 1 | recharge = 45 | sacrifice = 50% | description = [[Spell]]. [[Sacrifice]] 50% maximum [[Health]]. All [[nearby]] [[foe]]s take 50 [[damage]], and you bring the Holiday Blues to this location. For 30 seconds, foes [[in the area|within the area]] suffer -15 [[Health degeneration]]. | concise description = Spell. Deals 50 damage to nearby foes. Foes within the area have -15 Health degeneration (30 seconds). | aoe = in the area | target = self | causes1 = Health Degeneration }}
== Acquisition == This skill is given to Necromancers under the [[Yuletide]] disguise, i.e. those competing in [[Dwayna Vs Grenth]] or various [[Wintersday]] quests.
== Notes == * This skill has the highest [[sacrifice]] cost of any player skill. * [[Health degeneration]] is capped at -10, so the additional degeneration can negate the effects of the only Yuletide regeneration skill, [[Ice Breaker]].
== Trivia == * The animation of its [[area of effect]] resembles a [[well spell]]. * Before [[Wintersday 2009]], the sacrifice cost of this skill was 100% (which prevented NPCs from using it at all).
[[Category:Skills with nearby AoE]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 309 | name = Holy Veil | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | type = Enchantment Spell | upkeep = -1 | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 12 | causes1 = Increased Activation Time | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. While you [[Upkeep|maintain]] this enchantment, any [[Hex spell|hex]] cast on [[target]] [[ally]] takes twice as long to [[Activation time|cast]]. When Holy Veil ends, one hex is removed from target ally. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. Doubles casting time of hexes cast on target ally. End effect: removes a hex. | removes1 = Hex spell | target = allies }} [[Image:Holy Veil Beta Icon.jpg|thumb|64px|Beta [[skill icon]]]]
== Acquisition == ===[[Unlock]] and learn=== '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[The Undead Hordes]] ([[Beetletun]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Sorim]] ([[Quarrel Falls]]) ** [[Master Scout Kiera]] ([[Henge of Denravi]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Dau]] ([[The Mouth of Torment]])
===Unlock only=== ; [[Hero]]es * [[Eye of the North]] ** Unlocking [[Ogden Stonehealer]]
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Nature's Renewal}} * {{Skill Icon|Purifying Veil}}
== Notes == * This spell is often utilized by Monks in [[PvP]] using a technique called [[pre-veil]]ing. * Recasting this spell on a target on which it is still active will not remove a hex. * [[Hero]]es use Holy Veil effectively to remove hexes as they immediately stop maintaining this enchantment. * The [[foe]] [[AI]] (e.g. [[Juniper Bark]]s) will continue to maintain Holy Veil when they are hexed and will not stop maintaining it to remove a hex.
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Monk skill rewards]]

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 381 | name = Hundred Blades | campaign = Core | profession = Warrior | attribute = Swordsmanship | type = Skill | elite = y | energy = 5 | recharge = 25 | aoe = adjacent | target = untargeted | pbaoe = self | requires1 = Sword | causes1 = Slashing Damage | description = [[Elite]] [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 15 seconds, whenever you [[attack]] with a [[sword]], all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s take {{gr|10|25}} [[slashing damage]]. | concise description = Elite Skill. (15 seconds.) Deals {{gr|10|25}} slashing damage to all adjacent foes whenever you attack with a sword. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Swordsmanship]] | var1 name = [[Slashing damage]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 25}}
==Acquisition== *[[Guild Wars Prophecies|Prophecies]] **"[[Spoiler-related boss]]" ([[Hell's Precipice]]) **[[Galrath]] ([[Kessex Peak]], only during [[The Villainy of Galrath (Hard mode)]]) *[[Guild Wars Factions|Factions]] **[[Warrior's Construct]] ([[Sunjiang District|Sunjiang District mission]] and [[Sunjiang District (explorable area)|explorable area]]) **[[Commander Chui Kantu]] ([[Jaya Bluffs]], only during [[Honorable Combat]]) *[[Guild Wars Nightfall|Nightfall]] **[[Reaper of Agony]] ([[Depths of Madness]]) **[[Blade of Corruption (boss)|Blade of Corruption]] ([[Nightfallen Jahai]], only during [[Breaking the Broken]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Storm of Swords}} *{{skill icon|Vow of Strength}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *Synergizes well with [[attack skill]]s that can cause multiple attacks with a sword ([[Sun and Moon Slash]], [[Whirlwind Attack]], and [[Twin Moon Sweep]]) and with [[hex spell]]s that deal damage whenever the hexed foe takes [[physical damage]] ([[Barbs]] and [[Mark of Pain]]). **When Whirlwind Attack is used, this skill will trigger for each adjacent foe attacked. *Because this triggers ''on attack'', you don't actually have to hit for the damage to occur. *The damage from Hundred Blades is inflicted before the damage from your sword. This is relevant for skills such as [[Reversal of Fortune]] or [[Empathy]]. *Because this damages all "adjacent foes", [[Kite|kiting]] opponents will avoid damage if they have moved away by the time the attack connects. *If you are using an [[emote]] when using this skill, no animation will show until you stop doing the emote. The animation will stack with several Hundred Blades.
==Trivia== *This skill was non-elite prior to the release of [[Prophecies]] and the reason why Warriors have one elite skill more than other [[core]] professions. (See [[Mantra of Celerity]].) *This is one of five elite skills seen in [[Ascalon (pre-Searing)]] (used by [[Prince Rurik]]), the other four being [[Barrage]], [[Bull's Charge]], [[Earth Shaker]], and [[Ward Against Harm]]. *The swords seen in the [[skill icon]] are [[Gladius (gladius)|Gladii]]. *The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Point blank skills]]
[[de:Hundert Klingen]]

Use this skill up to 3 times to gain an additional 11% faster movement each time. | concise description = Stance. (10 seconds.) You move 11% faster. Use this skill up to 3 times to gain an additional 11% faster movement each time. {{gray|Ends if you use another skill or stop moving.}} }}
==Notes== *If the [[duration]] of the 33% version expires, it is replaced with the 22% version, and if the duration of the 22% version expires, it is replaced with the 11% version.

{{Skill infobox | id = 1334 | name = Hypochondria | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Mesmer | type = Spell | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 7 | causes1 = Condition | description = [[Spell]]. Transfer all [[condition]]s from all [[foe]]s [[in the area]] to target foe. | concise description = Spell. Transfer all conditions from foes in the area to target foe. | aoe = in the area | target = foes | removes1 = Condition }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]''' * [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])
== Notes == * The conditions are applied to the target before being removed from the foes in the area, so [[Fevered Dreams]] will not re-apply the conditions. * Can be used for an AoE [[Fragility]] spike.
== Trivia == * [[w:Hypochondriasis|Hypochondria]] is the excessive preoccupation or worry about having a serious illness.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 821 | name = Icy Veins | campaign = Factions | profession = Necromancer | attribute = Soul Reaping | type = Hex Spell | elite = y | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | causes1 = Cold Damage | description = [[Elite]] [[Hex Spell]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] is struck for {{gr|10|90}} [[cold damage]]. For {{gr|10|35}} seconds, if target foe [[Death|dies]] all [[nearby]] foes are struck for {{gr|20|110}} cold damage. | concise description = Elite Hex Spell. ({{gr|10|35}} seconds.) Deals {{gr|20|110}} cold damage to nearby foes if target foe dies. Initial effect: deals {{gr|10|90}} cold damage. | aoe = nearby }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Soul Reaping]] |var1 name = [[Cold damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 90 |var2 name = [[Duration]] |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 35 |var3 name = Cold damage upon death |var3 at0 = 20 |var3 at15 = 110}} == Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Bazzr Icewing]] ([[Drazach Thicket]]) == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Death Nova}} * {{skill icon|Putrid Bile}} * {{skill icon|Rising Bile}} * {{skill icon|Shatterstone}} ([[elite]]) == Notes == * The hex is applied before the damage, so if the damage done from this skill kills the target, the secondary effect occurs. * [[AI]] characters do not use this skill if the target is already hexed with Icy Veins, even though that would cause additional damage. == Trivia == * This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details. [[de:Eisadern]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 431 | name = Ignite Arrows | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Ranger | attribute = Wilderness Survival | type = Preparation | energy = 10 | recharge = 12 | activation = 2 | causes1 = Fire Damage | description = [[Preparation]]. For 24 seconds, your [[Bow attack|arrows]] explode on contact, dealing {{gr|3|18}} [[fire damage]] to [[target]] and all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. | concise description = Preparation. (24 seconds.) Your arrows deal {{gr|3|18}} fire damage to target and foes adjacent to target. | aoe = adjacent }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Wilderness Survival]] |var1 name = [[Fire damage]] |var1 at0 = 3 |var1 at15 = 18}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]''' * [[Unnatural Growths]] ([[Wizard's Folly]] - [[Ascalon (pre-Searing)|pre-Searing]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Halbrik]] ([[Ascalon City (outpost)|Ascalon City]] - pre-Searing) * [[Sir Bertran]] ([[Ascalon City]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
== Related skills == *{{skill icon|Hundred Blades}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Mark of Pain}} *{{skill icon|Sand Shards}} *{{skill icon|Splinter Weapon}} *{{skill icon|Vow of Strength}} (elite)
== Notes ==
* While under the effect of this skill, attacks with a bow will deal [[Armor-respecting damage|armor-respecting]] fire damage to all foes in an area adjacent to the landing area of each shot arrow, before the arrow itself hits. ** The explosion occurs regardless of whether the arrow actually hits its target (even if it [[miss]]es, [[stray]]s or is [[block]]ed). ** Multiple-arrow attacks ([[Dual Shot]], [[Forked Arrow]], [[Triple Shot]] and [[Incendiary Arrows]]) will trigger an explosion for each arrow. ** The fact that the explosion triggers first is relevant for skills such as [[Reversal of Fortune]] or [[Reversal of Damage]]. ** Unlike [[Kindle Arrows]], the [[damage type]] of the arrows is not converted to [[fire damage|fire]], thus it will not be enough to meet the condition of [[Conjure Flame]]'s bonus damage. ** The explosion itself is not an attack. The damage will not be increased by effects increasing the damage of attacks such as modifiers on the bow or skills like [[Ursan Roar]] or [["Together as One!"]]. However it is increased by [[Ebon Battle Standard of Honor]]. ** The fire damage can be used to trigger [[burning]] on foes hexed with [[Mark of Rodgort]].
[[Category:Ranger skill rewards]] [[Category:Ascalon (pre-Searing) skills]]
