revision.text:
__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 216 | name = Iron Mist | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Earth Magic | type = Enchantment Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | target = untargeted | causes1 = Increased Armor Rating | causes2 = Decreased Activation Time | causes3 = Decreased Recharge Time | causes4 = Overcast | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. For {{gr|8|15}} seconds, you have +15 [[Armor rating|armor]]. Your [[Air Magic]] [[spell]]s that [[target]] a [[foe]] [[Activation time|activate]] and [[Recharge time|recharge]] 25% faster, but you are [[Overcast]] by 3 points. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. ({{gr|8|15}} seconds.) Gain +15 armor. Air Magic spells that target a foe activate and recharge 25% faster, but you are Overcast by 3 points. }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Earth Magic]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 8 | var1 at15 = 15 }}
==Acquisition== ;[[Skill quest]] *[[Dropping Eaves]] ([[Ettin's Back]]) ;[[Skill trainer]]s *[[Tengsao]] ([[The Amnoon Oasis]]) *[[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Over the Limit}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Glyph of Swiftness}} *{{skill icon|Mantra of Recovery}} (elite)
==Notes== {{bug|The effects of this skill apply to all spells, regardless of target or attribute.}} *It takes 9s to eliminate 3 points of overcast, so the overcast will start stacking if using 3 spells or more on average every 20s (not counting overcast from other sources). ** Consider using non-spell skills when the enchantment is active and/or casting other spells during the downtime of the enchantment. ** If only looking for a way to reduce the recharge of spells, consider using [[Glyph of Swiftness]] instead, as with only rank 2 in Air Magic the glyph can reduce the recharge of 4 spells every 20s. *** This skill's advantages over Glyph of Swiftness are its good armor rating bonus and the fact that it is an enchantment, allowing to trigger enchantment-related effects and to use other glyphs ([[Glyph of Elemental Power]] or [[Glyph of Energy]] for instance). * The overcast caused by this skill is not increased by [[Equinox]], and not prevented by [[Glyph of Energy]].
==Trivia== *The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Iron Mist/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[Category:Elementalist skill rewards]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 786 | name = Iron Palm | campaign = Factions | profession = Assassin | attribute = Deadly Arts | type = Touch Skill | energy = 5 | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 20 | range = touch | causes1 = Knockdown | description = [[Skill]]. [[Target]] [[Touch skill|touched]] [[foe]] suffers {{gr|5|50}} [[damage]], and if that foe is suffering from a [[hex]] or [[condition]] that foe is [[knocked down]]. Iron Palm counts as a [[lead attack]]. | concise description = Touch Skill. Deals {{gr|5|50}} damage. Causes knock-down if target foe is hexed or has a condition. Counts as a lead attack. | target = foes }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Deadly Arts]] |var1 name = [[Damage]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 50}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Zhao Di]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]])
== Notes == * This skill is used by [[Ebon Vanguard Assassin]] summoned via [[Ebon Vanguard Assassin Support]].
== Trivia == * [[w:Iron Palm|Iron Palm]] is a body of training techniques in various martial arts.
[[Category:Skills which count as lead attacks]] [[Category:Touch skills]]
[[de:Eiserne Handfläche]]

{{otheruses|the [[skill]]|the [[unique weapon]]|Isaiah's Balance (weapon)}} {{Skill infobox | name = Isaiah's Balance | campaign = Prophecies | special = Monster | type = Hex Spell | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 30 | description = [[Hex Spell]]. Target foe and all nearby foes are hexed for 20 seconds. The next time a foe hexed with Isaiah's Balance uses a skill, that skill costs 25 Energy and has a recharge of 90 seconds. | concise description = Hex Spell. (20 seconds.) Also hexes nearby foes. The next skill used by target foes cost 25 Energy and recharges in 90 seconds. | aoe = nearby }}
== Notes == * Used by [[Confessor Isaiah]].
== Trivia == * This skill is a reference to [[Isaiah Cartwright]]'s "balance" of [[Smiter's Boon (PvP)|Smiter's Boon]] for PvP in the [[Game_updates/20080821|August 21, 2008 game update]].
[[de:Isaiahs Ausgleich (Fertigkeit)]] [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs]]

{{skill infobox | name = Jack Frost | id = 1901 | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | type = Binding Ritual | special = Snow fighting | activation = 3 | recharge = 20 | aoe = none | causes1 = Spirit | description = [[Binding Ritual]]. Create a level 5 [[Jack Frost (spirit)|Jack Frost]]. This creature deals 50 [[damage]] with [[snowball]]s. This creature dies after 60 seconds. | concise description = Binding Ritual. Creates a level 5 Jack Frost (60 second lifespan). It deals 50 damage with snowballs. }}
== Acquisition == This skill is given to Ritualists competing in a [[Dwayna Vs Grenth]] match, as well as in [[Wintersday]] quests.
== Notes ==
* This skill is only available to players during [[Wintersday]] events. It is also used by [[Industrious Snowman|Industrious Snowmen]] in the [[Secret Lair of the Snowmen]]. * Jack Frost is unique among binding rituals in that the summoned spirit is vulnerable to [[hex]]es and uses a spell instead a [[ranged attack]]. ** Since its attacks are spell-based; they have [[range#spell range|spell range]], are not affected by height, and cannot be [[block]]ed. * Since [[Yuletide]] sets all primary attributes to 0, it cannot be affected by [[Spawning Power]].
== Trivia == * The name of this skill comes from the folklore figure [[w:Jack Frost|Jack Frost]].
[[Category:Binding rituals]]

{{skill infobox | name = Jadoth's Storm of Judgment | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Monster | special = Monster | type = Spear Attack | adrenaline = 1 | activation = {{1/2}} | description = [[Spear Attack]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] and up to 3 foes within [[earshot]] are [[interrupt]]ed and take 60 [[holy damage]] | concise description = Spear Attack. Deals 60 holy damage and interrupts target and 3 foes within the area.}} ==Notes== *This skill is only used by [[Lord Jadoth]].
[[de:Jadoths Sturm der Beurteilung]]

revision.comment: of course they use it on single foes - what else are they supposed to do?

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 586 | name = Janthir's Gaze | campaign = Prophecies | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 5 | type = Spell | description = [[Spell]]. [[Area of Effect|Area]] [[knockdown]] caused by the [[Eye of Janthir]]. | concise description = Spell. Area knockdown caused by the Eye of Janthir. }}
== Notes == * This skill is used by the Eye of Janthir in the [[Divinity Coast]], but cannot be seen by players.

revision.comment: Note on hero behaviour, see talk page for testing. Feel free to clarify note if excessively worded.

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Junundu Strike | campaign = Nightfall | type = Touch skill | activation = 1 | recharge = 4 | special = Junundu | range = touch | description = [[Skill]]. Target touched foe is struck for 150 [[piercing damage]]. You gain 75 [[Health]]. | concise description = Touch Skill. Deals 150 piercing damage. You are healed for 75. | target = foes }}
== Acquisition == This skill is available whenever your character is riding a [[Junundu]], from the [[Gate of Desolation]] [[mission]] onward through the rest of the [[Desolation]].
== Notes == * Can be used after [[Junundu Tunnel]] and before [[Junundu Bite]] to quickly recover 575 health and deal 500 damage at the same time.
[[de:Junundus Stoß]]

{{Otheruses|the player version of Junundu Tunnel|the monster skill|Junundu Tunnel (monster skill)}} {{Skill infobox | name = Junundu Tunnel | campaign = Nightfall | type = Stance | special = Junundu | energy = 5 | recharge = 30 | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | causes2 = Knockdown | description = [[Stance]]. For 10 seconds, you [[Speed boost|move 66% faster]]. This skill [[End effect|ends]] if you use a [[skill]]. When this skill ends, all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s are [[Knock down|knocked down]] for 3 seconds. | concise description = Stance. (10 seconds.) You move 66% faster. End effect: knocks-down adjacent foes (3 seconds). {{gray|Ends if you use a skill.}} }}
==Acquisition == This skill is available whenever your character is riding a [[Junundu]], from the [[Gate of Desolation]] [[mission]] onward through the rest of [[the Desolation]].
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Bull's Charge}} ([[Elite skill|elite]])
==Notes== *This stance increases average speed by 22% if used every time it recharges. *If you use [[Junundu Bite]] while in this stance, the knock down is applied before the attack is calculated, thus gaining health from Junundu Bite. *[[Heroes]] will only activate this stance while in combat. *If this stance is active when leaving a Junundu, it will remain in effect for the remaining [[duration]] or until you use a skill, and it will still knock down adjacent foes upon ending.
[[de:Junundus Tunnel]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Junundu Wail | special = Junundu | campaign = Nightfall | type = Skill | energy = 15 | activation = 3 | recharge = 10 | target = self | aoe = earshot | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Resurrection|Resurrect]] all dead [[junundu]] within [[earshot]]. If there are no [[Foe|enemies]] within earshot, [[Health gain|gain]] 500 [[Health]] for each junundu in range. | concise description = Skill. Resurrect all dead junundu in earshot. If there are no enemies in earshot, gain 500 Health for each junundu in range. }}
==Acquisition == This skill is available whenever your character is riding a [[Junundu]], from the [[Gate of Desolation]] [[mission]] onward through the rest of the [[Desolation]].
==Notes== *The user is counted. Dead [[pet]]s and [[hero]]es ''not'' in Junundu form are not counted. [[Junundu Young]] are not counted. *Junundu are resurrected at full health and [[energy]].
[[Category:Resurrection skills]]
[[de:Junundus Klage]]

{{otheruses|the version used as an NPC|the version available under the disguise|Keiran's Sniper Shot (Hearts of the North)}} {{Skill infobox | name = Keiran's Sniper Shot | id= 3163 | profession = Monster | special = Monster | campaign = Prophecies | type = Bow Attack | energy = 10 | recharge = 20 | description= [[Bow Attack]]. Deals +50 [[damage]] to [[target]] [[foe]] and inflicts [[Bleeding]] for 25 seconds. Has a 25% chance of dealing +900 damage. | concise description = Bow Attack. Deals +50 damage to target foe. Inflicts Bleeding (25 seconds). 25% chance of dealing +900 damage. }} ==Related skills== * {{skill icon|Ebon Vanguard Sniper Support}} * {{skill icon|Keiran's Sniper Shot (Hearts of the North)}}
==Notes== *This skill is used by [[Lieutenant Thackeray]] of the [[Ebon Falcons]] during the [[War in Kryta]].
[[Category:War in Kryta skills]]
[[de:Keirans Heckenschuss (Monster-Fertigkeit)]]

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1056 | name = Kitah's Burden | campaign = Factions | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Illusion Magic | type = Hex Spell | energy = 15 | activation = {{3/2}} | recharge = 30 | special = duplicate | causes1 = Decreased Movement Speed | causes2 = Energy Gain | description = [[Hex Spell]]. For 10 seconds, [[target]] [[foe]] [[Snare (tactic)|moves 50% slower]]. When Kitah's Burden ends you gain {{gr|10|18}} [[Energy]]. | concise description = Hex Spell. (10 seconds.) Target foe moves 50% slower. End effect: you gain {{gr|10|18}} Energy. }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Illusion Magic]] |var1 name = [[Energy]] gain |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 18}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) * [[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Arcane Conundrum}} * {{skill icon|Crippling Anguish}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Ethereal Burden}} ([[duplicate skill]]) * {{skill icon|Imagined Burden}} * {{skill icon|Renewing Surge}} * {{skill icon|Shared Burden}} (elite)
== Notes == * The energy gain ''does'' trigger upon the death of the hexed foe. *If you cast this skill on a target which an ally has already put Kitah's Burden on, you will gain two [[packet]]s of energy. One for when theirs would have normally ended, and one when yours ends
== Trivia == * This skill is named after the [[Canthan Heroes|Canthan hero]], [[Kitah]]. * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Kitah's Burden/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[de:Kitahs Bürde]] [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 590 | name = Knock | campaign = Prophecies | special = Monster | type = Skill | energy = 5 | activation = 1,200 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. Rurik's wait to open the exit door. | concise description = Skill. Rurik's wait to open the exit door.}}
== Notes == * This skill is used by [[Prince Rurik]] to open the door at the end of the [[Ruins of Surmia]] mission. * The mission will mostly be completed before the end of the casting time. * Instead of waiting the whole time of casting, eliminating the small groups of Charr trying to invade will automatically complete the mission.
== Trivia == * This may be a reference to the [[w:Dungeons and Dragons|Dungeons and Dragons]] ritual "Knock", which opens doors. * This skill's casting time is equivalent to 20 minutes, which is the longest casting time of any skill in the game.
[[Category:References to Dungeons & Dragons]]
[[de:Anklopfen]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 2025 | name = Lava Pool |image = No image |campaign = Core |type = Environment effect |duration = 3 }}
[[Lava Pool]] is a type of [[environment effect]] terrain that, for three seconds, [[cripple]]s and inflicts [[burning]] to any non-[[minion]] [[creature]] walking over it.
== Locations == * [[Guild Wars Prophecies|Prophecies]] ** [[Ring of Fire Islands]] *** [[Abaddon's Mouth]] *** [[Hell's Precipice]] *** [[Perdition Rock]] *** [[Ring of Fire]] * [[Guild Wars Eye of the North|Eye of the North]] ** [[Depths of Tyria]] *** [[Catacombs of Kathandrax]] *** [[Cathedral of Flames]] *** [[Rragar's Menagerie]] (level 1) *** [[Shards of Orr]] (level 2 and 3) *** [[Slavers' Exile]] (Duncan and Selvetarm's levels) * [[Core]] ** [[Burning Isle]] [[Guild hall]] ([[Guild versus Guild]]) ** [[Deepway Ruins]] [[arena]] map ** [[The Crag]] arena map
== Notes == * [[Melandru's Resilience]] will provide net [[health regeneration]] while walking in Lava. * Lava Pool does not have an in-game description. * Not all visual lava pools inflict the Lava Pool environment effect: notably, the lava in [[The Fissure of Woe]] does not inflict conditions on those that walk in it.

{{Skill infobox |name = Lava Wave |campaign = Eye of the North |special = Monster |type = Skill |energy = 5 |activation = 2 |recharge = 25 |description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[The Great Destroyer]] sends out a wave of [[lava]] that deals 100 [[fire damage]] to all [[Burning]] [[foe]]s. While submerged in lava, the Great Destroyer gains 10 [[Health regeneration]] and is immune to all [[damage]]. Lava Wave ends after 12 seconds or if all other [[Destroyer]]s are destroyed. |concise description = Skill. Deals 100 fire damage to all Burning foes. The Great Destroyer is submerged in lava, gains +10 Health regeneration, and is immune to all damage. Lava Wave ends after 12 seconds or if all other Destroyers are destroyed. }}
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Searing Flames}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *Used only by [[The Great Destroyer]].
[[de:Lavawelle]]

{{skill infobox | id = 3150 | name = Lesser Flame Sentinel Resistance | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) }}
==Notes== * This [[skill]] is an always active, unseen [[buff]]. It cannot be prevented or disabled. * Another version of [[Natural Resistance]]. * Possibly used by [[Lesser Flame Sentinel]]s.

{{Skill infobox | name = Lesser Hard Mode NPC Buff | id = 3064 | type = Skill | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) }}

If [[target]] [[Touch skill|touched]] [[foe]] is [[knock down|knocked down]], that foe loses one [[enchantment]]. | concise description = Touch Skill. Removes one enchantment.{{gray|No {{sic|No space between the period and "No"}} effect unless target foe is knocked-down.}} }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]])

{{otheruses|the [[Title (skill type)|title effect]]|the title track|Lightbringer rank}} __NOTOC__{{skill infobox | name = Lightbringer | campaign = Nightfall | type = Title | causes1 = Damage Reduction | attribute = Lightbringer rank |description = [[Title (skill type)|Title]]. For each rank of [[Lightbringer rank|Lightbringer]], you deal 5% more [[damage]] to and have +1 [[damage reduction]] against [[Abaddon]] and his [[demon]]ic servants. | concise description = Title. For each rank of Lightbringer, you deal 5% more damage to and have +1 damage reduction against Abaddon and his demonic servants. }} ==Progression== {| class="skill-progression" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" ! colspan="2" | Progression |- style="vertical-align: top;" | nowrap="nowrap" style="font-weight: bold;" |
[[Lightbringer rank]]

|} ==Acquisition== *Talk to [[Seeker of Whispers|Seeker of Whispers [Lightbringer Ranks]]] in [[Chantry of Secrets]] after attaining the first rank of the [[Lightbringer rank|Lightbringer]] title. ==Demonic Servants of Abaddon== This title effect, as well as the two linked skills [[Lightbringer's Gaze]] and [[Lightbringer Signet]], work against the following foes: *[[Margonite]]s *[[Stygian]]s *Most [[Torment creature]]s (excluding [[Grasp of Insanity|Grasps of Insanity]], [[Wrathful Storm]]s, [[Scythe of Chaos (mesmer)|Scythe of Chaos Mesmers]], [[Lesser Grasp]]s and [[The Hunger]]) *[[The Blasphemy]] and [[Unbound Energy|Unbound Energies]] *All [[Shadow Army]] units in the Nightfall campaign (but not Shadow Army units in the [[Fissure of Woe]]) *All Nightfall exclusive [[Titan]]s ([[Titan Abomination]]s, [[Pain Titan]]s, [[Madness Titan]]s and all Titans in the Domain of Anguish), but not other Titans *[[Tortureweb Dryder]]s and the [[Emissary of Dhuum|Emissaries of Dhuum]], but not [[Terrorweb Dryder]]s or other [[Dryder]]s *[[Varesh Ossa]] in both forms *[[Abaddon]] himself *All monsters in the [[Domain of Anguish]] == Notes == * While a character displays the Lightbringer title, this effect is applied as a [[buff]] to that character and all of their [[hero]]es. * [[55 Monk]]s can combine [[Protective Spirit]] with this skill (at Rank 5 or higher) to reduce incoming damage to 0. ** However, as with any effect, the order that these are combined matters: make sure to re-apply Lightbringer ''after'' casting Protective Spirit, to ensure you receive the maximum expected damage reduction. (See the [[Talk:Lightbringer#Order matters|talk page]] for details.)

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 232 | name = Lightning Touch | campaign = Core | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Air Magic | type = Touch skill | energy = 5 | recharge = 10 | activation = {{3/4}} | target = foes | range = touch | aoe = adjacent | causes1 = Lightning Damage | causes2 = Blind | causes3 = Cracked Armor | causes4 = Armor Penetration | description = [[Skill]]. [[Target]] [[Touch skill|touched]] [[foe]] and all [[adjacent]] foes are struck for {{gr|10|60}} [[lightning damage]], are [[Blind]]ed for {{gr|1|4}} second[s], and have [[Cracked Armor]] for {{gr|1|10}} second[s]. This skill has 25% [[armor penetration]]. | concise description = Touch Skill. Deals {{gr|10|60}} lightning damage. Also hits foes adjacent to target foe. Inflicts Blind ({{gr|1|4}} second[s]) and Cracked Armor ({{gr|1|10}} second[s]) on all struck foes. 25% armor penetration. }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Air Magic]] |var1 name = [[Lightning damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 60 |var2 name = [[Blind]] [[duration]] |var2 at0 = 1 |var2 at15 = 4 |var3 name = [[Cracked Armor]] duration |var3 at0 = 1 |var3 at15 = 10}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Ephaz]] ([[Beetletun]]) ** [[Master Scout Kiera]] ([[Henge of Denravi]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Xu Fengxia]] ([[Ran Musu Gardens]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Warden of Whispers (Chantry of Secrets)|Warden of Whispers]] ([[Chantry of Secrets]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * Prophecies ** [[Nazeem the Damned]] ([[Gates of Kryta]]) ** [[Gezna Shadowstalker]] ([[D'Alessio Seaboard]]) ** [[Najja Doombringer]] ([[Divinity Coast]]) ** [[Aziz Rottenscalp]] ([[Nebo Terrace]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Shock}} * {{skill icon|Shockwave}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Star Burst}} (elite)
== Notes == * Blind [[cover]]s cracked armor. * Because this is not a spell, this will not count for the 10 spell count in [[Glyph of Elemental Power]], but will still get the stat boost.
== Trivia == * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Lightning Touch/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]
[[de:Blitz-Berührung]]

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 2123 | name = Long Claws | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | description = This [[creature]]'s [[critical hit]]s cause [[Deep Wound]] and [[Bleeding]]. | concise description = This creature's critical hits cause Deep Wound and Bleeding. | campaign = Eye of the North }}
==Notes== * Introduced with ''[[Guild Wars Eye of the North|Eye of the North]]'' release. * This skill is a [[passive]], continuously active effect, making it invisible to players.

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Mad King's Fan | id = 2756 | profession = Monster | special = Passive | campaign = Prophecies | campaign2 = Nightfall | type = Hex spell | description = [[Hex Spell]]. [[Mad King Thorn]] is pleased by your undying support. Survive his celebration for bonus treats! | concise description = Hex Spell. Mad King Thorn is pleased by your undying support. Survive his celebration for bonus treats! }}
== Notes == * This hex spell is applied to [[character]]s who stand in Mad King Thorn's "glowing circle" in [[Lion's Arch (Halloween)|Lion's Arch]] and [[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan (Halloween)|Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]] at the beginning of a [[Halloween/Finale|Halloween finale]] (after you follow his first request, which is to [[Emote|kneel]]). It is removed if you are killed by Mad King Thorn, leave the circle, or [[Zone|rezone]]. ** If you stay within the glowing circle after the last finale ends, then this effect remains for about 12 hours. * You receive 1 point towards your [[Gamer]] title track for each correct response while still hexed. You receive an additional 100 [[Trick-or-Treat Bag]]s and 25 Gamer points if this hex is still active on your character at the end of a finale. ** It can be difficult to achieve, since your character can unexpectedly be killed by Mad King Thorn from: *** Being randomly chosen to play rock-paper-scissors and losing. *** Not having each of the four instruments being played by four different players when commanded to. * This and [[Scarred Psyche]] are the only non-[[PvP]] methods to get Gamer points.
==Trivia== *Introduced in [[Halloween 2011]].
[[Category:Halloween 2011]]
[[de:Fan des verrückten Königs]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Maddened Stance | type = Skill | recharge = 1 | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | description = The [[Maddened Spirit|maddened spirit]] has no physical form and is unable to be harmed by your [[Desert Wurm (disguise)|wurm's]] [[attack]]s. | concise description = The maddened spirit has no physical form and your wurm's attacks cannot harm it. }}
==Notes== * This appears to be a constantly active, invisible effect on [[Maddened Spirit]]s.

== Notes == * The target foe with this hex will not take the damage, only foes adjacent to him. * This skill causes the [[area damage over time]] scatter effect. * Combines well with a high number of [[minion]]s. * Synergy with [[Hundred Blades]] or [[Vow of Strength]] as the damage they deal is [[Damage type|physical]].
[[Category:Necromancer skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]] [[Category:Armor-ignoring damage]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 298 | name = Martyr | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | type = Spell | elite = yes | energy = 5 | recharge = 10 | activation = 1 | target = self | causes1 = Condition | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. Transfer all [[condition]]s and their remaining [[duration]]s from your [[Ally|allies]] to you. | concise description = Elite Spell. Transfer all conditions from all allies to you. | removes1 = condition | aoe = party }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Dwayna's Cursed]] ([[Perdition Rock]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Am Fah Leader]] ([[The Undercity]], only during [[Capturing the Orrian Tome]]) ** [[Rien, the Martyr]] ([[Shenzun Tunnels]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Dunshek the Purifier]] ([[The Shattered Ravines]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Cautery Signet}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Draw Conditions}} * {{skill icon|Foul Feast}}
== Notes == * This spell works within [[party range]].
* Use it in [[disease]]-heavy areas to reduce the number of victims and prevent the condition from spreading. * Chain with [[Plague Touch]] or [[Plague Sending]] to transfer conditions to foes. * Combine with [[Purge Conditions]] or [[Infuse Condition]] to quickly remove several conditions from the party at once.
== Trivia == * The [[skill icon]] resembles [[Mhenlo]]. * A [[w:Martyr|martyr]] is a person who dies or endures suffering for the sake of a belief, principle, or cause.
[[Category:Skills that affect allies]]
[[de:Märtyrer]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 277 | name = Mend Ailment | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | attribute = Protection Prayers | type = Spell | energy = 5 | recharge = 5 | activation = {{3/4}} | causes1 = Healing | description = [[Spell]]. Remove one [[condition]] ([[Poison]], [[Disease]], [[Blind]]ness, [[Dazed]], [[Bleeding]], [[Crippled]], [[Burning]], [[Weakness]], [[Cracked Armor]], or [[Deep Wound]]) from [[target]] [[ally]]. For each remaining Condition, that ally is [[heal]]ed for {{gr|5|70}} [[Health]]. | concise description = Spell. Removes a condition. Removal effect: heals for {{gr|5|70}} for each remaining condition. | removes1 = Condition | target = allies }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Protection Prayers]] | var1 name = [[Heal]]ing | var1 at0 = 5 | var1 at15 = 70}}

[[Touch skill|Touched]] [[ally]] loses two [[condition]]s and is [[heal]]ed for {{gr|15|60}} [[Health]] for each condition removed in this way. | concise description = Touch Spell. Removes two conditions. Heals for {{gr|15|60}} for each condition removed. | removes1 = Condition }}

'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * Nightfall ** [[Hoju]] (Gate of Torment)
'''[[Signet of Capture]] * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Candy Corn Tyrant]] ([[North Kryta Province]], only during [[Evil Residents]] or [[Evil Residents Code: Harmonica]] and requires a [[Mad King's Influence#Norn form|Norn form skill]]) ** [[Selenas the Blunt]] ([[Twin Serpent Lakes (War in Kryta)]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Monstrous Afflicted Warrior]] ([[Pongmei Valley]], only during the [[Cleansing Pongmei Valley]]; [[Morostav Trail]], only during [[Cleansing Morostav Trail]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Dismiss Condition}} * {{skill icon|Healing Touch}} * {{skill icon|Mend Ailment}} * {{skill icon|Mend Condition}} * {{skill icon|Purge Conditions}} * {{skill icon|Restore Condition}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * In [[PvP]], it is common to use a [[cover]] condition for the most harmful condition (i.e. [[Blind]], [[Crippled]], [[Dazed]], and [[Deep Wound]]) you want to keep on your target. Since the amount of conditions doesn't scale, this skill can remove both the cover and the covered condition without any investment of [[attribute point]]s. ** Rangers especially can put this skill to good use since [[expertise]] will reduce its cost.
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

revision.text:
__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 226 | name = Mind Shock | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Air Magic | type = Spell | elite = y | energy = 5 | recharge = 8 | activation = 1 | overcast = 5 | target = foes | range = Casting | aoe = none | causes1 = Lightning Damage | causes2 = Knockdown | causes3 = Armor Penetration | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] suffers {{gr|10|50}} [[lightning damage]]. If you have more [[Energy]] than target foe, that foe suffers {{gr|10|50}} more lightning damage and is [[Knock down|knocked down]]. This spell has 25% [[armor penetration]]. | concise description = Elite Spell. Deals {{gr|10|50}} lightning damage. If you have more Energy than target foe, deals +{{gr|10|50}} lightning damage and causes knockdown. 25% armor penetration. | has-pvp = y }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Air Magic]] |var1 name = [[Lightning damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 50 |var2 name = + Lightning damage |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 50}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Old Red Claw]] ([[Snake Dance]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Edielh Shockhunter]] ([[Jaga Moraine]], only after completing [[Prenuptial Disagreement]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Mind Burn}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Mind Freeze}} (elite)
== Notes == * Temporarily swap to a [[weapon swap#Energy|high-energy set]] if you think you'll need the boost to have more energy than your target. * Provided that the prerequisites for additional damage of the skills are met, [[Lightning Bolt]], [[Lightning Hammer]], [[Lightning Orb]], and [[Lightning Strike]] deal the same amount of damage from Air Magic rank 14 to 16.
==Trivia== *This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Mind Shock/Skill history|PvE skill history]] and its [[Mind Shock (PvP)/Skill history|PvP skill history]] for details.
[[de:Geistiger Schock]]

{{Pveversion|Mind Wrack}} {{Skill infobox | id = 2734 | name = Mind Wrack (PvP) | campaign = Core | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Domination Magic | type = Hex Spell | energy = 5 | recharge = 7 | activation = 1 | causes1 = Energy Loss | description = [[Hex Spell]]. For {{gr|5|40}} seconds, whenever this [[foe]] is the [[target]] of one of your non-hex [[Mesmer]] [[skill]]s, that foe loses 1 [[Energy]]. If the target foe's Energy drops to 0, Mind Wrack ends and that foe takes {{gr|15|100}} [[damage]]. | concise description = Hex Spell. ({{gr|5|40}} seconds.) Causes 1 Energy loss each time foe is the target of your non-hex Mesmer skills. If target foe's Energy drops to 0, Mind Wrack ends and that foe takes {{gr|15|100}} damage. | is-pvp = y }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Domination Magic]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 40 |var2 name = [[Damage]] |var2 at0 = 15 |var2 at15 = 100}}
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Famine}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Malaise}} * {{skill icon|Wither}} (elite)
== Notes == * Works well with [[Aneurysm]] because Mind Wrack causes energy loss and notifies you when the target has no energy, also adding damage to the [[spike]]. * The target's energy must drop to 0 to trigger the effect. Energy lost [[Energy#Regeneration_and_degeneration|while having less than 0 energy]] does not trigger Mind Wrack. * This hex will end on the target if the caster [[Death|dies]].
[[de:Geistiges Wrack (PvP)]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 49 | name = Mind Wrack | campaign = Core | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Domination Magic | type = Hex Spell | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 7 | causes1 = Energy Loss | description = [[Hex]] [[Spell]]. For {{gr|5|40}} seconds, whenever this [[foe]] is the [[target]] of any of your non-hex [[Mesmer]] [[skill]]s, that foe loses 1 [[Energy]] and takes {{gr|5|25}} [[damage]] per point of Energy lost. If the target foe's Energy drops to 0, Mind Wrack ends and that foe takes {{gr|15|100}} damage. | concise description = Hex Spell. ({{gr|5|40}} seconds.) Causes 1 Energy loss each time foe is the target of your non-hex Mesmer skills. Deals {{gr|5|25}} damage per point of Energy lost. If target foe's Energy drops to 0, it takes {{gr|15|100}} damage and Mind Wrack ends. | has-pvp=y }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Domination Magic]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 40 |var2 name = [[Damage]] per [[Energy]] lost |var2 at0 = 5 |var2 at15 = 25 |var3 name = Damage |var3 at0 = 15 |var3 at15 = 100}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[The False Gods]] ([[Temple of the Ages]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Bartoch]] ([[Droknar's Forge]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Masaharu]] ([[Seitung Harbor]]) ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) ** [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) ** [[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Godaj]] ([[Lair of the Forgotten]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * Prophecies ** [[Slikk Sandhopper]] ([[North Kryta Province]]) ** [[Hew Gruntruck]] ([[Watchtower Coast]]) ** [[Twig Slipfall]] ([[Nebo Terrace]]) ** [[Snap the Braineater]] ([[Tangle Root]]) * Nightfall ** [[Ensign Charehli]] ([[Issnur Isles]]) ** [[Qwytzylkak]] ([[Vehtendi Valley]], only during [[The Killing Joke]]) ** [[Midshipman Morolah]] ([[Barbarous Shore]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Energy Burn}} * {{skill icon|Energy Surge}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Famine}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Malaise}} * {{skill icon|Wither}} (elite)
== Notes == * Mind Wrack only deals damage for the energy loss it causes, not for energy loss caused by other skills. * Works well with [[Aneurysm]] because Mind Wrack causes energy loss and notifies you when the target has no energy, also adding damage to the [[spike]]. * The target's energy must drop to 0 to trigger the effect. Energy lost [[Energy#Regeneration_and_degeneration|while having less than 0 energy]] does not trigger Mind Wrack. * This hex will end on the target if the caster [[Death|dies]].
[[Category:Mesmer skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]
[[de:Geistiges Wrack]]

{{pveversion|Mirror of Disenchantment}} {{Skill infobox | id = 3194 | name = Mirror of Disenchantment (PvP) | campaign = Nightfall | is-pvp = y | profession = Mesmer | type = Spell | target = foes | energy = 15 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | removes1 = Enchantment | description = [[Spell]]. Remove one [[enchantment]] from [[target]] [[foe]]. All of that foe's [[party]] members also lose that same enchantment. | concise description = Spell. Removes one enchantment from target foe. That foe's party members also lose this enchantment. | aoe = party }}

That foe's party members also lose this enchantment. | aoe = party }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Baram]] ([[The Kodash Bazaar]]) * [[Dau]] ([[The Mouth of Torment]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Warden of Whispers (The Kodash Bazaar)|Warden of Whispers]] (The Kodash Bazaar)
== Notes == * This skill can be used to remove enchantments from all of a [[minion master]]'s minions (e.g. [[Death Nova]] or [[Jagged Bones]]), since the game treats them as a [[party]]. * This skill can remove a [[Doublecast skill|doublecast enchantment]] from both the caster and its ally if they are members of the same party.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]
[[de:Spiegel der Entzauberung]]

{{skill infobox | name = Mmm. Slushy! | campaign = Core | profession = | type = Enchantment Spell | special = Snow fighting | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 60 | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. You are [[heal]]ed for 250 [[Health]], and you have +10 [[Health regeneration]] for 10 seconds. Mmm. Slushy! ends if you use a [[skill]]. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. (10 seconds.) You have +10 Health regeneration. Initial effect: heals you for 250. Ends if you use a skill. }}
== Acquisition == This skill is given to all players in a [[The Great Snowball Fight of the Gods (PvP)|The Great Snowball Fight of the Gods]] match.

{{Skill infobox | name = Monkey See, Monkey Do | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | type = Skill | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 40 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 20 seconds, this skill is replaced by a skill currently in use by a random [[ally|friend]] or [[foe]] within [[earshot]]. The new skill activates with an [[attribute]] level equal to the caster's rank in that attribute. | concise description = Skill. (20 seconds.) This skill becomes a random skill currently in use by friend or foe within earshot. The new skill activates with attribute level equal to the caster's ranks in that attribute.}}
==Notes== * This skill is used by all non-[[boss]] [[beast|Simian]]s in the [[Tarnished Coast]]. * If this skill copies another skill that was already copied by Monkey See, Monkey Do, the attribute level will be 0.
==Trivia== * The term [[w:Monkey_see%2C_monkey_do|Monkey see, monkey do]] is a saying referring to the action of observing another's behaviour, and then imitating it, usually without understanding the behaviour, or without knowing the outcome of such behaviour. When the imitator knows what the outcome of the behaviour will be, the phrase is used to denote a lack of concern for the outcome of the mimicked behaviour.
[[de:Der Affe sieht, der Affe macht]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1329 | name = Monster doesn't get death penalty | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) }}
== Notes == * This skill is a [[passive]], continuously active buff, making it invisible to players. Information on its existence came from a number of other sources.

{{skill infobox | id = 547, 548 | name = Natural Resistance | campaign = Core | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) }}
== Game mechanics == * This skill halves the [[duration]] of [[condition]]s and [[hex]]es applied to the [[creature]] which uses it. * This [[skill]] is an always active, unseen [[buff]]; it cannot be prevented or [[disable]]d.
; Exploitation * Natural Resistance can be turned against the user by utilizing effects that trigger when a hex or condition ends: ** [[Wastrel's Worry]] will deal damage after only 1 second due to rounding, making it very effective against foes using Natural Resistance. ** [[Fragility]] triggers more frequently.
; Creatures using this skill include: {{section-stub|the list is vague, meaning that it's hard to tell if any particular proph boss has or does not have Natural Resistance}} * Almost all [[Prophecies]] and [[Eye of the North]] [[boss]]es. * Some bosses and [[boss-like foe]]s outside of Prophecies. * [[Ether Seal]]s and most [[Wurm]]s. * Many creatures representing human souls, including [[Seal Guard]]s, [[New Soul]]s, [[Tortured Spirit]]s and possibly [[Leah Stone]]. * Some creatures carry this skill in [[hard mode]], but not in [[normal mode]].
== Related skills == * {{monster skill icon|Strong Natural Resistance}}
== See also == * [[End effect]] * [[List of hex spells]]
[[de:Natürlicher Widerstand]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Natural Stride | id = 1727 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Ranger | attribute = Wilderness Survival | type = Stance | energy = 5 | recharge = 12 | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | causes2 = Block | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|1|8}} second[s], you [[Speed boost|run 33% faster]] and have a 50% chance to [[block]] incoming [[attack]]s. Natural Stride ends if you become [[hex]]ed or [[Enchantment|enchanted]]. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|1|8}} second[s].) You move 33% faster and have 50% chance to block. {{gray|Ends if you become hexed or enchanted.}} }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Wilderness Survival]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 1 |var1 at15 = 8}}

{{Skill infobox | id = 405 | name = Oath Shot | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Ranger | attribute = Expertise | type = Bow Attack | elite = y | energy = 10 | recharge = 25 | causes1 = Recharge | causes2 = Disable | description = [[Elite]] [[Bow Attack]]. If Oath Shot hits, all of your [[skill]]s except Oath Shot are [[recharge]]d. If it misses, all of your skills are [[disable]]d for {{gr|10|4}} seconds. (50% miss chance with [[Expertise]] 7 or less.) | concise description = Elite Bow Attack. Recharges all skills except Oath Shot if it hits. {{gray|Disables all skills if it misses ({{gr|10|4}} seconds). 50% miss chance unless Expertise 8 or higher.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Expertise]] |var1 name = [[Disable]] [[duration]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 4}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Jade Bow (boss)]] ([[Ice Floe]]) * [[Hilios the Dutiful]] ([[Iron Mines of Moladune]]) * [[Perfected Cloak]] ([[Thunderhead Keep]] or [[The Battle for Lion's Arch (explorable area)]] during [[The Battle for Lion's Arch]]) * [[Cairn the Relentless]] ([[Abaddon's Mouth]]) * [[Cairn the Troubling]] ([[Ring of Fire]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Assassin's Promise}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Determined Shot}} * {{skill icon|Flourish}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Moebius Strike}} (elite)
== Notes == * This skill only recharges Resurrection Signet or Sunspear Rebirth Signet if they were disabled by another skill (e.g. by Distracting Shot); it will not recharge them if they were used to resurrect. * This skill is sometimes used by [[trapper]]s, as it allows them to plant another set of traps or [[nature rituals]] without waiting out the long recharge time. * Combine with [[Determined Shot]], which recharges all your attack skills if it [[Fail#Skills that have an effect when an attack fails to hit|fails to hit]]. This can be used to rapidly recharge Oath Shot. ** This tactic can be extended with [[Shadow Sanctuary]], which almost guarantees a miss. ** Add [["Dodge This!"]] or [[Asuran Scan]] to the [[skill chain]] to ensure that Oath Shot hits through [[block]] and/or [[blind]], bear in mind it will still have a 50% chance to miss when below 8 Expertise. * The 50% [[miss]] chance is actually a 50% [[fail]] chance and cannot be prevented with effects such as Asuran Scan. Oath Shot will still go into recharge, unlike in regular attack skill failure.
[[Category:Skills with a failure rate linked to an attribute]]
[[de:Eidschuss]]

== Trivia == * The word orison means "prayer".
[[Category:Monk skill rewards]] [[Category:Ascalon (pre-Searing) skills]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 3424 | name = Over the Limit | campaign = Core | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Energy Storage | pve-only = y | type = Enchantment Spell | elite = y | upkeep = -1 | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | target = untargeted | causes1 = Overcast | causes2 = Decreased Activation Time | causes3 = Decreased Recharge Time | description = [[Elite]] [[Enchantment Spell]]. While you [[Upkeep|maintain]] this enchantment, your [[spell]]s cast {{gr|15|20}}% faster, and [[recharge]] {{gr|15|50}}% faster, but you continuously gain [[Overcast]]. {{gray|PvE Skill}} | concise description = Elite Enchantment Spell. Spells cast {{gr|15|20}}% faster and recharge {{gr|15|50}}% faster. Continuously gain Overcast while active. {{gray|PvE Skill}} }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Energy Storage]] | var1 name = [[Activation time|Casting]] % | var1 at0 = 15 | var1 at15 = 20 | var2 name = [[Recharge time|Recharge]] % | var2 at0 = 15 | var2 at15 = 50 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *[[Prophecies]] **[[Abaddon's Cursed]] ([[Perdition Rock]]) (requires a party member to be carrying a [[Proof of Triumph]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Iron Mist}} *{{skill icon |Glyph of Swiftness}} *{{skill icon |Time Ward}} ([[elite]])
== Notes== *This is a [[core]] skill, but [[Guild Wars Prophecies]] is required to obtain the skill. *This skill has both regular upkeep cost and overcast "upkeep". The overcast rate is one point of overcast per second. **Assuming this is the only overcast skill used, and that it is recast everytime it recharges, the enchantment must be dismissed around 6 or 7s after casting it to avoid building overcast. *Overcast caused by this spell will not be negated with [[Glyph of Energy]].
==Trivia== *This skill uses the same icon as the ''[[Guild Wars 2]]'' [[gw2:Weaver|Weaver]] skill [[gw2:Primordial Stance|Primordial Stance]]. *This is the only Elementalist skill with an upkeep cost, and the only maintained skill with a continuous overcast [[Resource cost|additional resource cost]]. *Added to the game with the [[Feedback:Game updates/20200422|22nd April 2020 update]] as part of the 15th [[Anniversary Celebration]]. *The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Core PvE-only Elite skills]] [[Category:Anniversary Celebration elite skills]]

== Notes == *This effect is generated around a [[G.O.L.E.M. 2.0]] after it uses the [[Phase Shield (monster skill)|Phase Shield monster skill]]. **This effect continues even after the G.O.L.E.M. 2.0 that has cast it has been killed, which can result in one player or [[hero]] taking no damage permanently as long as they don't move. *This effect is generated around a player under the [[G.O.L.E.M. (disguise)|G.O.L.E.M. disguise]] after the [[Phase Shield]] skill is used. {{Anomaly|The effect description shows a 10 second recharge regardless of the duration of the actual effect and the recharge of the effect generating this one}}

{{Skill infobox | id = 73 | name = Physical Resistance | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Inspiration Magic | type = Stance | energy = 10 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Increased Armor Rating | causes2 = Decreased Armor Rating | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|30|90}} seconds, You gain +40 [[Armor rating|armor]] against [[physical damage]], but you lose {{gr|24|12}} armor against [[elemental damage]]. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|30|90}} seconds.) You have +40 armor against physical damage. {{gray|You have {{gr|24|12|-}} armor against elemental damage.}} }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Inspiration Magic]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 30 |var1 at15 = 90 |var2 name = - [[Armor rating|Armor]] against [[elemental damage]] |var2 at0 = 24 |var2 at15 = 12}} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Taltosh]] ([[Grendich Courthouse]]) * [[Captain Osric]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Elemental Resistance}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Earth}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Flame}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Frost}} * {{skill icon|Mantra of Lightning}} == Notes == * In [[PvP]], most physical damage characters carry an elemental damage weapon for use against [[Warrior]]s (who often have less armor against elemental damage). This stance can be quite dangerous to use since, upon seeing it used, attackers can simply [[weapon swap|swap weapons]]. * This skill is often used by Warriors when [[farming]] in [[the Underworld]]. {{bug|Similar to [[Cracked Armor]], this skill will not lower your armor rating below 60 or your [[List of armor effects by category#Equipment|"core" armor]] rating, if your "core" armor rating is lower than 60.}} {{bug|If you use a skill or combination of skills and effects that, after subtraction of the penalty from Physical Resistance, still grants +26 or more armor rating against elemental damage, Physical Resistance's armor penalty does not function. See also [[armor calculation]].}}

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 2021 | name = Poison Ground |image = No image |campaign = Prophecies |type = Environment effect |duration = 14 }}
{{stub}} [[Poison Ground]] is a type of [[environment effect]] terrain that, for 14 seconds, inflicts [[poison]] to players, allies such as the WiK-related allies and their [[pet]]s. Most visual swamps throughout Kryta inflict the Poison Ground environmental effect, but not all of them.
== Locations == * [[Guild Wars Prophecies|Prophecies]] ** [[Kryta]] *** [[The Black Curtain]] *** [[Sanctum Cay]] *** [[Divinity Coast]] *** [[Gates of Kryta]] *** [[Riverside Province]] *** [[Majesty's Rest]] ?
== Notes == * Poison Ground does not have an in-game description. * Allies summoned via [[Summoning stone]] are immune to this environment effect.

{{Skill infobox | name = Polymock Block | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Polymock | type = Enchantment spell | energy = 2 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 12 | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. For 2 seconds, the next [[Foe|enemy]] [[spell]] that [[target]]s you [[fail]]s. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. (2 seconds.) The next enemy spell that targets you fails.}}
==Acquisition== Polymock Block is one of the five skills that is available to all [[Polymock]] pieces.
==Related skills== *{{Skill icon|Shadow Form (PvP)}} ([[Elite skill|elite]])
==Trivia== *This skill uses the [[skill icon]] of [["Watch Yourself!"]], and is one of several Polymock skills that is named different than the icon's regular skill.

{{Skill infobox | name = Polymock Frozen Trident | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Polymock | type = Spell | energy = 6 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | description = [[Spell]]. [[Projectile spell|Send out]] a fast-moving Frozen Trident that strikes [[target]] [[foe]] for 600 [[damage]] if it hits. If target foe is casting a [[spell]], that spell is [[interrupt]]ed. | concise description = Spell. Fast projectile: deals 600 damage. Interrupts a spell.}}
==Acquisition== This skill is available in the following [[Polymock]] forms: *[[Kappa Form]]
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Polymock Earthquake}} *{{skill icon|Polymock Meteor}} *{{skill icon|Water Trident}} ([[Elite skill|elite]])
[[de:Polymock-Frostdreizack]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Polymock Glyph of Power | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Polymock | type = Glyph | energy = 1 | activation = 1 | recharge = 10 | description = [[Glyph]]. If you are below 50% [[health]], your next [[spell]] that targets a foe deals 200 additional [[damage]]. If you are below 25% health, your next 2 spells are affected. | concise description = Glyph. Your next spell that targets a foe deals +200 damage if you are below 50% Health. If you are below 25% Health, your next 2 spells are affected.}}
==Acquisition== '''Polymock Glyph of Power''' is one of the five skills that is available to all [[Polymock]] pieces.
==Notes== *The check for Health takes place when the glyph successfully activates. Dropping below 25% while the Glyph is active will not make it affect a second spell. *This glyph shares the icon of [[Glyph of Elemental Power]].
[[de:Polymock-Glyphe der Kraft]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Polymock Searing Flames | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Polymock | type = Spell | energy = 4 | activation = 1 | recharge = 2 | description = [[Spell]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] is struck with Searing Flames. If that foe is already on fire, that foe takes 800 [[damage]]. Otherwise, that foe begins [[Burning]] for 5 seconds. | concise description = Spell. Deals 800 damage if target foe is Burning. Otherwise, that foe begins Burning (5 seconds). Burning causes -7 Health degeneration.}}
==Acquisition== This skill is available in the following Polymock forms: *[[Ruby Djinn Form]]
==Related skills== *{{Skill icon|Searing Flames}} ([[Elite skill|elite]])
==Notes== *Burning causes -10 [[health degeneration]] in [[Polymock]].

If [[target]] [[foe]] is casting a [[spell]] or [[chant]], that [[skill]] is [[interrupt]]ed and for {{gr|4|10}} seconds, that foe has -2 [[Energy degeneration]]. | concise description = Elite Hex Spell. Interrupts a spell or chant. Interruption effect: -2 Energy degeneration ({{gr|4|10}} seconds). }}

== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Power Leak}} * {{skill icon|Power Leech}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * The hex will apply even if the interruption effect is prevented. * This skill causes a net energy loss of <font color=green>'''2.67...6...6.67'''</font color> if it lasts its full duration.
== Trivia == * Flux is a term describing the rate of flow of something through a surface. * The woman in the [[skill icon]] seems to also appear in [[Power Leech]]'s skill icon.

revision.comment: /* Related skills */ Neither of these skills have a similar functionality aside from healing
revision.text:
__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1250 | name = Preservation | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Restoration Magic | type = Binding Ritual | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Spirit | causes2 = Healing | description = [[Elite]] [[Binding Ritual]]. Create a level {{gr|1|14}} [[spirit]]. Every 4 seconds, this spirit [[heal]]s one non-spirit [[ally]] [[in the area]] for {{gr|10|115}} [[Health]]. This spirit dies after 90 seconds. | concise description = Elite Binding Ritual. Creates a level {{gr|1|14}} spirit (90 second lifespan). Every 4 seconds this spirit heals one non-spirit ally for {{gr|10|115}}. | has-pvp = y | aoe = in the area }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Restoration Magic]] | var1 name = Level | var1 at0 = 1 | var1 at15 = 14 | var2 name = [[Heal]]ing | var2 at0 = 10 | var2 at15 = 115}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Factions]] ** [[Flower Spiritgarden]] ([[The Eternal Grove (explorable area)]]) ** [[Soulwhisper, Elder Guardian]] ([[Gyala Hatchery (explorable area)]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Fozzy Yeoryios]] ([[Sacnoth Valley]])
== Notes == * This skill creates a [[Spirit of Preservation]]. * The spirit heals one random ally in the area, including allies with full health. * The healing is a passive effect; the spirit does not use any skills, so it cannot be [[interrupt]]ed; however, the healing will still trigger [[Scourge Healing]]. * Heroes attempt to maintain this spirit even outside of battle. * The concise description neglects to mention that only allies in the area of the spirit will be healed.
==Trivia== * The [[skill icon]] shows a spirit holding a glowing [[w:Ankh|ankh]], the Egyptian symbol of life. * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Skills that affect allies]]
[[de:Erhaltung]]

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 263 | name = Protective Bond | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Monk | attribute = Protection Prayers | type = Enchantment Spell | upkeep = -1 | energy = 10 | activation = 2 | causes1 = Damage Reduction | causes2 = Energy Loss | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. While you [[Upkeep|maintain]] this [[enchantment]], [[target]] [[ally]] cannot lose more than 5% max [[Health]] due to [[damage]] from a single [[attack]] or [[spell]]. When Protective Bond prevents damage, you lose {{gr|6|3}} [[Energy]] or the spell ends. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. Target ally cannot lose more than 5% max Health from a single attack or spell. {{gray|Each time damage is reduced you lose {{gr|6|3}} Energy or this spell ends.}} }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Protection Prayers]] | var1 name = [[Energy]] loss | var1 at0 = 6 | var1 at15 = 3}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Avena]] ([[Maguuma Stade]]) * [[Tengsao]] ([[The Amnoon Oasis]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Leaps Thunderclap]] ([[North Kryta Province]]) * [[Gack Splotchplunk]] ([[Watchtower Coast]]) * [[Fluum Banzo]] ([[Divinity Coast]]) * [[Tree of Vitality]] ([[The Wilds]]) * [[Splintertrunk]] ([[Ettin's Back]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Defiant Was Xinrae}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Protective Spirit}} * {{skill icon|Shelter}} * {{skill icon|Xinrae's Weapon}} (elite)
== Notes == * The energy loss can be split between multiple [[character]]s maintaining the same enchantment on one character. Two characters with 8 Protection Prayers will each lose 2 energy per hit. Three characters at 13 Protection Prayers will each only lose 1 energy per hit. Two characters at 13 Protection Prayers will lose 2 and 1 energy, respectively. The first to cast takes the larger energy burden on an odd split. If characters are at differing [[attribute]] ranks of Protection Prayers, the lowest rank is used. **If the enchantment is split up so that each [[bonder]] will lose 1 energy, then each of the bonders can cast [[Life Bond]] on the character that is the target of Protective Bond, and then [[Balthazar's Spirit]] on themselves to cover all of the energy cost, and maintain Protective Bond as long as it isn't stripped. However, Life Bond only splits up damage from [[attack]]s, so 1 energy will still be lost for each [[packet]] of damage from non-attack damage. As long as the non-attack damage isn't reduced to zero, 1 energy can usually still be gained from [[Essence Bond]]. * If more than one character is maintaining this enchantment and one character runs out of energy, all other characters stop maintaining the enchantment.
== Trivia == * Before it was [[nerf]]ed, this skill was the backbone to a [[55 Monk]] build for [[farming]] [[the Underworld]]. According to [[Isaiah Cartwright]], [[User_talk:Isaiah_Cartwright/Izzy_Talk_Archive_1#Essence_Bond_question...|this skill was nerfed]] not solely because it was overpowered in [[Player versus Environment|PvE]], but because of a recursion [[bug]] that could crash [[ArenaNet]] servers.
* During the beta, this skill was known as ''Mantle of Protection''.

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1219 | name = Protective Was Kaolai | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Restoration Magic | type = Item Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 25 | causes1 = Increased Armor Rating | causes2 = Healing | description = [[Item Spell]]. [[Hold]] [[Kaolai]]'s ashes for up to {{gr|15|60}} seconds. While you hold his ashes, you gain 10 [[armor rating|armor]]. When you drop his ashes, all [[party]] members are [[heal]]ed for {{gr|10|85}} [[Health]]. | concise description = Item Spell. ({{gr|15|60}} seconds.) You have +10 armor. Drop effect: all party members are healed for {{gr|10|85}}. | aoe = party }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Restoration Magic]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 15 | var1 at15 = 60 | var2 name = [[Heal]]ing | var2 at0 = 10 | var2 at15 = 85}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Breath of the Great Dwarf}} * {{duplicate skill icon|Divine Healing|Heaven's Delight}} * {{skill icon|Feast of Souls}} * {{skill icon|Heal Party}} * {{skill icon|Light of Deliverance}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Precast this item spell to gain reduced damage provided by the additional armor rating and drop the ashes to use as an emergency [[Heal Party]] or when energy is low to regain the benefits from your [[weapon set]]. * Can be maintained indefinitely by re-casting the spell while still holding the ashes to retain the additional armor rating while providing a steady stream of [[party healing]]. * Requires care when facing [[Soul Bind]] or [[Scourge Healing]] as once the item spell has been cast, the party heal cannot be stopped. * Combines well with [[Herald's Insignia]] for an extra +10 armor rating.
==See also== *[[Party healing]]
== Trivia == * This skill is named after the [[Canthan Heroes|Canthan hero]], [[Kaolai]]. * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.

{{Skill infobox | id = 1057 | name = Psychic Instability | campaign = Factions | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Fast Casting | type = Spell | has-pvp = y | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 12 | causes1 = Interrupt | causes2 = Knockdown | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. [[Interrupt]] the [[target]] [[foe]]'s [[action]]. If that action was a [[skill]], that foe and [[nearby]] foes are [[Knock down|knocked down]] for {{gr|2|4}} seconds. (50% [[fail]]ure chance with Fast Casting 4 or less.) | concise description = Elite Spell. Interrupts an action. Interruption effect: if the action is a skill, cause knockdown for {{gr|2|4}} seconds on target foe and all nearby foes. {{gray|50% failure chance unless Fast Casting 5 or higher.}} | aoe = nearby | target = foes }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Fast Casting]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 2 |var1 at15 = 4}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Chazek Plague Herder]] ([[Unwaking Waters (explorable area)]])
== Notes == {{hero|Heroes seem to use this skill more often on locked targets.}} * Can permanently keep a group of foes on the ground in PvE if using at least 12 in [[Fast Casting]] under [[Quickening Zephyr]], assuming the user manages to succesfully interrupt the first skill the mob uses every time they recover from the knockdown. * The knockdown will not occur if the interruption is prevented.
==Trivia== *This is one of the few skills with a concise description longer than its normal one. *This skill causes one of the longest [[knock down]]s of any player-usable skills.
[[Category:Skills with a failure rate linked to an attribute]]
[[de:Übernatürliche Labilität]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 278 | name = Purge Conditions | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | type = Spell | energy = 5 | recharge = 20 | activation = {{1/4}} | description = [[Spell]]. Remove all [[condition]]s ([[Poison]], [[Disease]], [[Blindness]], [[Dazed]], [[Bleeding]], [[Crippled]], [[Burning]], [[Weakness]], [[Cracked Armor]], and [[Deep Wound]]) from [[target]] [[ally]]. | concise description = Spell. Removes all conditions. | removes1 = Condition | target= allies }}

== Trivia == * During the beta, this skill was known as ''Mend Injury''.
[[Category:Monk skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 295 | name = Purge Signet | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | type = Signet | recharge = 20 | activation = 2 | target = allies | range = casting | aoe = | removes1 = Condition | removes2 = Hex spell | causes1 = Energy Loss | description = [[Signet]]. Remove all [[hex]]es and [[condition]]s from [[target]] [[ally]]. You lose 10 [[Energy]] for each hex and each condition removed. | concise description = Signet. Removes all hexes and conditions. {{gray|Removal cost: 10 Energy each.}} }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Mazzim]] ([[Fishermen's Haven]]) ** [[Tengsao]] ([[The Amnoon Oasis]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) ** [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Baram]] ([[The Kodash Bazaar]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * Nightfall ** [[Hoju ]] ([[Gate of Torment]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * Prophecies ** [[Liam Shanglui]] ([[Kessex Peak]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Peace and Harmony}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * To minimize the potential for massive [[energy]] loss, this skill is often used in combination with an [[energy hiding]] [[weapon set]]. * Consider using [[Ether Signet]] immediately after using this skill. [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1579 | name = Purifying Finale | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Paragon | attribute = Motivation | type = Echo | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 10 | description = [[Echo (skill type)|Echo]]. For {{gr|10|35}} seconds, [[target]] non-[[spirit]] [[ally]] loses 1 [[condition]] whenever a [[chant]] or [[shout]] ends on that ally. | concise description = Echo. ({{gr|10|35}} seconds.) Target ally loses one condition whenever a chant or shout ends on that ally. {{gray|Cannot target spirits.}} | removes1 = Condition | target = allies }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Motivation]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 35}}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Dau]] ([[The Mouth of Torment]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Godaj]] ([[Lair of the Forgotten]])
==Notes== *Good synergy with [["Dodge This!"]], [["Go for the Eyes!"]] and [["The Power Is Yours!"]]. *When using shouts or chants that end when using an attack skill, Purifying Finale will remove a condition : ** After the next attack if [["Find Their Weakness!"]], [[Anthem of Envy]] or [[Anthem of Flame]] ends. ** Before the next attack if [["Go for the Eyes!"]], [[Anthem of Weariness]] or [[Anthem of Disruption]] ends. <!-- To also check : Anthem of Fury Anthem of Guidance Crippling Anthem Song of Purification Song of Restoration Zealous Anthem, and skills that end on attack/skill use Defensive Anthem, Song of Power or Fall Back -->
==Trivia== * The [[skill icon]] is similar to [[Demonic Miasma]].
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

Create a Rain of Terror at [[target]] [[foe]]'s location. For 5 seconds, foes [[in the area]] are struck for 30 [[damage]]. This [[Armor-ignoring damage|damage ignores armor]]. | concise description = Spell. (5 seconds.) Deals 30 damage. Hits foes in the area of the target. Armor Ignoring. }}

{{Skill infobox | name = Rand's Attack | id= 2529 | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | activation = {{3/4}} | energy = 5 | recharge = 10 | type = Skill | description= [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 10 seconds, all nearby allies gain +5 Health regeneration. }}
== Notes == *This skill is used by [[Rand Stormweaver]] in the [[dungeon]] [[Slavers' Exile]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 830 | name = Ray of Judgment | campaign = Factions | profession = Monk | attribute = Smiting Prayers | type = Spell | elite = y | target = foes | energy = 10 | activation = 2 | recharge = 20 | range = Casting | aoe = adjacent | causes1 = Holy Damage | causes2 = Burning | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. Invoke a Ray of Judgment at [[target]] [[foe]]'s location. For 5 seconds, target foe and all foes [[adjacent]] to this location take {{gr|5|45}} [[holy damage]] each second and begin [[Burning]] for {{gr|1|3}} second[s]. | concise description = Elite Spell. Deals {{gr|5|45}} holy damage and inflicts Burning ({{gr|1|3}} second[s]) every second (5 seconds). Hits foes adjacent to target's initial location. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Smiting Prayers]] | var1 name = [[Holy damage]] | var1 at0 = 5 | var1 at15 = 45 | var2 name = [[Burning]] [[duration]] | var2 at0 = 1 | var2 at15 = 3 }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Barthimus the Provident]] ([[Cursed Lands (War in Kryta)]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[The Afflicted Miju]] ([[The Undercity]], [[Vizunah Square]]) ** [[The Afflicted Cho]] ([[Dragon's Throat]]) ** [[The Afflicted Jingme]] ([[Unwaking Waters]]) ** [[Ming the Judgment]] ([[The Undercity (Winds of Change)]] before completion of [[A Chance Encounter]]) ** [[Dimsur Cheefai]] (The Undercity (Winds of Change), after completion of A Chance Encounter) ** [[Plagued Zunraa]] ([[Zen Daijun (Winds of Change)]]) ** [[Monstrous Afflicted Monk]] ([[Morostav Trail (Winds of Change)]]) ** [[Rei Bi]] (Dragon's Throat, only during [[What Waits in Shadow]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Gorlos Skinflayer]] ([[Heart of the Shiverpeaks]])
== Notes == * Burning is refreshed every second that Ray of Judgment is active, e.g. a stationary target might burn as long as 7 seconds from a ray cast with a Smiting Prayers rank of 12 to 18.
== Trivia == * This is the only monk skill that can inflict a condition on foes. * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[Category:Armor-ignoring damage]]
[[de:Strahl des Urteils]]

{{skill infobox | name = Reactor Blast Timer | id = 2903 | campaign = Core | type = Skill | special = Monster | recharge = 15 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. P.O.X. counts down from 5 before setting off a reactor blast. | concise description = Skill. P.O.X counts down from 5 before setting off a reactor blast. }} == Notes == *This skill is used by [[P.O.X.]]. *Similar to the skill [[Countdown]] used by [[N.O.X.]], this skill will prevent ''only the spell [[Reactor Blast]]'' (the equivalent of [[N.O.X.ion Buster]] used by N.O.X.) from being interrupted for its duration. The end of the skill's effect can be easily determined, as P.O.X. begins the countdown from 5 in speech bubbles above his head when it begins. When the speech bubble timer reaches 0, the skill's effect has ended and the spell can be interrupted through standard means (interrupt skills or hitting with an attack while he is [[Dazed]]).
[[de:Reaktor-Explosions-Timer]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Reactor Burst | id = 3379 | campaign = Core | special = G.O.L.E.M. | type = Spell | activation = {{3/4}} | energy = 10 | recharge = 10 | description = [[Spell]]. Overload your reactor, removing a [[condition]] from yourself and dealing 150 [[damage]] to all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. Foes struck by Reactor Burst are [[interrupt]]ed and [[Burning|set on fire]] for 3 seconds. | concise description = Spell. Removes a condition. Deals 150 damage to adjacent foes and sets them on fire (3 seconds). Interrupts struck foes. }}
==Acquisition == This skill is available while under the [[G.O.L.E.M. (disguise)|G.O.L.E.M. disguise]] during the [[April Fools' Day]] quest [[Annihilator 2: Searing Day]].

{{pveversion|Read the Wind}} {{Skill infobox | id = 2969 | name = Read the Wind (PvP) | campaign = Core | profession = Ranger | attribute = Marksmanship | type = Preparation | energy = 5 | recharge = 12 | activation = 2 | is-pvp = y | causes1 = Increased Projectile Speed | description = [[Preparation]]. For 24 seconds, your arrows move twice as fast. | concise description = Preparation. (24 seconds). Your arrows move twice as fast. }}
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Favorable Winds}}
== Notes == * This skill significantly reduces both the arc and flight time of arrows for all [[bow]] types and sets them equal to one another. Under Read the Wind, arrows fly at the same arc and speed regardless of the type of bow they are fired from.
* This skill does not change the modified arc or flight times from certain arc-changing bow attack skills, such as [[Broad Head Arrow]], [[Needling Shot]], [[Quick Shot]], etc. These skills ignore the effect of Read the Wind. [[Arcing Shot]], however, does have its arc significantly reduced.
* The arrow speed enhancing effect of this skill does not stack with Favorable Winds. Favorable Winds will still provide additional damage; however, the flight of the arrow remains the same as Read the Wind by itself.
==Trivia== * A [[Recurve Bow]] appears in the [[skill icon]].
[[Category:Essentially unlinked skills]]
[[de:Wind lesen (PvP)]]

revision.comment: /* Notes */ They don't seem to follow such a pattern. Source: Talk page and my own experience.
It's unlikely a skill trainer you can get to before a skill quest can unlock the skill. The trainer in Kaineng Center probably has this skill.

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 994 | name = Renewing Smash | campaign = Factions | profession = Warrior | attribute = Hammer Mastery | type = Hammer Attack | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 30 | causes1 = Energy Gain | causes2 = Recharge | description = [[Hammer Attack]]. If Renewing Smash hits, it deals +{{gr|10|40}} [[damage]]. If you hit a [[Knock down|knocked-down]] [[foe]], you gain 3 [[Energy]] and this [[attack]] [[Recharge time|recharges]] instantly. | concise description = Hammer Attack. Deals +{{gr|10|40}} damage. You gain 3 Energy and this attack recharges instantly if target foe was knocked down. | has-pvp = y }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Hammer Mastery]] |var1 name = + [[Damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 40}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
== Notes ==
* This skill works well with the four-second knock downs caused by [[Backbreaker]]. * Combined with a skill that improves [[attack speed]] by 33%, this attack can hit four times every three seconds (the length of a standard knock down with [[Stonefist Insignia]]). * Heroes will only use this skill on enemies that are knocked down. ** Heroes may occasionally queue this skill on enemies who are just about to recover from being knocked down, resulting in the skill undergoing full cooldown.
== Trivia == * The warrior in the [[skill icon]] appears to be wearing [[warrior Canthan armor|Canthan Armor]]. * The weapon in the icon appears to be a [[Spiked Club]].
[[de:Erneuernder Schlag]]

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 787 | name = Resilient Weapon | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Restoration Magic | type = Weapon Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 6 | causes1 = Health Regeneration | causes2 = Increased Armor Rating | description = [[Weapon Spell]]. For {{gr|3|12}} seconds, [[target]] [[ally]] has a Resilient Weapon. While suffering from a [[hex]] or [[condition]], that ally gains +{{gr|1|6}} [[Health regeneration]] and +24 [[Armor rating|armor]]. | concise description = Weapon Spell. ({{gr|3|12}} seconds.) +{{gr|1|6}} Health regeneration and +24 armor. {{gray|No effect unless target ally is hexed or has a condition.}} |target = allies}}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Restoration Magic]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 3 | var1 at15 = 12 | var2 name = [[Health regeneration]] | var2 at0 = 1 | var2 at15 = 6}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Condition Removal]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|"I Will Survive!"}} * {{skill icon|Conviction}} * {{skill icon|Melandru's Resilience}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Resilient Was Xiko}} * {{skill icon|Shield of Regeneration}} (elite)
== Notes == * The +24 armor rating will [[Damage reduction|reduce damage]] by ~34%; combines well with [[Ghost Forge Insignia]] for +15 armor rating to reduce damage by ~50%. * If [[Lightning Surge]] ends and is the last hex, the damage is still reduced. * [[Hero]]es will cast Resilient Weapon to overwrite non-defensive weapon spells when the target's [[health]] is at critical levels.
== Trivia == * This skill icon is very similar to the icon for [[Vital Weapon]]. * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Ritualist skill rewards]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 2120 | name = Respawn | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) | campaign = Core }}
==Notes== * Probably used to reattach [[AI]] into [[Resurrection|resurrected]] monster.

revision.text:
:''[[Image:disambig icon.png|19px]] This article is about the Monk skill. For the [[game mechanics|game mechanic]], see [[Resurrection]]. For the [[monster skill]]s, see [[Resurrect (monster skill)]] and [[Resurrect (Gargoyle)]]. {{Skill infobox | id = 305 | name = Resurrect | campaign = Core | profession = Monk | type = Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 5 | recharge = 8 | description = [[Spell]]. [[resurrection|Resurrect]] [[target]] [[party]] member. Target party member is returned to life with 25% [[Health]] and zero [[Energy]]. | concise description = Spell. Resurrects target party member (25% Health, 0 Energy). | target = dead party members }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[In Memory of Paulus]] ([[Old Ascalon]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Seeking a Cure]] ([[Kinya Province]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Primary Training]] ([[Churrhir Fields]]) ** [[Choose Your Secondary Profession (Nightfall quest)|Choose Your Secondary Profession]] (Churrhir Fields) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Prophecies ** [[Captain Osric]] ([[Yak's Bend]]) ** [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) '''[[Profession changer]]s''' * [[Core]] ** [[Profession Changer (NPC)|Profession Changer]] ([[Great Temple of Balthazar]]) * Factions ** [[Senji]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) * Nightfall ** [[Zuwarah]] ([[Command Post]])
== Notes == * Consider carefully whether to bring this skill. If it is used to resurrect a team member in the midst of battle, that member will have low health, requiring a follow-up heal. In addition, with no energy that member will likely not be able to join the battle quickly. In such situations, a non-reusable [[Resurrection Signet]] or a different resurrection skill is better. * Among all monk henchmen, currently only [[Taya]] has this skill.
[[Category:Resurrection skills]] [[Category:Monk skill rewards]] [[Category:Skills without known Nightfall trainers]] [[Category:Skills without known Factions trainers]]
