revision.text:
{{skill infobox | name = Reverse Polarity Fire Shield | campaign = Eye of the North | type = Spell | special = Monster | description = [[Spell]]. Living creatures standing within this shield have -50 armor against [[fire damage]]. | concise description = Spell. Living creatures in the shield have -50 armor against fire damage. }} == Notes == *This is a [[ward]]-like area that follows a [[Malfunctioning Shield Golem]] in [[Oola's Lab: Level 2]].
== Trivia == *May be a reference to the line spoken in [[w:Third_Doctor#.22Reverse_the_polarity.22|Doctor Who]] by Jon Pertwee: "Reverse the polarity of the neutron flow", which was Pertwee's way of dealing with the technobabble that he was required to speak as the Doctor.
[[Category:References to popular culture]]
[[de:Polaritäts-Feuerschild umkehren]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 422 | name = Revive Animal | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Ranger | attribute = Beast Mastery | type = Skill | energy = 5 | activation = 6 | recharge = 20 | target = self | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[resurrection|Resurrect]] all [[nearby]] allied [[animal companion]]s. They come back to life with {{gr|10|94}}% [[Health]]. | concise description = Skill. Resurrects all nearby allied pets ({{gr|10|94}}% Health). | aoe = nearby }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Beast Mastery]] | var1 name = % [[Health]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 94}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Marna]] ([[Ice Tooth Cave]]) * [[Firstwatch Sergio]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Comfort Animal}} * {{skill icon|Heal as One}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * The range for this skill is much shorter than the resurrection range of [[Comfort Animal]] and one must practically stand on the dead pet for it or others to revive making it unwieldy in battle. * The slow cast time also makes it easy to interrupt with possibly devastating results if multiple party members are relying on this skill to revive their dead pets. * As of the [[Feedback:Game_updates/20090806|August 6, 2009]] game update, [[Comfort Animal]] can be used instead of Charm Animal for your companion to travel with you in [[PvE]] areas. [[Heal as One]] was later updated with the [[Feedback:Game_updates/20100225|February 25, 2010]] game update to also have this functionality. These updates largely render Revive Animal suboptimal because of their ability to resurrect pets, mandatory bar placement for pet usage, cast time, recharge time, pet heal and range.
[[Category:Pet skills]] [[Category:Resurrection skills]]
[[de:Tier wiederbeleben]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 836 | name = Ride the Lightning | profession = Elementalist | attribute = Air Magic | type = Spell | campaign = Factions | has-pvp = y | elite = y | energy = 10 | recharge = 5 | activation = 1 | overcast = 5 | target = allies or foes | range = Casting | aoe = adjacent | causes1 = Lightning Damage | causes2 = Armor Penetration | causes3 = Blind | causes4 = Shadow Step | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. You [[shadow step|Ride the Lightning]] to [[target]]. All [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s are [[Blind]]ed for {{gr|1|5}} second[s]. If your target is a foe, it is struck for {{gr|10|70}} [[lightning damage]]. This spell has 25% [[armor penetration]]. | concise description = Elite Spell. Deals {{gr|10|70}} lightning damage. 25% armor penetration. Blinds all adjacent foes ({{gr|1|5}} second[s]). You instantly move to your target. May target allies. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Air Magic]] | var1 name = [[Lightning damage]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 70 | var2 name = [[Blind]] [[duration]] | var2 at0 = 1 | var2 at15 = 5 }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Factions]] ** [[Kunvie Firewing]] ([[Unwaking Waters (explorable area)]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Thraexis Thundermaw]] ([[Grothmar Wardowns]])
== Notes == * The blindness is applied to foes adjacent to the target rather than the user's initial location. * This skill is mechanically the same as a [[shadow step]]. * This skill is the fastest recharging shadow step skill that moves the user. * This skill (and its PvP version) is the only shadow step skill able to move the user to any target regardless of whether the target is a foe or ally.
== Trivia == *The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Ride the Lightning/Skill history|PvE skill history]] and [[Ride the Lightning (PvP)/Skill history|PvP skill history]] for details. * <!-- This reference has been confirmed by ArenaNet. -->This skill is a reference to the album and/or song by [[w:Ride_the_lightning|Metallica]]. The band chose that name to describe the [[w:electric chair|electric chair]], a method of execution wherein the condemned is strapped to a wooden chair and electrocuted.
[[Category:References to music]]
[[de:Den Blitz reiten]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Rise From Your Grave! | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | type = Spell | activation = 6 | description = [[Spell]]. [[Infantryman Hareh]] compels the dead to rise and do his bidding. | concise description = Spell. Infantryman Hareh compels the dead to rise and do his bidding.}}
==Notes== *This spell is used by Infantryman Hareh during the quest [[Raising an Army]]. *Each time he uses it, two level 18 (20) [[Undead Soldier]]s will be created.
==Trivia== *"Rise from your grave!" is a quote used in the classic arcade game [[w:Altered Beast|Altered Beast]].
[[de:Erhebt Euch aus Eurem Grab!]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Rocky Ground | id = 1383 | campaign = Nightfall | type = Environment effect}}
[[Rocky Ground]] is an [[environment effect]] strongly suspected to cause players to leave their [[Junundu]]s if they are currently in one. This effect also displays a message which inform the player that Junundus cannot travel through the rocky terrain. The Junundu will otherwise automatically release the character controlling it, as if the skill [[Leave Junundu]] was used. ==Notes== {{anomaly|[[Junundu Tunnel]] is not removed when walking on rocky ground, allowing players to benefit from the 66% speed boost for a moment.}}

{{Skill infobox | name = Rollerbeetle Blast | campaign = Core | type = Skill | special = Rollerbeetle | target = foes | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Target]] rollerbeetle is [[Knock down|knocked down]]. | concise description = Skill. Knocks-down target rollerbeetle. }} == Acquisition == Automatically equipped upon entry into the [[Rollerbeetle Racing (outpost)|Rollerbeetle Racing outpost]].
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Gale}}
==Notes== *The skill descriptions omit that this skill can only randomly be recharged by hitting a [[Power Up Box]].

{{Skill infobox | name = Rollerbeetle Dash | campaign = Core | type = Skill | special = Rollerbeetle | target = self | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 5 seconds, you [[Speed boost|move extremely fast]]. | concise description = Skill. (5 seconds.) You move extremely fast.}} == Acquisition == Automatically equipped upon entry into the [[Rollerbeetle Racing (outpost)|Rollerbeetle Racing outpost]].
==Notes== *The skill descriptions omit that this skill can only be recharged by passing through a [[Rollerbeetle Racing#Checkpoints|checkpoint]].
{{bug|If you encounter any change of speed after activating Rollerbeetle Dash — even by [[Ram]] or [[Water]] ending — you risk gaining no benefit for the remainder of the [[duration]].}}
[[de:Rollkäferrasen]]

Rollerbeetle Echo becomes the next skill you use (30 seconds).}}

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 811 | name = Run as One | campaign = Factions | profession = Ranger | attribute = Beast Mastery | type = Stance | energy = 5 | recharge = 15 | causes1 = Increased Movement Speed | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|5|15}} seconds, you and your [[pet]] run 25% faster. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|5|15}} seconds.) You and your pet move 25% faster. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Beast Mastery]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 5 | var1 at15 = 15}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Call of Haste}} * {{skill icon|Rampage as One}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * This skill can be used without [[Charm Animal]], [[Comfort Animal]] nor [[Heal as One]] equipped or when your [[animal companion]] is dead. {{speed|5|15|25|15}} * Animal companions already run faster than normal player speed so this may not be needed for the pet's benefit though it will still allow the pet to better catch a running target. * This skill will continue to be active for the pet even if the owner has activated another stance after it. * Consider using in combination with [[Feral Aggression]].
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Pet skills]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 3199 | name = Sacrifice Pawn | campaign = Prophecies | special = Monster | type = Skill | energy = 5 | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 10 | target = other allies | description = [[Skill]]. Drains the life of [[target]] [[ally]], killing them and [[heal]]ing the caster for an amount equal to that ally's current [[Health]]. | concise description = Skill. Kills target ally. Caster gains Health equal to that ally's current Health. }}
==Notes== *Used by [[Koril the Malignant]].
== Trivia == *The skill's name is a [[wikipedia:Sacrifice_(chess)|chess term]] used to denote giving up a lower echelon member for a strategic advantage.
[[de:Bauernopfer]]

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Selvetarm's Attack | id= 2530 | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description= Whenever any of [[Selvetarm]]'s allies are [[nearby]], Selvetarm takes no damage. }}
==Notes== *This skill is a passive monster skill, which means it is always active.

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 456 | name = Serpent's Quickness | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Ranger | attribute = Wilderness Survival | type = Stance | energy = 5 | recharge = 45 | causes1 = Decreased Recharge Time | description = [[Stance]]. For {{gr|15|30}} seconds, [[recharge time]]s for your [[skill]]s are reduced by 33%. Serpent's Quickness ends if your [[Health]] drops below 50%. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|15|30}} seconds.) Your skills recharge 33% faster. {{gray|Ends if your Health drops below 50%.}} }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Wilderness Survival]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 15 | var1 at15 = 30}}
== Game mechanics == * This skill works by reducing the base recharge times of any skills that finish activation ''while'' Serpent's Quickness is active. ** This include skills that begin activation sooner, as long as the stance is the first to complete the process. ** However, it does not affect itself or any stances that replace it. ** [[Interrupt]]ed skills use their base recharge time, since they fail to complete activation.
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[The Deserters]] ([[Beacon's Perch]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Firstwatch Sergio]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Mantra of Recovery}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Serpent's Quickness can be maintained indefinitely while the user is enchanted with [[Dwarven Stability]]: with a [[Deldrimor rank]] of 2, the user needs a Wilderness Survival rank of 12; if the Deldrimor rank is 5 or higher, only rank 8 Wilderness Survival is required. * Serpent's Quickness will not reduce its own recharge, since stances end before being reapplied.
== See also == * [[Recharge time#Skills that reduce recharge time|Skills that reduce recharge time]]
[[Category:Ranger skill rewards]]

{{redirect 2|"SWS"|Stone Summit tactics shield|[[Summit Warlord Shield]]}} __NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Seven Weapons Stance | campaign = Core | profession = Warrior | attribute = Strength | pve-only = y | type = Stance | elite = y | energy = 5 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Increased Attribute | causes2 = Increased Attack Speed | description = [[Elite]] [[Stance]]. For {{gr|3|20}} seconds, your weapon [[attribute]]s are increased by +{{gr|1|15}} and you [[Attack speed|attack 33% faster]]. {{gray|PvE Skill}} | concise description = Elite Stance. ({{gr|3|20}} seconds.) Weapon attributes are increased by +{{gr|1|15}}. You attack 33% faster. {{gray|PvE Skill}} | id = 3426 }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Strength]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 3 | var1 at15 = 20 | var2 name = + [[Attribute]]s | var2 at0 = 1 | var2 at15 = 15 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *[[Factions]] **[[Blade Ancient Syu-Shai]] ([[Raisu Palace]]) (requires a party member to be carrying a [[Proof of Triumph]])
==Notes== *This is a [[core]] skill, but [[Guild Wars Factions]] is required to obtain the skill. *This skill will increase all weapon attributes regardless of the secondary profession selected and display them in the attributes list while the effect is active. *Attributes are still capped at rank 20, see [[Attribute]] for more details.
== See also == * [[Weapon swap]] * [[Weapon set]]
==Trivia== *This skill uses the same icon as the ''[[Guild Wars 2]]'' [[gw2:Spellbreaker|Spellbreaker]] skill [[gw2:Imminent Threat|Imminent Threat]]. *There are seven different martial weapons in the game. *Added to the game with the [[Feedback:Game updates/20200422|22nd April 2020 update]] as part of the 15th [[Anniversary Celebration]].
[[Category:Core PvE-only Elite skills]] [[Category:Anniversary Celebration elite skills]]

revision.text: {{skill infobox | id = 1106 | name = Shield of Saint Viktor | type = Spell | campaign = Factions | special = Bundle | description = [[Spell]]. You are protected by the Shield of Saint Viktor. 80...1280 [[damage]] is absorbed. | concise description = Spell. You are protected by the Shield of Saint Viktor. 80...1280 damage is absorbed. }} {| style="margin:1em 0.25em; border:1px solid #6A3; border-collapse:collapse; text-align:center;" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" rules="all" ! colspan="13" style="background:#ADA;" | Progression |-style="background:#DFD;" ! Urn level |1||2||3||4||5 |- ! Absorption |80||160||240||480||1280 |} == Related skills == * {{Skill icon|Phase Shield}} * {{Skill icon|Urn of Saint Viktor (skill)}} == Notes == * Activated by dropping the [[Urn of Saint Viktor]] or by using the skill [[Celestial Summoning]]. * The amount of damage absorbed is divided equally among all [[ally|allies]] within its radius ''except for [[hero]]es'', [[minion]]s, and [[spirit]]s. The amounts will be rounded up. For example, ** A level 1 urn will shield the player and [[Danika]] from 40 damage each (total of 80). ** If [[Jamei]] is also in the affected area, each character will be shielded by 27 damage (instead of 26 or 26/27/27). [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs|Saint Viktor]]

== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Mazzim]] ([[Fishermen's Haven]]) * [[Tengsao]] ([[The Amnoon Oasis]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Brawling Headbutt}} * {{skill icon|Lightning Touch}} * {{skill icon|Shove}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Because this is not a spell, this will not count toward the 10-spell limit on [[Glyph of Elemental Power]], but will still get the stat boost. * Frequently used by melee characters, especially warrior and assassin, to meet the knocked-down target requirement of certain skills. The touch range is not an issue. **Warriors can extend the knockdown by 1 second using a [[Stonefist Insignia]]. **Warriors relying on [[Adrenaline]] will not mind the overcast toll. **The knockdown will occur at Air Magic 0. **Can be used while [[blinded]] or affected by [[anti-melee]] hexes such as [[Ineptitude]]. Additionally, it cannot be [[blocked]].
==Trivia== *This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Shock/Skill history|skill history]] for details.
[[Category:Touch skills]]
[[de:Schock]]

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | id = 1776 | name = Signet of Aggression | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Paragon | type = Signet | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | causes1 = Adrenaline Gain | description = [[Signet]]. If you are under the effects of a [[shout]] or [[chant]], you gain 2 strikes of [[adrenaline]]. | concise description = Signet. You gain 2 adrenaline if you are under the effects of a shout or chant. }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' *[[Primary Training]] ([[Churrhir Fields]]) *[[Choose Your Secondary Profession (Nightfall quest)|Choose Your Secondary Profession]] (Churrhir Fields) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]])
== Notes == * Is useful between battles to build and maintain adrenaline and start the next battle with all adrenaline skills charged.
[[Category:Paragon skill rewards]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 145 | name = Signet of Agony | campaign = Core | profession = Necromancer | attribute = Blood Magic | type = Signet | has-pvp = y | sacrifice = 10% | activation = {{3/4}} | recharge = 8 | aoe = nearby | target = untargeted | pbaoe = self | causes1 = Bleeding | description = [[Signet]]. You suffer from [[Bleeding]] for 25 seconds. All [[nearby]] [[foe]]s take {{gr|10|70}} [[damage]]. | concise description = Signet. Deals {{gr|10|70}} damage to foes near you. {{gray|You begin Bleeding (25 seconds).}} }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Blood Magic]] | var1 name = [[Damage]] | var1 at0 = 10 | var1 at15 = 70}}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill quest]]s''' *[[Prophecies]] **[[A Belated Betrothal]] ([[Seeker's Passage]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *Prophecies **[[Bartoch]] ([[Droknar's Forge]]) **[[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]]) *[[Factions]] **[[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) **[[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) *[[Nightfall]] **[[Zendeht]] ([[Gate of Torment]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *Prophecies **[[Kara Bloodtail]] ([[The Wilds]]) **[[Numa Plaguemane]] ([[Silverwood]]) **[[Cootle Sizzlehorn]] ([[Prophet's Path]]) *Nightfall **[[Najab Lifedrinker]] ([[Lahtenda Bog]]) **[[Shelboh the Ravenous]] ([[Jahai Bluffs]])
==Notes== *When used with [[Contagion]] and [[Dark Aura]], Dark Aura's damage will be triggered twice. *Can be followed with [[Unholy Feast]] to quickly recover the lost health and for additional [[AoE]] damage. *Consider bringing [[Plague Touch]] or [[Plague Sending]] to transfer the bleeding. *This skill is commonly used by [[Saccer]]s to force-trigger [[Death Nova]].
==Trivia== *This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|PvE]] and [[{{PAGENAME}} (PvP)/Skill history|PvP]] skill histories for details.
[[Category:Necromancer skill rewards]] [[Category:Point blank skills]]
[[de:Siegel der Qual]]

revision.text: {{Skill infobox | id = 3 | name = Signet of Capture | campaign = Core | type = Signet | pve-only = y | recharge = 2 | activation = 2 | causes1 = Skill Copying | description = [[Signet]]. Choose one [[skill]] from a nearby dead [[Boss]] of your [[profession]]. Signet of Capture is permanently replaced by that skill. If that skill was [[Elite skill|elite]], gain 250 [[Experience|XP]] for every [[level]] you have earned. | concise description = Signet. Choose one skill from a nearby dead Boss of your profession. Signet of Capture is permanently replaced by that skill. If that skill was elite, gain 250 XP for every level you have earned.}} {{quotation|[[Tablet of Wisdom]]|Some [[skill trainer]]s will offer a skill to you called Signet of Capture. This specialized skill can be used to capture skills from [[boss]]es. A boss is clearly identified by the glowing aura that surrounds them, and they are typically much more difficult than normal enemies and provide more and better loot. Once you have killed a boss, you can activate the Signet of Capture in your [[skill bar]]. A list of the skills that boss had will appear, and you will be allowed to pick one of these skills, unlocking it for your own use. If you choose not unlock {{sic|missing "to"}} any of the skills from that particular boss, you can simply retain your Signet of Capture for a later time. Keep in mind that you can only capture skills from a boss of the same primary or secondary profession as yourself.}} The [[Signet of Capture]] is a [[skill]] used to capture skills from dead [[boss]]es. == Acquisition == ; [[Skill quest]]s * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Malaquire's Test]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) * [[Factions]] ** [[Minister's Test]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Capturing the Signet of Capture]] ([[Marga Coast]]) ; [[Skill trainer]]s * [[Core]] ** [[Skill Trainer (NPC)|Skill Trainer]] (the [[guild hall]] skill trainer will sell this skill to any [[character]], even if he did not complete any of the quests above) * Prophecies ** Any from [[Lion's Arch]] onward * Factions ** Any on the [[Cantha]]n mainland * Nightfall ** Any from [[Yohlon Haven]] onward * [[Eye of the North]] ** Any skill trainer {{anomaly|The skill trainers in [[Lion's Arch]], [[Camp Rankor]], [[Vasburg Armory]], and [[Ascalon Settlement]] in [[North Kryta Province]] do not sell this skill. [[Tyrian]] ([[Prophecies]]) characters can purchase a Signet of Capture in Lion's Arch from [[Magi Malaquire]].}} == Capturing skills == The following steps allow a player to capture a skill using the Signet: # Obtain the signet and add it to the character's skill bar. # Kill [[list of elite skills by capture location|an appropriate boss]]. # Activate the signet (while in the boss' vicinity) # From the skill-pick window, select one of the available skills and press the ''capture'' button. # The Signet will be replaced with the new skill. # When you return to an outpost, you will have one less capture signet available in the skills panel. === Capture notes === * The skill-pick window will show skills from all bosses within range that belong to the character's primary [[profession]] and current secondary. It will not show two types of skills: ** Those from the other eight professions. ** [[Monster skill]]s * The capture button will be greyed out and prevent capturing two types of skills: ** Already known skills, i.e. you cannot re-capture a skill. ** Skills from [[campaign]]s not yet linked to the [[account]]. * Signets are typically used to capture [[elite skill]]s, but they can be used for other skills, too: ** Some ordinary skills can be obtained sooner via capturing than through a skill trainer; these are noted on the relevant skill's wiki article. ** It is cheaper and easier to obtain the [[Resurrection Signet]] via the relevant campaign quests. == Notes == * Each time a character learns a new elite, they gain another point of progress in the relevant [[Skill Hunter]] [[title]] track. * Unlike other skills, it is possible to obtain multiple copies of Signet of Capture. * This skill counts as a [[List of PvE-only skills|PvE skill]]: ** It cannot be equipped for [[PvP]] or by [[hero]]es. ** You can equip up to three copies of this signet on your skill bar. ** Although this allows you to have multiple elites after capturing, when you [[zone]], you will be left with only one elite. *** The game will drop any ''extra'' elites on the left side of the skill bar. *** You may rearrange your skills so that the skill you wish to keep is on the right before you zone. * This skill cannot be [[Echo]]ed, [[unlock]]ed, or learned by using a [[skill tome]]. * [[fleshy|Non-fleshy]] bosses leave a spot on the ground rather than a visible [[corpse]]. {{anomaly|Signet of Capture's actual [[range]] is larger than [[earshot]].}} === Dialogue (if no skills for your professions) === : No valid skills were found. You can only capture skills that correspond to your profession. == Trivia == * This skill was once intended to be called "Signet of Attainment". * Prior to the [[Game updates/20050608|June 8th, 2005 update]], this skill had to be activated at the same time the [[target]]ed boss activated the desired skill. * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Signet_of_Capture/Skill history|skill history]] for details. [[Category:Core PvE-only skills]]

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1239 | name = Signet of Spirits | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Channeling Magic | type = Signet | elite = y | has-pvp = y | activation = 1 | recharge = 30 | target = untargeted | causes1 = Spirit | description = [[Elite]] [[Signet]]. Create 3 level {{gr|1|12}} [[spirit]]s. These spirits deal {{gr|5|20}} [[damage]] with [[attack]]s and die after 60 seconds. | concise description = Elite Signet. Creates 3 level {{gr|1|12}} spirits (60 second lifespan). These spirits deal {{gr|5|20}} damage with attacks. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Channeling Magic]] | var1 name = Level | var1 at0 = 1 | var1 at15 = 12 | var2 name = [[Damage]] | var2 at0 = 5 | var2 at15 = 20 }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Wagg Spiritspeak]] ([[Ferndale]]) * [[Reisen the Phoenix]] (only during [[Raid on Kaineng Center]]) * [[Hamato]] ([[The Undercity (Winds of Change)]] (only during [[When Kappa Attack (Hard mode)]]))
== Notes == * This skill summons a [[Spirit of Anger]], a [[Spirit of Hate]] and a [[Spirit of Suffering]]. These spirits use the [[Pain (attack) (Signet of Spirits)|Pain attack skill]]. * This skill triggers effects of skills like [[Boon of Creation]], [[Spirit's Gift]] and [[Explosive Growth]] on all three spirits. * Combines with [[Feast of Souls]] for a cheap powerful party heal. * Combines well with [[Shaman's Insignia]] for +15 armor rating.
== Trivia == * During [[The Tengu Accords]], [[Master Togo]] summons the same three spirits with [[Call to the Spirit Realm]]. <!-- This trivia has been confirmed by Linsey Murdock. Do not remove it. --> * The three spirits are inspired by a quote from [[w:Yoda|Yoda]] in Star Wars: ''“Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering.”'' <ref name="Linsey confirms Yoda's influence">[http://wiki.guildwars.com/index.php?title=User_talk:Linsey_Murdock&diff=1620226&oldid=1620209 Linsey confirms Yoda's influence.]</ref> * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[Signet of Spirits/Skill history|PvE]] and [[Signet of Spirits (PvP)/Skill history|PvP]] skill revision history for details. * This is the only player-usable, non-[[ritual]] skill that creates spirits.
== References == <references/>
[[Category:References to films & tv series]]
[[de:Siegel der Geister]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Signet of Twilight | id = 1648 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Assassin | type = Signet | activation = 2 | recharge = 20 | removes1 = Enchantment | description = [[Signet]]. For each [[hex]] on [[target]] [[foe]], that foe loses one [[enchantment]]. | concise description = Signet. Removes one enchantment for each hex on target foe. | target = foes }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Pikin]] (Kamadan, Jewel of Istan)
== Notes == * [[Hero]]es will use this skill on any hexed foe regardless if they are enchanted or not.
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1623 | name = Skin of Stone | type = Skill | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Monster | special = Passive | description = Caster can only be harmed by [[Junundu Siege|wurm siege]]. | concise description = Caster can only be harmed by wurm siege. }}
== Notes ==
* This is likely to be a constantly active, invisible effect on [[Horde of Darkness (NPC)|Hordes of Darkness]] and the [[Solitary Colossus]]. * This skill only prevents direct [[damage]]; it has no effect on [[health degeneration]], [[life stealing]], or any other form of [[health loss]]. * In theory, the Hordes of Darkness could be lured off of the lethal sulfur. However, it is much more efficient to attack them while riding the wurms. * The only type of wurm siege in the area is the [[Junundu Siege]] available to characters riding Junundu.
[[de:Steinerne Haut]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Sloth Hunter's Shot | id = 2069 | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Ranger | attribute = Marksmanship | type = Bow Attack | energy = 10 | recharge = 8 | description = [[Bow Attack]]. If this attack hits, [[target]] [[foe]] takes +{{gr|10|25}} [[damage]]. If that foe is not using a [[skill]], Sloth Hunter's Shot does an additional +{{gr|10|35}} damage. | concise description = Bow Attack. Deals +{{gr|10|25}} damage. Deals +{{gr|10|35}} more damage if target foe is not using a skill. | has-pvp = y }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Marksmanship]] |var1 name = + [[Damage]] |var1 at0 = 10 |var1 at15 = 25 |var2 name = Additional damage |var2 at0 = 10 |var2 at15 = 35}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Micah Fergson]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) *[[Sida]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) *[[Ybbob]] ([[Rata Sum]])
== Related skills == *{{skill icon|Harrier's Toss}}<!--A moving target also meets the "not using a skill" damage trigger of Sloth Hunter's Shot, since a moving target can't use a skill with an activation time without stopping their movement.--> *{{skill icon|Melandru's Shot}} ([[Elite skill|elite]])<!--A moving or knocked down target also meets the "not using a skill" damage trigger of Sloth Hunter's Shot, since a moving or knocked down target can't use a skill with an activation time without stopping their movement nor while knocked down, respectively.-->
==Notes== * If you [[interrupt]] with this skill (while target is [[Dazed]] for example), the interrupt occurs first, then the bonus damage is applied, even if the target was using a skill. * Consider using along with [[shutdown]] methods, such as interrupts, to give yourself a window of time in which to hit.
==Trivia== * The figure in this [[skill icon]] is a female necromancer wearing [[Necromancer Cabal armor|Cabal armor]] and a [[blindfold]].
[[de:Schuss des Faultierjägers]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Smoke Trap | id = 1729 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Ranger | attribute = Wilderness Survival | type = Trap | elite = y | energy = 10 | recharge = 20 | activation = 2 | causes1 = Blind | causes2 = Dazed | description = [[Elite]] [[Trap]]. == Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Veldrunner Centaur (boss)]] ([[Kodonur Crossroads]]) * [[Uhiwi the Smoky]] ([[The Shattered Ravines]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Black Powder Mine}} *{{skill icon|Dust Trap}} *{{skill icon|Temple Strike}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== * Blind [[cover]]s dazed. * [[Veldrunner Centaur (boss)]] is an ally, but getting him killed by enemies during the [[Kodonur Crossroads]] mission can allow you to capture the skill very early in the game.
[[Category:Easily interrupted skills]]
[[de:Rauchfalle]]

{{skill infobox | name = Snaring Web | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | profession = Monster | type = Hex spell | energy = 5 | activation = 2 | recharge = 30 | description = [[Hex Spell]]. Projectile: target and nearby foes are Crippled and activate skills 100% slower (15 seconds.) }}
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Arcane Conundrum}} *{{monster skill icon|Corsair's Net}} *{{skill icon|Shared Burden}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *This skill is used by [[Bloodweaver]]s, [[Venomweaver]]s, [[Lifeweaver]]s, [[Painweaver]]s, and [[Carlotta]]. * [[Inspired Hex]] and [[Revealed Hex]] are particularly effective at removing this, since they will [[recharge]] instantly when used on monster skills. * Crippled is applied as a separate condition and has to be removed independently.
[[Category:Projectile spells]]
[[de:Fallennetz]]

{{skill infobox | name = Soulrending Shriek | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | type = Skill | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 15 | target = foes | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Target]] [[foe]] takes 40 [[damage]]. If target is [[Enchantment|enchanted]], that foe loses one enchantment and is [[Dazed]] for 8 seconds. | concise description = Skill. 40 damage. Removes one enchantment and inflicts Dazed condition (8 seconds) if target foe is enchanted. }}
==Notes== *Used by [[Bloodthirst Incubus]], [[Stormcloud Incubus]], [[Cryptwing Incubus]], and [[Bloodbath Incubus]]. *Being a skill and not a [[spell]], it can remove enchantments such as [[Shadow Form]], [[Spell Breaker]], and [[Vow of Silence]]. *The daze is applied before the damage is dealt, if applicable. Therefore, this skill will also interrupt anyone enchanted who is casting a spell.
==Trivia== *This skill was named ''Mystic Shriek'' during the [[Guild Wars Eye of the North Sneak Peek Weekend]].
[[de:Seelen zerreißender Schrei]]

{{skill infobox | name = Spear of Archemorus | image = [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (skill).jpg]] | type = Spell | campaign = Factions | special = Bundle | description = [[Spell]]. The [[Spear of Archemorus]] is powered by the souls of those dying within its radius. Dropping it will cause [[Archemorus]] to deal {{gr2|10|235}} [[damage]] to any [[foe|enemy]] within the spear's [[danger zone]]. | concise description = Spell. The Spear of Archemorus is powered by the souls of those dying within its radius. Dropping it will cause Archemorus to deal {{gr2|10|235}} damage to any enemy within the spear's danger zone. | id = 966, 967, 968, 969, 970 | aoe = nearby }} {| style="margin:1em 0.25em; border:1px solid #6A3; border-collapse:collapse; text-align:center;" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" rules="all" ! colspan="13" style="background:#ADA;" | Progression |-style="background:#DFD;" ! Spear level |1||2||3||4||5 || Supreme |- ! Damage |10||25||55||115||235 || 300 |- ! [[Skill icon]]s | [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (level 1).jpg|link=Spear of Archemorus (skill)]] | [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (level 2).jpg|link=Spear of Archemorus (skill)]] | [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (level 3).jpg|link=Spear of Archemorus (skill)]] | [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (level 4).jpg|link=Spear of Archemorus (skill)]] | [[Image:Spear of Archemorus (level 5).jpg|link=Spear of Archemorus (skill)]] | {{x}}
(see ''Notes'', below) |} == Related skills == * {{skill icon|Cruel Was Daoshen}} * {{skill icon|Destructive Was Glaive}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Dragon Empire Rage}} * {{skill icon|Grasping Was Kuurong}} (elite) == Notes == * The spear's danger zone is approximately [[nearby]] range. * Anything that dies within the zone will power the spear, including [[Ally|allies]], [[minion]]s, [[spirit]]s, foes, and resurrected foes. * The spear will gain power whether it is carried or on the ground. {{anomaly|This skill's sixth level deals 300 damage, causes [[knock down]] on foes it deals damage to, and changes the display name of the Spear of Archemorus to ''"Supreme Spear of Archemorus"''. This level does not have its own skill icon and the 300 damage will not appear in the skill description. Instead, the skill icon and description appear the same is if the spear was powered to level 5. If the spear is picked up when it is the Supreme Spear of Archemorus, this skill does not appear in the [[effects monitor]], but will deal the 300 damage and cause knock down. This level functions similar to [[Archemorus' Strike]].}} [[Category:Skills named after eponymous NPCs|Archemorus]]

revision.text:
{{Otheruses|the Monster skill|the temporarily available [[Bonus Mission Pack]] skill|Spectral Agony (Saul D'Alessio)}} __NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 546 | name = Spectral Agony | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Monster | special = Monster | type = Skill | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 15 | target = foes | description = Skill. For 5 seconds, [[target]] [[foe]] [[Snare (tactic)|moves]], [[Attack speed|attacks]], and [[Activation time|uses]] [[skill]]s up to 80% slower; suffers -{{gr2|1|30}} [[Health degeneration]]; and [[Health loss|loses]] {{gr2|3|81}} [[Health]] each second. | concise description = Skill. (5 seconds.) Target foe has -{{gr2|1|30}} Health degeneration; moves, attacks, and uses skills 80% slower; and loses {{gr2|3|81}} Health each second. }}
==Mechanics== This potent skill is the [[Mursaat]]'s greatest weapon, able to easily kill unprotected targets. Mursaat use this skill as often as its [[recharge time]] allows. *Infusion (see below) is the best way to reduce the [[effect]]s of Spectral Agony. *[[Jade construct]]s do not activate Spectral Agony directly. Instead, the effect is automatically applied whenever they deal [[damage]] to a target. *The health loss effect persists through [[resurrection]].
===Infusion=== {{main|Infusion}} The primary defense against Spectral Agony is infusion, which can be applied to any piece of [[armor]] by the [[Ancient Seer]] in various [[Prophecies]] missions and one explorable area. Each piece of infused armor reduces the impact of Spectral Agony.
:{| {{STDT|transparent|+=text-align: center;}} |- | '''Infused armor pieces''' || 0 || 1 || 2 || 3 || 4 || 5 |- | '''Health degeneration'''<sup>1</sup> || 30 || 13 || 9 || 7 || 5 || 3 |- | '''Health loss per second''' || 81 || 42 || 29 || 22 || 16 || 9 |- | '''Total health loss'''<sup>2</sup> || 505 || 310 || 235 || 180 || 130 || 75 |- | '''Slow effect''' || 80% || 33% || 23% || 18% || 12% || 7% |} #The game [[Effect stacking#Effect_caps|cap]]s health degeneration at -10; any degeneration beyond -10 hinders [[health regeneration]], but does not result in additional loss of health. #Both direct and degeneration.
{{bug|The skill does not actually cause [[health loss]] but [[Armor-ignoring]] [[damage]], and is therefore affected by damage modifiers and notably [[damage reduction]]: *Skills such as [[Spirit Bond]], [[Seed of Life]], and [[Protective Spirit]] are especially useful with [[party|party member]]s that are not infused.}}
==Notes== *[[Player]]s can use a form of [[Spectral Agony (Saul D'Alessio)|Spectral Agony]] by playing [[Saul D'Alessio]] during [[The Rise of the White Mantle]] (a mission in the [[Bonus Mission Pack]]).
[[de:Spektralqual]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1820 | name = Spirit Form | image = [[File:Spirit Form (Remains of Sahlahja).jpg]] | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | type = Enchantment Spell | description = Enchantment Spell. Your [[wurm]]'s body is consumed by powerful spiritual energy that enables you to do battle with maddened spirits and reduces the effectiveness of the maddened spirits' attacks by 75%. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. Powerful spiritual energy consumes your wurm's body and enables you to battle with maddened spirits and reduces the effectiveness of the maddened spirits' attacks by 75%. }}
==Notes== * This is applied to the player when a [[Greater Infestation]] is killed, in the [[Remains of Sahlahja]] [[challenge mission]]. It is required to harm [[Maddened Spirit]]s, and greatly reduces the effectiveness of their [[Maddened Strike]] [[Skill]] (from 700 damage to 175 damage). * This Enchantment lasts about 35 seconds.

{{Skill infobox | id = 1257 | name = Spirit Light Weapon | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Restoration Magic | type = Weapon Spell | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | target = allies | causes1 = Health Gain | description = [[Elite]] [[Weapon Spell]]. For 10 seconds, [[target]] [[ally]] [[Health gain|gains]] {{gr|1|15}} [[Health]] per second and an additional {{gr|1|15}} Health per second if that ally is within [[earshot]] of a [[spirit]]. | concise description = Elite Weapon Spell. (10 seconds.) Target ally gains {{gr|1|15}} Health each second. {{gr|1|15}} more healing per second while within earshot of a spirit. }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Restoration Magic]] | var1 name = [[Health gain]] per second | var1 at0 = 1 | var1 at15 = 15 | var2 name = Additional health gain
per second | var2 at0 = 1 | var2 at15 = 15}} == Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Factions]] ** [[Chkkr Brightclaw]] ([[Melandru's Hope]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Reesou the Wanderer]] ([[Alcazia Tangle]]) == Notes == * The health gain at 12 Restoration Magic equals a [[health regeneration]] of 6 [[pip]]s (12 pips within earshot of a spirit) and 8 pips at 16 Restoration Magic (16 pips within earshot of a spirit). * [[Hero]]es will cast Spirit Light Weapon to overwrite non-defensive weapon spells when the target's health is at critical levels. {{bug|Contrary to the concise description, this skill's conditional effect causes health gain and not [[healing]].}} == Trivia == * The [[skill icon]] resembles an axe affected by a [[weapon spell]] which has an ankh - the Egyptian symbol of life - on it. * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details. [[de:Geisterlichtwaffe]]

For {{gr|8|20}} seconds, whenever [[target]] [[foe]] [[attack]]s or uses a [[skill]], Spiteful Spirit deals {{gr|5|35}} [[shadow damage]] to that foe and all [[adjacent]] [[Ally|allies]] of that foe. | concise description = Elite Hex Spell. ({{gr|8|20}} seconds.) Deals {{gr|5|35}} damage to target and adjacent foes whenever this foe attacks or uses a skill. }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Curses]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 8 |var1 at15 = 20 |var2 name = [[Shadow damage]] |var2 at0 = 5 |var2 at15 = 35}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Sapph Blacktracker]] ([[Snake Dance]]) ** [[Nighh SpineChill]] ([[Talus Chute]]) ** [[Ceru Gloomrunner]] ([[Iron Mines of Moladune]]) ** [[Zaln the Jaded]] ([[D'Alessio Seaboard (explorable area)]]) * [[Eye of the North]] ** [[Harvest Soulreign]] ([[Against the Charr]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Backfire}} * {{skill icon|Empathy}} * {{skill icon|Insidious Parasite}} * {{skill icon|Pain Inverter}} * {{skill icon|Soul Leech}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Spoil Victor}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Visions of Regret}} (elite)
== Notes == * This skill is more powerful in [[hard mode]] as it benefits from the increased [[attack speed]] and decreased [[activation time]] of foes. ** In Normal Mode, you can use [[Reckless Haste]] to increase the foe's attack speed. * [[Arcane Echo]] can be used to help facilitate this strategy by duplicating the skill. {{hero|[[Hero]]es will only use this skill on attacking foes.}} * Capturing this skill from [[Harvest Soulreign]] in the mission [[Against the Charr]] is fairly difficult as a [[cinematic]] will start shortly after he is killed, and his corpse will be removed immediately afterwards. It is however possible to do so by killing [[Gordam Griefgiver]] first, starting activating Signet of Capture when Soulreign is nearly dead, and with quick reflexes capture Spiteful Spirit before the cinematic starts.
== See also == * [[SS necromancer]]
== Trivia == * The three original Prophecies bosses that this skill can be captured from are [[Nightmare]]s and one also seems to appear in the [[skill icon]].
[[de:Boshafter Geist]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 792 | name = Splinter Weapon | campaign = Factions | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Channeling Magic | type = Weapon Spell | has-pvp = y | aoe = adjacent | target = allies | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 5 | causes1 = Physical Damage | description = [[Weapon Spell]]. For 20 seconds, [[target]] [[ally]] has a Splinter Weapon. Target ally's next {{gr|1|5}} [[attack]][s] deal {{gr|5|50}} [[damage]] to up to 4 [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. | concise description = Weapon Spell. (20 seconds.) Attacks deal {{gr|5|50}} damage to 3 {{sic}} adjacent foes. {{gray|Ends after {{gr|1|5}} attack[s].}} }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Channeling Magic]] | maximum = 19 | var1 name = [[Attack]]s | var1 at0 = 1 | var1 at15 = 5 | var2 name = [[Damage]] | var2 at0 = 5 | var2 at15 = 50}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Masaharu]] ([[Seitung Harbor]]) * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Ziinyingmao Kaga]] ([[Dragon's Throat (outpost)|Dragon's Throat]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]])
== Related skills == *{{skill icon|Hundred Blades}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Ignite Arrows}} *{{skill icon|Mark of Pain}} *{{skill icon|Sand Shards}} *{{skill icon|Vow of Strength}} (elite)
== Notes == {{hero|Hero(es) ''will'' cast this skill on [[minion]]s and non-attacking allies. They ''do not'' cast it on allies that are carrying a [[bundle]], wielding a [[staff]] or [[wand]], or those not wielding any weapon. They ''will not'' cast it on [[animal companion]]s of your party.}} * Damage is only dealt to foes adjacent to the target, not to the target itself. * Splinter Weapon will trigger once for each attack when used with [[scythe]]s or [[Attack#Skills dealing multiple attacks|attack skills that can deal multiple attacks]]. * Damage from this skill is [[Armor-ignoring damage|armor-ignoring]]-[[physical damage]]: it benefits from [[Winnowing]] and triggers [[Mark of Pain]] and [[Barbs]]. However, it does not trigger the three [[Upgrade component|weapon modifications]] that depend on the [[weapon]] hitting the foe (i.e. [[Furious]], [[Vampiric]], and [[Zealous]] weapons hit the target, while the Splinter Weapon damage affects the adjacent foes).
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[de:Splitterwaffe]]

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1066 | name = Spoil Victor | campaign = Factions | profession = Necromancer | attribute = Blood Magic | type = Hex Spell | elite = y | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 10 | causes1 = Health Loss | description = [[Elite]] [[Hex Spell]]. For {{gr|3|15}} seconds, whenever [[target]] [[foe]] [[attack]]s or casts a [[spell]] on a [[creature]] with less [[Health]], that foe [[Health loss|loses]] {{gr|25|100}} Health. | concise description = Elite Hex Spell. ({{gr|3|15}} seconds.) Causes {{gr|25|100}} Health loss whenever target foe attacks or casts spells on a creature with less Health. | has-pvp=y }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Blood Magic]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 3 | var1 at15 = 15 | var2 name = [[Health loss]] | var2 at0 = 25 | var2 at15 = 100}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]] * [[Foalcrest Darkwish]] ([[Mourning Veil Falls]]) * [[Sourbeak Rotshell]] ([[Silent Surf]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Backfire}} * {{skill icon|Empathy}} * {{skill icon|Insidious Parasite}} * {{skill icon|Soul Leech}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Spiteful Spirit}} (elite)
== Notes == * More effective in [[hard mode]], where foes have higher health and attack rate and will thus trigger it more often. * This skill is highly potent against [[boss]]es, especially end-game bosses who have many times the health of a player character, assuming the boss attacks or casts targeted spells. * Spoil Victor or alternatively [[Spiteful Spirit]] can be used for [[Soloing|solo]] [[farming]]. ** Spoil Victor is especially effective for characters with low health, typically [[55hp]], as the character will almost always have low health and meet the requirement. * This skill will trigger when a healer casts a [[heal]]ing spell on an [[ally]] with less health; however, self-targeting a healing spell will not cause health loss. [[Resurrection|Resurrecting]] an ally with a spell will also trigger Spoil Victor.
== Trivia == * This skill's name seems to be a pun on the saying "to the victor go the spoils", which is derived from the "to the victor belong the spoils", a quote from 19th century US Senator [[w:William L. Marcy|William L. Marcy]]. * This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|PvE]] and [[{{PAGENAME}} (PvP)/Skill history|PvP]] skill histories for details.
[[de:Sieger plündern]]

(10 seconds.) Party-wide effect. Every successful attack summons a level 20 celestial attacker (maximum of 6). | aoe = party }}

== Notes == * The skill descriptions omit that this skill can only be recharged when gaining a [[Morale Boost]]. * Despite their appearance, Celestial Assassins are not [[minion]]s: they do not have inherent [[health degeneration]], do not turn [[Masterless minion|hostile]] when their master is killed, and [[Health regeneration#Automatic regeneration|regenerate health outside of combat]] like normal [[creature]]s. * Although Celestial Assassins do not follow the party, they continue to go attack foes that are [[aggro]]ed by a party member.

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Stun Grenade | special = Going Commando | campaign = Core | type = Spell | energy = 5 | recharge = 15 | activation = {{1/2}} | description = [[Spell]]. Deals 50 [[Blunt damage]] to [[target]] and [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. Target and foes [[in the area]] are [[Dazed]] for 5 seconds and [[Blind]]ed for 10 seconds. | concise description = Spell. Target and adjacent foes take 50 Blunt damage. Target and foes in the area are Dazed (5 seconds) and Blinded (10 seconds). | aoe = adjacent | target = foes }} [[Category:Skills with in the area AoE]]
== Acquisition == This skill is available while under the [[Going Commando]] disguise during the [[April Fools' Day]] quest [[Annihilator]].
== Related skills == *{{skill icon|Smoke Trap}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Temple Strike}} (elite)
== Notes == * Similar to [[shout]]s, characters will say ''"Stun grenade out!"'' when this skill is activated. {{anomaly|The descriptions omit that this is a [[projectile spell]].}}
[[Category:Projectile spells]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 537 | name = Stun Immunity | campaign = Core | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | special2 = Monster | causes1 = Knockdown Immunity | description = [[Monster]] cannot be [[knock down|stunned]]. | concise description = Monster cannot be stunned. }}
== Notes == * [[Earthbind]] is the only skill that bypasses this skill's effect. * Most foes that use [[Giant Stomp]] carry this [[passive]] skill, which prevents them from stunning each other. Similarly, their oversized allies also carry the skill and are unaffected by stomping. ** For example, all [[Jotun]] carry the skill and cannot be knocked down by the stomping of [[Jotun Skullsmasher]]s. ** In contrast, [[Stone Summit Herder]]s will knock down their dwarf-sized [[Stone Summit]] allies, who do not carry the skill. ** Notably, the [[Sadistic Giant|Sadistic]] and [[Nomad Giant]]s of [[the Desolation]] do not carry the skill; they can be knocked down like any other foe. Nevertheless, they do not knock each other down. * Many large foes, such as [[Wurm]]s, carry Stun Immunity, giving them the appearance of being too big to be knocked over. Other massive foes, e.g. [[Avalanche]]s, do not carry the skill and can be knocked down. * The fact that a foe is hard to knock down does not mean they carry this skill. For example, [[Dhuum]] and [[Shiro Tagachi|Shiro]] cannot be knocked down ordinarily, unless the duration of the KD is extended (e.g. via a [[Stonefist Insignia]]).<!-- * For a full list of foes that carry this skill, see [[:Category:Immune to knock down]] --><!--hidden until the category is fully populated.-->
== Trivia == * ''Stun'' is an internal name for [[knock down]].
[[de:Immunität gegen Betäubung]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 308 | name = Succor | campaign = Prophecies | profession = Monk | type = Enchantment Spell | upkeep = -1 | energy = 5 | activation = 1 | recharge = 10 | causes1 = Health Regeneration | causes2 = Energy Regeneration | causes3 = Energy Loss | description = [[Enchantment Spell]]. While you [[Upkeep|maintain]] this Enchantment, [[target]] other [[ally]] gains +1 [[Health regeneration|Health]] and +1 [[Energy regeneration]], but you lose 1 Energy each time that ally casts a [[Spell]]. | concise description = Enchantment Spell. +1 Health regeneration and +1 Energy regeneration. {{gray|Cannot self-target. You lose 1 Energy each time target ally casts a spell.}} | target = other allies }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Marna]] ([[Ice Tooth Cave]]) * [[Firstwatch Sergio]] ([[Lion's Arch]]) * [[Dakk]] ([[Ember Light Camp]])
==Notes== * Succor is a boon for Paragons, Rangers and Warriors, the three [[profession]]s with no spells, and the latter two with few non-[[elite]] options for energy management. * The Assassin and Dervish builds that are heavily invested into [[melee attack]]s (and not spells) also mutually benefit from Succor's energy gain, and its status as an enchantment (a conditional for many Dervish skills).
==See also== * [[Bonder]]
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[Category:Upkeep skills]]

revision.text: {{Skill infobox | id = 1444 | name = Summon Torment | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | type = Spell | recharge = 1 | activation = 5 | description = [[Spell]]. Any [[nearby]] rifts or altars become much more Tormented | concise description = Spell. Any nearby rifts or altars become much more Tormented. }} == Notes == *[[The Blasphemy]] uses this skill during the [[Grand Court of Sebelkeh]] mission. *This skill makes the capture point in which it is used to increase for about 1/4 of the bar for the team of the creature that uses it.

{{Skill infobox | name = Summoning Lord | id= 2350 | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | activation = 2 | recharge = 15 | type = Skill | description= [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For the next 30 seconds, all of your summoning spells take 1 second to cast instead of their normal casting time. }}

__NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 1191 | name = Sundering Attack | campaign = Factions | profession = Ranger | attribute = Marksmanship | type = Bow Attack | energy = 10 | recharge = 4 | activation = {{3/4}} | special = Duplicate | causes1 = Armor Penetration | description = [[Bow Attack]]. If Sundering Attack hits, you strike for +{{gr|5|25}} [[damage]] and this attack has 10% [[armor penetration]]. | concise description = Bow Attack. Deals +{{gr|5|25}} damage. 10% armor penetration. | has-pvp = y }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Marksmanship]] | var1 name = + [[Damage]] | var1 at0 = 5 | var1 at15 = 25}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Masaharu]] ([[Seitung Harbor]]) * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]]) * [[Akane]] ([[Senji's Corner]]) * [[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Penetrating Attack}} ([[duplicate skill]])
== Notes == * The arrow leaves the bow {{3/8}} seconds into this skill's activation, as [[attack skill]]s hit halfway through their stated [[activation time]].
== Trivia == * The female in the [[skill icon]] is wearing [[Ranger Luxon armor]].
[[de:Trennender Angriff]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1816 | name = Sunspear Rebirth Signet | campaign = Nightfall | type = Signet | special = Resurrection | pve-only = yes | activation = 3 | recharge = morale boost | attribute = Sunspear rank | target = dead party members | range = Casting | aoe = | causes1 = Shadow Step | requires = Morale Boost | description = [[Signet]]. [[Resurrection|Resurrect]] [[target]] [[death|dead]] [[party]] member [[shadow step|at your location]] with full [[Health]] and 10% [[Energy]] for each [[Sunspear rank]] you have attained. This signet can only be used once per mission unless [[Recharge time|recharged]] by a [[Morale Boost|morale boost]]. | concise description = Signet. Resurrect target dead ally {{sic}} at your location (full Health and 10% Energy for each Sunspear Rank attained). {{gray|This signet only recharges when you gain a morale boost.}} }}
==Acquisition== Received from [[Runduk]] in the [[Sunspear Great Hall]] after reaching a [[Sunspear rank]] of Sunspear Sergeant.
==Related skills== {{main|Resurrection|Shadow step|}} *{{Skill icon|Rebirth}} *{{skill icon|Resurrection Signet}} *{{skill icon|Unyielding Aura}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * With Sunspear rank 3 or above it will provide more energy than a [[Resurrection Signet]]. * Unlike other [[Sunspear skill]]s, this skill's effect scales linearly with Sunspear rank. * The concise description incorrectly mentions "[[ally]]" instead of "party member". There is no skill that can resurrect dead allies.

{{Skill infobox | name = Super Rollerbeetle | campaign = Core | type = Skill | special = Rollerbeetle | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 10 seconds, you [[Speed boost|move extremely fast]] and cannot be [[knock down|knocked down]]. | concise description = Skill. (10 seconds.) You move extremely fast and cannot be knocked-down. }} == Acquisition == Automatically equipped upon entry into the [[Rollerbeetle Racing (outpost)|Rollerbeetle Racing outpost]].
==Notes== *The skill descriptions omit that this skill can only randomly be recharged by hitting a [[Power Up Box]].
==Trivia== *This skill shares the same animation as [[Flame Djinn's Haste]].
[[de:Superrollkäfer]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Swap | id = 1653 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Assassin | type = Spell | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 10 | causes1 = Shadow Step | description= [[Spell]]. You and [[target]] [[summoned creature]] [[Shadow Step]] to each other's location. | concise description = Spell. You and target summoned creature Shadow Step to each other's locations. | target = summoned creatures }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Tohn]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) * [[Kenohir]] ([[Command Post]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Godaj]] ([[Lair of the Forgotten]])
== Notes == * This skill can be used to move spirits out of the way when confronting [[Duncan the Black]] in [[Slavers' Exile]]. * It can also be used to move clones and phantom copies of [[Reiko]] during [[The Final Confrontation]].
== Trivia == *The Assassins in the [[skill icon]] appear to be wearing [[Assassin Vabbian armor|Vabbian armor]].
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]] [[Category:Skills that target allies or foes]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 2495 | name = Sweeping Strikes | campaign = Core | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | special2 = Monster | description = This [[creature]]s {{sic}} [[attack]]s hit two additional [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. | concise description = Attacks hit 2 additional adjacent foes. | aoe = adjacent }}
== Notes == *Used by [[Mobrin, Lord of the Marsh]]. *This skill is a passive monster skill, which means it is always active.

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Symbolic Strike | id = 2195 | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Warrior | type = Melee Attack | adrenaline = 4 | description = [[Melee Attack]]. If this [[attack]] hits, you deal +12 [[damage]] for each [[signet]] you have equipped (maximum 70 damage). | concise description = Melee Attack. Deals +12 damage (maximum 70) for each signet you have equipped. }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Micah Fergson]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) *[[Sida]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) *[[Ybbob]] ([[Rata Sum]])
==Notes== * This skill exactly requires 80 units of adrenaline to be fully charged, so 3 strikes and 5 units.
==Trivia== *The warrior in the [[skill icon]] is wearing [[Warrior Charr Hide armor|Charr Hide armor]]. *This skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[{{PAGENAME}}/Skill history|skill history]] for details.

{{skill infobox | name = Target Acquisition | id = 2906 | campaign = Core | recharge = 8 | type = Hex Spell | special = Monster | description = [[Hex Spell]]. [[P.O.X.]] attempting {{sic}} to acquire target. After 5 seconds, this hex will end and the target will suffer from Dazed, Weakness, and Burning for 15 seconds. | concise description = Hex Spell. (5 seconds) P.O.X. attempting {{sic}} to acquire target. End effect: inflicts Dazed, Weakness, and Burning (15 seconds). }}


== Notes == * This skill is used by [[P.O.X.]] and features a blue and then red targeting reticule that can be seen on the player being targeted. == Trivia == * The figure in the icon is wearing armor similar to [[Ranger Elite Druid armor|Elite Druid armor]]. [[de:Zielerfassung]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Tear Gas | special = Going Commando | campaign = Core | type = Spell | energy = 10 | recharge = 20 | activation = {{1/2}} | description = [[Spell]]. Your Tear Gas explodes at [[target]] [[foe]]'s location, striking [[adjacent]] foes for 50 [[fire damage]] and creating a Smoke Screen for 10 seconds. Foes inside the Smoke Screen suffer from [[Poison]] for 10 seconds and cannot cast spells. | concise description = Spell. Deals 50 fire damage to target and adjacent foes. Creates a Smoke Screen (10 seconds) that applies poison (10 seconds) and prevents spellcasting. | aoe = adjacent | target = foes }} [[Category:Skills with in the area AoE]]
== Acquisition == This skill is available while under the [[Going Commando]] disguise during the [[April Fools' Day]] quest [[Annihilator]].
== Notes ==
* Similar to [[shout]]s, characters will say ''"Gas out!"'' when this skill is activated. * The smoke screen behaves similarly to a [[ward]].
{{anomaly|The descriptions omit that this is a [[projectile spell]].}}
[[Category:Projectile spells]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1342 | name = Tease | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Inspiration Magic | type = Spell | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 15 | target = foes | range = | aoe = in the area | causes1 = Interrupt | causes2 = Energy Stealing | description = [[Elite]] [[Spell]]. If [[target]] [[foe]] is using a [[skill]], that foe and other foes [[in the area]] are [[interrupt]]ed and you steal {{gr|0|5}} [[Energy]] from all foes in the area. | concise description = Elite Spell. Interrupts a skill. Interruption effect: also interrupts other foes in the area, and you steal {{gr|0|5}} Energy from all foes in the area. }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Inspiration Magic]] |var1 name = [[Energy]] stolen |var1 at0 = 0 |var1 at15 = 5}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Prophecies]] ** [[Justiciar Kimii]] ([[Riverside Province (explorable area)]]) * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Makdeh the Aggravating]] ([[Yatendi Canyons]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Cry of Frustration}} * {{skill icon|Cry of Pain}} * {{skill icon|Panic}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Steals energy from target and foes in the area even if interruption is prevented.
== Trivia == * The [[functionality]] of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.
[[de:Reizen]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 573 | name = Teleport Players | activation = 2 | type = Skill | description = Skill. [[Teleport]]s all players to caster's location. | concise description = Skill. Teleports all players to caster's location. | campaign = Core }}

{{Skill infobox | id = 2151 | name = Temporal Sheen | campaign = Eye of the North | type = Skill | profession = Monster | special = Passive | description = Monster is immune to [[damage]] from all sources except [[Flux Matrix|Flux Energy]]. | concise description = Monster is immune to damage from all sources except Flux Energy. }}
==Notes== *Used by [[Indestructible Golem]] and [[Malfunctioning Enduring Golem]]. *[[Life Draining]], [[life stealing]], and [[health loss]] are unaffected, since they are not damage. *[[Deep Wound]] can still reduce total health.

{{Skill infobox | name = Tengu's Mimicry | profession = monster | special = Monster | type = Shout | recharge = 30 | campaign = Eye of the North | causes3 = Skill Copying | description = [[Shout]]. This [[Tengu]] repeats any shout it hears. | concise description = Shout. This Tengu repeats any shout it hears. }}
== Notes == * This skill also mimics [[chant]]s. * [[Tengu's Gaze]] can only copy skills being used by the [[target]]. * Like any shout, can be countered with skills like [[Vocal Minority]] or [[Well of Silence]]. * Tengu can copy [[PvE-only skills]] with this effect.
== Trivia == This monster skill may be a reference to the mimicry of human speech, often associated with parrots and other intelligent birds.
[[de:Mimikry des Tengu]]

{{skill infobox | id = 1711 | name = The Apocrypha is changing to another form! | type = Skill | recharge = 10 | special = Monster | campaign = Nightfall | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. It cannot be harmed while in tablet form. }}
==Related Skills== *{{skill icon|Reform Carvings}}

{{Skill infobox | name = Thommis's Attack | id= 2531 | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Skill | description= All of Thommis's attacks cause [[Burning]] for 5 seconds. Whenever Thommis strikes a Burning foe, he gains 100 Health. }}
==Notes== *This skill is a passive monster skill, which means it is always active.

{{stub}} __NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Time Ward | campaign = Core | profession = Mesmer | attribute = Fast Casting | type = Ward Spell | pve-only = y | elite = y | energy = 10 | activation = 2 | recharge = 30 | causes1 = Decreased Activation Time | causes2 = Decreased Recharge Time | description = [[Elite]] [[Ward Spell]]. You create a Time Ward at your location. For ({{gr|3|15}}) seconds, non-spirit allies in this area cast [[spell]]s ({{gr|15|20}})% faster and [[recharge]] skills ({{gr|15|20}})% faster. {{gray|PvE Skill}} | concise description = Elite Ward Spell. ({{gr|3|15}} seconds.) Allies in this ward cast spells {{gr|15|20}}% faster and recharge skills {{gr|15|20}}% faster. {{gray|Allied spirits are not affected. PvE Skill}} | id = 3422 }} {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Fast Casting]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 3 |var1 at15 = 15 |var2 name = Faster Cast % |var2 at0 = 15 |var2 at15 = 20 |var3 name = Faster Recharge % |var3 at0 = 15 |var3 at15 = 20 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *[[Eye of the North]] **[[Fureyst Sharpsight]] ([[Sacnoth Valley]]) (requires a party member to be carrying a [[Proof of Triumph]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Ebon Battle Standard of Wisdom}} *{{skill icon|Over the Limit}} ([[elite]])
==Notes== *This is a [[core]] skill, but [[Guild Wars Eye of the North]] is required to obtain the skill. *At rank 17 [[Fast Casting]], Time Ward can be maintained constantly without the need for external recharge time modifiers. **At rank 14 Fast Casting, Time Ward is self sustaining provided the initial casting is affected by a reduced recharge time modifier of 15% or more.
* The AI cannot detect a ward's presence. Although remaining inside the ward would be favourable, even flagged NPC allies will leave the ward's area of effect whilst taking damage or targeting an enemy beyond their spell and attack range.
==Trivia== *Originally, this reduced recharge times to {{gr|15|20}}% of their initial values but this was corrected in a hot fix. *This skill uses the same icon as the ''[[Guild Wars 2]]'' [[gw2:Chronomancer|Chronomancer]] skill [[gw2:Rewinder|Rewinder]]. Its functionality is also similar to the Chronomancer [[gw2:well|well skills]]. *Added to the game with the [[Feedback:Game updates/20200422|22nd April 2020 update]] as part of the 15th [[Anniversary Celebration]].
[[Category:Skills that affect allies]] [[Category:Core PvE-only Elite skills]] [[Category:Anniversary Celebration elite skills]]

page.title: Titans get plus Health regen and set enemies on fire each time he is hit.

revision.text: {{otheruses|the [[skill]] used by [[Torment Claw]]s|the skill used by [[Smothering Tendrils]]|Torment Slash (Smothering Tendrils)}} {{Skill infobox | id = 1324 | name = Torment Slash | campaign = Nightfall | special = Monster | type = Skill | energy = 5 | aoe = linear | activation = 3.253¼ | recharge = 8 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. All [[Foe|enemies]] directly in front of you are struck for 150 [[slashing damage]], twice. | concise description = Skill. 150 damage to all foes in front of you. Hits twice. }} ==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Lightning Javelin}} *{{skill icon|Twin Moon Sweep}} ==Notes== * [[Torment Claw]]s use this skill. * This skill is nearly identical to [[Lightning Javelin]], as it creates several [[area of effect|areas of effect]] in a "straight line". [[de:Qualvoller Hieb (Monster-Fertigkeit)]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Trapper's Speed | id = 1475 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Ranger | attribute = Expertise | type = Stance | energy = 5 | recharge = 20 | causes1 = Decreased Recharge Time | causes2 = Decreased Activation Time | description= [[Stance]]. For {{gr|5|30}} seconds, your [[Trap]]s [[recharge]] 25% faster and activate 25% faster. This Stance ends if you successfully hit with an [[attack]]. | concise description = Stance. ({{gr|5|30}} seconds.) Your traps recharge 25% faster and activate 25% faster. {{gray|Ends if you hit with an attack.}} }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Expertise]] |var1 name = [[Duration]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 30}} ==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' *[[Medando]] ([[Yohlon Haven]]) *[[Zendeht]] ([[Gate of Torment]])
'''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Libeh]] ([[Command Post]])
==Related skills== *{{Skill icon|Serpent's Quickness}} *{{Skill icon|Trapper's Focus}} ([[elite]])
[[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Tripwire | id = 1476 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Ranger | attribute = Wilderness Survival | type = Trap | energy = 10 | activation = 2 | recharge = 30 | causes1 = Piercing Damage | causes2 = Knockdown | description = [[Trap]]. When Tripwire is triggered, all [[nearby]] [[foe]]s are struck for {{gr|5|20}} [[piercing damage]]. Any [[Crippled]] foes are [[Knock down|knocked down]]. Tripwire ends after 90 seconds. While activating this [[skill]], you are [[easily interrupted]]. | concise description = Trap. (90 seconds.) Deals {{gr|5|20}} piercing damage to nearby foes. Causes knock-down to Crippled foes. {{gray|Easily interrupted.}} | aoe = nearby }}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Wilderness Survival]] |var1 name = [[Piercing damage]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 20}}
==Acquisition== '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Dau]] ([[The Mouth of Torment]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Godaj]] ([[Lair of the Forgotten]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Spike Trap}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * If [[Barbed Trap]] (which inflicts cripple) and Tripwire are both placed in the same location, a foe setting both traps off at once will only ''sometimes'' be knocked down by Tripwire.
== Trivia == *The figure on the [[skill icon]] resembles a male [[Paragon]], wearing [[Elonian armor]].
[[Category:Easily interrupted skills]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1172 | name = Turtle Shell | campaign = Factions | profession = Monster | special = Passive | type = Stance | description = [[Stance]]. Reduces [[damage]] from non-[[critical hit]]s. | concise description = Stance. Reduces damage from non-critical hits. }}
== Notes == * Many [[Turtle]]s and [[Kappa]]s use this skill. * The [[damage reduction]] is equal to the creature's [[level]], e.g. all [[direct damage]] to level 23 [[Kappa]]s will be reduced by 23. ** The reduction takes place ''after'' taking into account reductions due to the turtle's [[armor rating]]. * The skill description does not include any [[activation time|activation]] or [[recharge time]]; it is possible that the skill recharges instantly, as turtles have been observed to re-enter the stance quickly. * Turtle Shell, like other stances, can be removed by [[Wild Blow]], [[Wild Strike]], or [[Wild Throw]] (each of which will deal full damage, since the stance is removed first). * [[Assassin]]s may use ranks in [[Critical Strikes]] to reduce the effect of this stance. * Repetitive, low damage attacks are ineffective, e.g. [[hammer]]s are better suited than [[sword]]s to counter the stance's effect.
== See also == * [[Exposed Underbelly]] * [[Critical hit#Comparison of combined effects|Critical hit — Comparison of combined effects]].
[[de:Schildkrötenpanzer]]

revision.comment: And here's a great example of ArenaNet's many inconsistencies.

revision.text:
{{skill infobox | name = Twisting Jaws | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | type = Touch skill | energy = 15 | recharge = 20 | activation = 1 | range = touch | causes1 = Life Stealing | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Creature]] [[Life stealing|steals]] 120 [[Health]] from [[target]] [[Touch skill|touched]] [[foe]]. That foe suffers from a [[Deep Wound]] and begins [[Bleeding]] for 10 seconds. | concise description = Touch Skill. Steals 120 Health; inflicts a Deep Wound and Bleeding (10 seconds). | target = foes }}
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Twisting Fangs}} * {{skill icon|Wounding Strike}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Most [[dinosaur]]s use this skill. While it has a long recharge, having a pack of four descend on an unprepared [[party]] could mean a [[wipe]], especially if they [[spike]] one target. * [["Can't Touch This!"]] is useful against this skill.
== Trivia == * The dinosaur in the [[skill icon]] is a [[Raptor]].
[[de:Schlangenkiefer]]

{{Skill infobox | id = 1017 | name = Undying | profession = Monster | special = Passive | special2 = Monster | type = Skill | description = (monster only) | concise description = (monster only) | campaign = Core }}
==Notes== *This [[skill]] is an always active, unseen [[buff]]. It cannot be prevented or [[disable]]d. *Relating to name, this buff probably prevents [[NPC]]'s from dying.

{{Skill infobox | id = 1876 | name = Unknown Junundu Ability | campaign = Nightfall | type = Skill | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = 2 | recharge = 8 | special = Junundu | description = [[Elite]] [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. You have not taught your [[junundu]] to perform this skill. | concise description = Elite Skill. You have not taught your junundu to perform this skill. }}
==Acquisition == This skill is available whenever your character is riding a [[Junundu]], from the [[Gate of Desolation]] [[mission]] until the point where [[Junundu Siege]] is available for use.
==Notes== * This skill shares recharge, activation, and energy cost with Junundu Siege. However, it cannot actually be activated. * After killing the [[Elder Siege Wurm]]s as part of the primary quest [[Horde of Darkness]], this skill will be replaced permanently with [[Junundu Siege]]. * This skill will not count toward the [[Skill Hunter]] title. * Mesmer foes in Desolation like [[Awakened Thought Leech]] may use their [[Signet of Humility]] to disable this skill without any advantage for themselves. It's not clear whether they mistakenly count this skill as harmful or simply use to disable any elite skill on their foes.
[[de:Unbekannte Junundu-Fertigkeit]]

{{skill-stub}} {{skill infobox |name = Unseen Aggression |type = Melee attack | profession = Monster | special = Monster |campaign = Eye of the North |description = [[Melee Attack]]. If this attack hits, it deals 225 [[damage]] and causes [[knock down]]. | concise description = Melee Attack. Deals 225 damage and causes knock-down. }}
==Notes== *This skill is used by the [[Nornbear]].
==Notes== * This skill actually deals 450 damage due to the boss double damage bonus.
[[de:Unsichtbare Aggression]]

{{skill infobox | name = Unstable Aura | campaign = Eye of the North | special = Monster | type = Skill | recharge = 30 | description = [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. For 30 seconds, if the golem is struck by [[elemental damage]], all of its [[attack]]s are converted to that [[damage type]]. | concise description = Skill. (30 seconds.) If the golem takes elemental damage, its attacks are converted to that damage type. }}
[[de:Instabile Aura]]

For 8 seconds, the next time [[target]] [[ally]] takes [[damage]] or [[life stealing|life steal]] from a [[foe]], that ally steals up to {{gr|15|60}} [[Health]] from that foe. | concise description = Weapon Spell. (8 seconds.) Steals {{gr|15|60}} Health from the next foe that deals damage or life steal to target ally. | target = allies }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Restoration Magic]] | var1 name = [[Life stealing]] | var1 at0 = 15 | var1 at15 = 60}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill quest]]s''' * [[Factions]] **[[Locate Professor Gai]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * Factions ** [[Ossian]] ([[Cavalon]]) ** [[Zytka]] ([[House zu Heltzer]]) ** [[Zenaida]] ([[Harvest Temple]]) '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Nightfall]] ** [[Captain Alsin]] ([[Barbarous Shore]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Life Sheath}} ([[elite]]) * {{skill icon|Reversal of Damage}} * {{skill icon|Reversal of Fortune}} * {{skill icon|Vengeful Was Khanhei}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Weapon of Remedy}} (elite) * {{skill icon|Xinrae's Weapon}} (elite)
== Notes == * Vengeful Weapon's life stealing occurs before the target ally takes the damage or life stealing. * If damage with no source, such as the [[Madness Dart]] in [[Jokanur Diggings]], is taken, the life stealing from Vengeful Weapon is dealt to the target ally. * When being attacked by [[minion]]s, the summoner receives this skill's life steal. If the [[Masterless minion|minion is masterless]], the life stealing will be dealt to the minion.
== Trivia == * The functionality of this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details.

Heals target ally for 100; the nearest foe takes 100 damage. }} == Notes == *This skill is used by [[G.O.L.E.M. 1.0]] and [[G.O.L.E.M. 2.0]] when in defense mode. *There does not appear to be a maximum range on the "nearest foe".

revision.text:
{{Skill infobox | name = Wastrel's Collapse | id = 1644 | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Assassin | type = Skill | energy = 5 | elite = y | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 20 | target = foes | causes1 = Shadow Step | causes2 = Knockdown | causes3 = Disable | description = [[Elite]] [[Skill (skill type)|Skill]]. [[Shadow Step]] to [[target]] [[foe]]. If target foe is not using a [[skill]], that foe is [[knocked down]]. All of your non-[[dagger]] [[attack skill]]s are [[disable]]d for 10 seconds. | concise description = Elite Skill. Shadow Step to target foe. Causes knock-down if target foe is not using a skill. {{gray|Disables your non-dagger attack skills (10 seconds).}} }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Jarimiya the Unmerciful]] ([[Vehtendi Valley]])
== Notes == * This skill has a {{3/4}} second [[aftercast delay]] despite not being a spell, in line with any shadow step skill that has an activation time. * Wastrel's Collapse disables all attack skills that are not [[dagger attack]] skills, rather than disabling ''all'' skills that are not dagger attack skills. [[Wild Throw]] functions similarly with an equally ambiguous description. * Heroes will use this skill indiscriminately on the foes which cannot be knocked down because of [[Stun Immunity]].
[[de:Verfall des Verschwenders]]
