{{Skill infobox | id = 987 | name = Way of the Empty Palm | campaign = Factions | profession = Assassin | attribute = Deadly Arts | type = Enchantment Spell | elite = y | energy = 5 | activation = {{1/4}} | recharge = 10 | target = | range = | aoe = | causes1 = Decreased Energy Cost | causes2 = | removes1 = | requires1 = Off-hand | requires2 - Dual attacks | description = [[Elite]] [[Enchantment Spell]]. For {{gr|5|20}} seconds, [[Off-Hand Attack|off-hand]] and [[dual attack]]s cost no [[Energy]]. | concise description = Elite Enchantment Spell. ({{gr|5|20}} seconds.) Your off-hand and dual attacks cost no Energy. }}
{{Skill progression | attribute = [[Deadly Arts]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 5 | var1 at15 = 20}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' * [[Ilidus of the Empty Palm]] ([[Boreas Seabed (explorable area)]], not during [[The Halcyon Job]]) * [[Senkai, Lord of the 1,000 Daggers Guild]] (Boreas Seabed (explorable area), only during The Halcyon Job)
== Notes == * Great synergy for [[Repeating Strike]] as the skill will not consume energy and can be easily spammed. *Skills that count as off-hand or dual attacks also benefit, such as [[Mantis Touch]].
== Trivia == * [[Xuekao, the Deceptive]] in [[Pongmei Valley]] used to have this elite skill, but it was switched out for [[Assassin's Promise]] in the [[Game updates/20060519|May 19, 2006 update]]. *The Japanese words for empty (kara) and palm (te) bring us the word "karate".
[[Category:Skills that interact with dual attacks]] [[Category:Skills that interact with off-hand attacks]]
[[de:Weg der leeren Handfläche]]

While holding a non-dagger weapon, you have +{{gr|3|33}}% chance to land a critical hit.}}
{{Skill progression |attribute = [[Critical Strikes]] |var1 name = Additional [[critical hit|crit]] chance% |var1 at0 = 3 |var1 at15 = 33}}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Micah Fergson]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' * [[Gedrel of Ascalon]] (Eye of the North) * [[Kodan]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) * [[Tyr the Skaald]] (Gunnar's Hold) * [[Lexx]] ([[Rata Sum]])
== Related skills == * {{Skill icon|Critical Eye}} * {{Skill icon|Way of the Assassin}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * This skill works well with skills that reap benefits from critical hits, such as [[Vicious Attack]], [["Find Their Weakness!" (PvP)]], [[Keen Arrow]] and [[Disrupting Accuracy]].
== Trivia == * The Assassin in the [[skill icon]] is wearing [[Assassin Elite Kurzick armor|Elite Kurzick]] armor.

__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | name = Weapons of Three Forges | campaign = Core | profession = Ritualist | attribute = Spawning Power | pve-only = y | type = Weapon Spell | elite = y | energy = 10 | activation = 2 | recharge = 15 | target = untargeted | aoe = earshot | description = [[Elite]] [[Weapon Spell]]. For {{gr|3|20}} seconds, each non-spirit [[ally]] in [[earshot]] gains the effect of a random [[Weapon Spell]]. {{gray|PvE Skill}} | concise description = Elite Weapon Spell. ({{gr|3|20}} seconds.) Allies in earshot gain the effect of a random Weapon Spell. {{gray|Allied spirits are not affected. PvE Skill}} | id = 3429 }} {{Skill progression | attribute = [[Spawning Power]] | var1 name = [[Duration]] | var1 at0 = 3 | var1 at15 = 20 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Signet of Capture]]''' *[[Factions]] **[[Blade Ancient Syu-Shai]] ([[Raisu Palace (explorable area)]]) (requires a party member to be carrying a [[Proof of Triumph]])
==Notes== *This is a [[core]] skill, but [[Guild Wars Factions]] is required to obtain the skill. *Since this skill does not target an ally, it will not remove conditions with [[Wielder's Remedy]]. *The created weapon spells are chosen randomly for each ally and cannot be a PvE-only weapon spell. *The created weapon spells will have the same duration as Weapons of Three Forges (factoring in the Spawning Power bonus) and their attributes all match the original caster's Spawning Power rank. **The created weapon spells will not list the correct duration in the effect window as a result.
==Trivia== *This skill uses an altered version of the skill icon [[gw2:Conjure Flame Axe|Conjure Flame Axe]], an [[gw2:elementalist|elementalist]]'s skill in ''[[Guild Wars 2]]'' that gives the user and an ally a conjured weapon to use. **The icon is the only one amongst all ritualist skill icons to have red and yellow colors. *''Triforge'' was the original name for the company now known as [[ArenaNet]]. *Added to the game with the [[Feedback:Game updates/20200422|22nd April 2020 update]] as part of the 15th [[Anniversary Celebration]].
[[Category:Skills that affect allies]] [[Category:Core PvE-only Elite skills]] [[Category:Anniversary Celebration elite skills]]

{{Skill infobox | name = Well of Ruin | id = 2236 | campaign = Eye of the North | profession = Necromancer | attribute = Curses | type = Well Spell | energy = 10 | activation = 1 | recharge = 20 | range = Casting | aoe = in the area | causes1 = Exploits Corpse | causes2 = Cracked Armor | description = [[Well spell|Well Spell]]. {{Skill progression |attribute = [[Curses]] |var1 name = [[Well spell]] [[duration]] |var1 at0 = 5 |var1 at15 = 30 |var2 name = [[Cracked Armor]] duration |var2 at0 = 5 |var2 at15 = 20 }} == Related skill == * {{skill icon|Ward of Weakness}} == Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Micah Fergson]] ([[Eye of the North (outpost)|Eye of the North]]) * [[Sida]] ([[Gunnar's Hold]]) * [[Ybbob]] ([[Rata Sum]])

{{otheruses|the Nightfall skill|the temporarily available [[Bonus Mission Pack]] skill|Whirlwind Attack (Turai Ossa)}} __NOTOC__ {{Skill infobox | id = 2107 | name = Whirlwind Attack | campaign = Nightfall | profession = Warrior | attribute = Sunspear rank | pve-only = y | type = Melee Attack | recharge = 1 | adrenaline = 6 | description = [[Melee Attack]]. [[Attack]] [[target]] and [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. Each attack that hits deals +{{gr2|13|20}} [[damage]]. | concise description = Melee Attack. Deals +{{gr2|13|20}} damage to target and adjacent foes. | aoe = adjacent | target = foes | pbaoe = self }} {{Skill progression max10 | title track = [[Sunspear rank]] | var1 name = + [[Damage]] | var1 at0 = 13 | var1 at10 = 20 }}
==Acquisition== '''[[Hero skill trainer]]s''' *[[Pikin]] ([[Kamadan, Jewel of Istan]]) *[[Shiloh]] ([[Sunspear Great Hall]]) *[[Libeh]] ([[Command Post]])
==Related skills== *{{skill icon|Crude Swing}} *{{skill icon|Cyclone Axe}} *{{skill icon|Eremite's Attack}} *{{skill icon|Triple Chop}} ([[elite]]) *{{skill icon|Judgment Strike}} (elite)
==Notes== * Whirlwind Attack is a single [[attack]] that can [[hit]] multiple foes. ** When wielding a scythe, each target will only be hit once. * The foes hit by this skill are those adjacent to the user, not the target. ** This attacks will fail to hit [[kiting]] opponents, including the target, if they have moved away by the time the attack would have connected. * The 1 second recharge prevents the skill from being easily [[spam]]med, since it will not benefit from the adrenaline it generates. **[[Echo]] can overcome this with six adjacent foes, three adjacent foes when under effects that double adrenaline gain from skills such as [["For Great Justice!"]].
==Trivia== [[Image:Whirlwind Attack historical.jpg|frame|right|The old icon]] * This skill once used another [[skill icon]] until [[Game_updates/20070717#Guild_Wars_Wiki_notes_2|July 17, 2007 update]]. * The damage inflicted by this skill has changed since its introduction; see its [[/Skill history|skill revision history]] for details. * Whirlwind Attack is a feat introduced in the 3rd edition of the popular pen and paper RPG, [[w:Dungeons and Dragons|Dungeons and Dragons]]. Its effects are similar to those of the skill's.
[[Category:Warrior PvE-only skills]] [[Category:Skills offered by hero skill trainers]]

revision.text:
__NOTOC__{{Skill infobox | id = 1137 | name = Yeti Smash | campaign = Factions | profession = Warrior | attribute = Hammer Mastery | type = Hammer Attack | adrenaline = 6 | causes1 = Knockdown | causes2 = Adrenaline Loss | description = [[Hammer Attack]]. Lose all [[adrenaline]]. [[Attack]] all [[adjacent]] [[foe]]s. If this attack strikes a foe suffering from a [[condition]], that foe is [[Knock down|knocked down]]. (50% [[fail]]ure chance with [[Hammer Mastery]] 4 or less.) | concise description = Hammer Attack. Attack all adjacent foes. Knocks down foes suffering from a condition. {{gray|You lose all adrenaline. 50% failure chance unless Hammer Mastery is 5 or more.}} | aoe = adjacent | target = foes | pbaoe = self }}
== Acquisition == '''[[Skill trainer]]s''' * [[Zhao Di]] ([[Shing Jea Monastery]]) * [[Michiko]] ([[Kaineng Center]])
== Related skills == * {{skill icon|Crude Swing}} * {{skill icon|Earth Shaker}} ([[elite]])
== Notes == * Unlike [[Earth Shaker]], which knocks down [[target]] foe and foes adjacent to the target, this attack hits foes adjacent to the user hence the attack can miss on kiting foes as with [[Cyclone Axe]] and [[Crude Swing]]. * Good synergy with [["You Are All Weaklings!"]] and [[Belly Smash]] (preceded by an [[elite]] knock-down, e.g. [[Earth Shaker]]). * Skills like [[Withering Aura]] inflict conditions before Yeti Smash hits. * In [[normal mode|normal]] and [[hard mode]], the [[AI]] will use this skill on a foe even if it is not adjacent to another foe nor suffering from a condition. <!--Tested with Koss in Isle of the Nameless and Jotun Skullsmasher-->
== Trivia == * [[Mountain Yeti]]s and [[Yeti (warrior)|Yetis]] are Warrior [[Yeti]]s in Factions that use Yeti Smash.
[[Category:Skills with a failure rate linked to an attribute]]

revision.comment: /* Related skills */ Heal Other is very similar in terms of healing, energy cost, cast time and recharge time.
